texts.es: William de 29 años, convive con alejandrina de 26 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijas, Jenifer de 3 años y Yazury de 3 meses de nacido. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. William es un hombre lleno de vida con un futuro muy prospero quien decidió emprender un negocio en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene 07 años en este negocio y considera que aún le es rentable, pues durante estos años ha logrado posicionar su tienda y ahora es muy concurrido por todas las personas que viven en la zona.  William con el crédito obtenido desea  ampliar su bodega, además abastecerse de variados productos. Sin embargo el no contar con movilidad para transportar los productos que comprar al por mayor y  trasladarlos hasta su bodega le resulta complicado, ya que el costo de transporte es muy caro. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo espera que lo apoyen con el desarrollo de su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, ampliará su bodega y abastecerse de productos.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old and lives with his partner, 26 year-old Alejandrina.  The couple have two daughters: 3 year-old Jenifer and 3 month-old Yazury.  They live together in a rental house in the village of Natividad, in Pichari district.

William is a man who is full of life and has a very prosperous future.  He decided to set up a business selling basic household products.  He has been in this business for seven years and considers it to be profitable.  Over the years, he has managed to position his store and now it is very popular with all the people who live in his area.  William would like to use his loan to expand his store and stock it with a variety of products.  However, he does not have a vehicle which he can use to transport the products that he buys wholesale to his store.  It is complicated and the transportation costs are very high.

This is William's second loan from MFP.  He hopes that you will support him in developing his business.  He will use the money he is requesting to expand his store and stock it with products.

loans.use: to expand his store and stock it with products

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es: Hugo Alberto de cuarenta años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una venta de sorbete artesanal que junto a su esposa preparan en su misma casa y posteriormente distribuye en  diferentes colegios y universidades, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan los jovenes estudiantes, exquisitos sabores naturales y a precios accesibles, de coco, tamarindo, arrayan, nance, entre otros, Hugo es muy servicial y atento con sus clientes. Es un hombre de trabajo que se levanta desde muy temprano a ganarse el pan de cada día,  él piensa que hay que disfrutar el trabajo que nos lleva al éxito por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de materias primas como hielo, azucar, jarabes y frutas, para producir mayor cantidad de helados, así crezca el negocio y siempre tenga lo que sus clientes demanden. Hugo Alberto tiene la confianza que esta es la mejor forma de llevar a su hogar estabilidad económica y una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo Alberto is forty years old and lives with his life partner and children in his own house.  He owns a business selling handmade sorbets that he and his wife prepare in their home to then distribute to different schools and universities.  He has a lot of customers because they prefer his product since he always has what the young students need, and exquisite natural flavors at reasonable prices.  He sells sorbets made from coconut, tamarind, myrtle, and nance, among others.  

Hugo is very service-oriented and attentive to his customers.  He is a worker that rises very early in order to be a breadwinner each day.  He believes that one must enjoy the work that brings us success.  This why he requests a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy a greater quantity of raw materials such as ice, sugar, syrups and fruits to make more of his ices.  This way, his business will grow and he’ll have what the customers demand.  

Hugo Alberto has confidence that this is the best way to bring financial stability to his home and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: buy ice, sugar, syrups and fruits.

loans.name: Masinambane Group

texts.en:
Thembisile is 53 years old and married with nine children between 22 and 32 years old. She also takes care of two relatives in her home in Mandini, South Africa. Over the last three years, she has been in business raising chickens and selling them from her home. She requested a loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase more chickens to increase her stock.

Over the next five years, Thembisile hopes to expand her stock to include general items like food and clothes. She says that the biggest problem her business faces is that her customers buy on credit and fail to repay her. She would like to thank Kiva and WDB for helping her a lot. The money she makes from her chickens will help to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 30 años, convive con Nelly de 25 años, con quien tiene 2 hijas. Juntos residen en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito de Sivia. Félix es una persona que se caracteriza por tener muchos proyectos, pero él asegura que debe realizarlo con mucha cautela, para llegar a cumplir su meta. Es por ello que empezó cultivando cacao, actividad que lo realiza con su esposa. A medida que sus ventas incrementaron, incursionó en la producción de cacao injertado, pues el desarrollo de este fruto es más grande de lo normal y crecen en un menor tiempo. Hasta el momento lo que ha producido no le basta, es por ello que espera ampliar su siembra de esta planta, pues aún tiene tierras que le falta sembrar. Además se siente tranquila por que sabe que una vez llegue la cosecha, su familia le dará su apoyo en la extracción de sus frutos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.500 soles que solicita, desea comprar más plantas de cacao.
texts.en: Félix is 30 years old and lives with his partner Nelly, 25 years old, with whom he has 2 daughters.  Together they live in their own house located in the Santa Rosa Alta community in the district of Sivia.  Félix is a person who has many projects, but he asserts that he has to undertake them with great caution in order to meet his goal.  This is why he started growing cacao, an activity that he carries out with his spouse.  As his sales grew, he moved into the production of grafted cacao, since this fruit grows larger than normal and grows in a shorter amount of time.  Up to this point, what he has grown has not been enough for him. That is why he hopes to increase the amount of this plant that he sows, since he still has fields that are not planted.  Also, he feels calm because he knows that once the harvest time comes, his family will help him to bring in the produce.  This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time.  With the 2,500 soles he is asking for, he would like to buy more cacao plants.

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La  señora María de Lourdes, es casada con el señor Abildai y tiene una hija a su responsabilidad de nombre tahalí de ocho años de edad.

    Ella se dedica a su  hogar y solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía ay surtir su negocio de abarrotes en donde lleva un año y comenta que le va bien ya que  con ello  tenido un mejor ingreso para sacar adelante a su familia.

    Lo que lo inspiro a esta actividad fue su familia ya que para mejorar sus ingresos tenía que tener un trabajo el cual le dejara una buena ganancia para sostener a su pequeña hija, así también apoyar a su esposo con el trabajo.

     Lo que más desea es que la sigan apoyando para que con el tiempo su  actividad sea más amplia con mercancía de mejor calidad, para así tener sus propios ahorros y apoyar a su hija con su educación.
texts.en:
María de Lourdes is married to Abildai and she is raising a daughter named Tahalí, who is eight years old.  

She is a homemaker who is asking for the loan to invest in buying merchandise to supply her small grocery store she has had for a year. She remarks that it has gone well for her since with it she has had more income to get her family ahead.

What inspired her to do this activity was her family, since to improve their income, she had to have a job which would get her good earnings to support her young daughter, as well well as support her husband in his job.  

What she wants the most is to keep having support so that in time her activity will be bigger with better quality merchandise so that she will have her own savings and be able to support her daughter in her education.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of merchandise to supply her small grocery store.

loans.name: J. Santana

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora J Santana le está haciendo falta la construcción de un cuarto al frente de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es  block, cemento, varilla y arena, para empezar a construir la recamara que será para su hijo, y así podrá tener su propio espacio en la casa. 
Doña J Santana planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, ya que su esposo el señor José se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una agencia, como guardia de seguridad. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
J. Santana needs a room to be built at the front of her house.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy material like cement blocks, cement, rods, and sand.  She needs these to start building a bedroom for her son.  That way he will have his own space in the house.

J. Santana plans to pay back the loan with the earnings she gets from selling beauty products by catalog.  

Her husband, José, takes care of the family expenses and school expenses with the salary he gets from working as a security guard for an agency.  They want to improve their family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to start building a room on the front of the house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a determined businessman who is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last three years, he has been operating a retail shop to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to buy a plot. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sweets, torches and biscuits. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy sweets, torches and biscuits

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesus

texts.es:
Mercedes, es madre soltera, vive junto con sus dos hijos de 19 y 25 años, su esposo murió hace seis meses, por el cual a ella le toca trabajar, se dedica a vender pollos y cerdos en el mercado de 4:00 am a 6:00 pm todos los días.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos y cerdos, para mejorar sus ventas, y generar más ingresos, para el sostén de su familia.
El sueño de Mercedes es que salgan adelante sus hijos en el estudio y que el futuro sean unos profesionales, y dar un apoyo económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a single mother who lives with her two children, ages 19 and 25. Her husband died six months ago, which is why she has to work. Mercedes sells chickens and pigs at the market from 4am to 6pm every day.

She needs a loan to buy chickens and pigs so that she can improve her sales and generate more income to sustain her family. Mercedes dreams of seeing her children move forward with their studies so that they can become professionals in the future and provide financial support for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Ruth Liliana

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos.
Ruth tiene una tienda de Bicicletas y repuestos, ella siempre tenía este negocio, claro que antes era poco, pero ahora aumentó su capital y ventas, esta feliz porque en su Banco Comunal le brindan la ayuda que necesita, las capacitaciones y el apoyo que ha recibido han hecho que ella pueda crecer en su tienda, le encanta el ahorro que gracias a ello se puede trazar metas a largo plazo. Con el préstamo comprará repuestos para las bicicletas, la meta que siempre se traza es poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Ruth is a member of the communal bank Tarpuy.  She is 30 and has two children.  Ruth runs a bicycle and repair parts shop which she has had for a long time.  Before she did not have a lot of business but now her sales and capital have increased.  She is pleased that the communal bank has given her the help she needs as well as training and support so she could expand her store.  She loves being able to save so she can establish long-term goals.  She plans to use the loan to buy repair parts for the bicycles.  He ongoing goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lily is 46 years old, widowed, and has four children. Lily owns and operates a business, providing clothing alteration and tailoring services to local community members.  She has been in this business for three years.  

Lily is requesting a loan for 2,700 WST, which she will use to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the profits from her business, estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Lily joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lily's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Khadidiatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 13 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge une partie de sa belle famille.

Elle s’active dans la vente de cacahouette. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité,qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de rembourser ses prets et d'épargner.
texts.en:
This cooperative group was created on May 28, 2001.  It is made up of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their primary activity is sales.

Mrs. Khadidiatou, at right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group leader.  She is 66 years old, married, and the mother of 13 children.  She is also responsible for some of her in-laws.  She sells peanuts and has several years of experience in the business.

This loan will allow Mrs. Khadidiatou to increase her capital and better develop her business.  The profits will allow her to repay her loans and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 54 years old, married and lives with her husband and her son who are both working.

Samira is an owner of a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing through.

She decided to apply for this loan of $1800 in order to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her store's inventory. She is aiming to gain more profits to allow her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her store's inventory.

loans.name: Webanania Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Webanania Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne is the facilitator of the Webanania group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Everlyne is a mother to two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest two bags of maize on half an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Webanania group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
46-year-old Imelda earns a living providing mobile prepaid credit and selling softdrinks. She has had this business for 10 years. Imelda earns 10000 PHP each month. She plans to use her loan to buy more mobile prepaid credit and soft drinks to sell.

Imelda works hard to support her family of a husband and a 3-year-old child. One of her goals is to save for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more mobile prepaid credit and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the tailoring industry for the last six years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He is 57 years old, married to Mary, and they have three children who are in secondary school.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more cloth fabric to make dresses.

The anticipated profits he will save and purchase a modern sewing machine. John hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy cloth fabric for making dresses.

loans.name: Las Limas Group

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es uno de los miembros del grupo las limas el cual esta integrado por 16 personas, este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido ya que a sus alrededores hay muchos arboles principalmente arboles de hule. 

Doña Gloria tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato y esta casada con don Juan que trabaja como jornalero, ella tiene tres hijos pero actualmente solo depende de ella el mas pequeño de nombre Alan Emilio el tiene 16 años y estudia la preparatoria. 

Doña Gloria es una señora muy trabajadora y alegre y platica que desde hace mas de 15 años con el apoyo de su esposo abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar con el propósito de ayudar un poco a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, con el pasar de los años su negocio ha ido creciendo y surtiéndose mas,ella dice que ella y su familia atienden su negocio abre todos los días de ocho de la mañana a nueve de la noche y siempre le gusta tener aunque sea un poquito de todo para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que necesitan y así animarlos a que vuelvan a comprar con ella.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Arroz, Frijol, Sopa, Aceite, cloro , jabon, dulces, papel higiénico,azucar, cafe, sal y refrescos   para resurtir su negocio y continuar con sus ventas.

Doña Gloria espera que con este crédito su negocio continué creciendo ya que desea poder a poyar a su hijo para que estudie una profesión.

los demas integrantes del grupo son: 

Abel venta de pan
Georgina venta de frescos
Maria venta de manualidades
Antelma venta de manualidades
Dulce Maria club nutricional 
Leonor venta de cosmeticos
Lidia venta de topper 
Maribel venta de pollo 
Jeny Damaris venta de catalago 
Nieves venta de reposteria
Nidia venta de zapatos 
Irene molino 
Martha cocina economica
Nayrobi panaderia 
Zulibet abarrotes
texts.en:
Doña Gloria is one of the members of the group "Las Limas," which consists of 16 people. This group is located in a community which is characterized by its warm climate, since there are many trees on its outskirts, principally rubber trees.

Doña Gloria is 49 years old. She studied up to the high school certificate level, and she is married to Don Juan, who works as a day-laborer. She has three children, but now only the youngest, Alan Emilio, depends on her. He is 16 and goes to preparatory school.

Doña Glora is a very hard-working, happy, and chatty woman who, more than 15 years ago, with the support of her husband, opened a little grocery store in her home with the idea of helping her husband a little with the household expenses. With the passage of time, her business has been growing and providing more. She says that she and her family tend to the business, which is open every day from eight in the morning until nine at night, and she always likes to have even just a bit of everything so that her customers always find what they need and thus are encouraged to come back to buy from her.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, soup, oil, bleach, soap, sweets, toilet paper, sugar, coffee, salt, and soft drinks to restock her business and continue with her sales.

Doña Gloria hopes that with this loan her business will continue growing, since she wants to support her son so that he can study for a career.

The other members of the group are: Abel, who sells bread; Georgina, who sells beverages; Maria, who sells handicrafts; Antelma, who sells handicrafts; Dulce Maria, who has a nutritional club; Leonor, who sells cosmetics; Lidia, who sells tupperware; Maribel, who sells chicken; Jeny Damaris, who does catalog sales; Nieves, who sells confectionery; Nidia, who sells shoes; Irene, who has a mill; Martha, who has a home-style restaurant; Nayrobi, who has a bakery; and Zulibet, who sells groceries.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soup, bleach, soap, sweets, toilet paper, sugar, coffee, salt, and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia extracts palm oil for sale at Efutu. She has been doing this for the past 10 years now.  Her husband also extracts oil for sale.  They have 4 children. Cecilia assists her husband in paying utility bills.  She needs this loan to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale.  With the new profits, Cecilia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale.

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
Jairo, de 34 años, originario de Telpaneca municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene tres hijos de 12,10 y 4 años de edad, de oficio comerciante , el vende monturas para caballo. Inicio sus actividades con capital propio que tenia ahorrado de su trabajo anterior donde elaboraba monturas para caballos en el taller de su tío pero el soñaba con un día tener su propio negocio y con la experiencia adquirida salir delante de forma independiente para sacar adelante a su familia. 
El realizo el crédito compra de materia prima tales como baquetas, clavos, cuero y pago de mano de obra para elaborar monturas. Esto le ayudara a la fabricación de un mayor números de monturas y poderlas vender por cantidad al por mayor. El tiene como meta agrandar su negocio darse a conocer fuera de Estelí para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Le gustaría hacer mejoras a su casa ya que actualmente donde vive la casa es de tabla y cuando llueve se moja todo.
texts.en:
34-year-old Jairo is from Telpaneca, Estelí.  He is married and has three children who are 12, 10 and 4 years old.  He is a salesman by trade and sells horse saddles.  He started his business with his own capital which he saved up from his previous job making horse saddles in his uncle's workshop.  He dreamed of one day owning his own business and used the experience he had gained to move ahead independently in order to provide for his family.

Jairo will use this loan to buy raw materials such as rods, nails and leather.  He will also pay people to make saddles.  This will help him to make more saddles and he will be able to sell them in bulk, wholesale.  Jairo's goal is to expand his business and to become known outside of Estelí, so that he can provide his family with a better standard of living.  He would like to make some improvements to his home as the house in which he currently lives is made from wood and, when it rains, everything gets wet.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as rods, nails and leather, and to pay people to make saddles

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a farmer, which she has been doing for seven years, producing and selling milk, eggs, and maize to the local market in her hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya.

Beatrice is requesting a loan for 102,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to expand her farming business in two areas: dairy and poultry farming. She will use 52,000 KES  to buy and insure a dairy cow and the rest to expand her poultry business by buying more birds. 

Beatrice states that her seven years of experience in farming has proved to her that someone can rely on farming for her family upkeep. Her major challenge in farming remains the rampant animal diseases but she is optimistic that she will be owning five dairy cows in five years.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zagnanabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, WAWA personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Eduardo Moises

texts.es:
Eduardo con 37 años de edad, de estado civil separado, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 16 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Eduardo es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con aval.

loans.use: lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah has been a good member of Mercury Mothers Women Group since 2002. She is hard working and utilizes every opportunity to her disposal. She has managed to educate her children and bought 2 dairy cows. She grows and sells vegetables, beans and maize. Her sales per month total $100 but in a dry season it falls down because of limited water to irrigate the crops. This is why she wants to buy a water tank in order to store enough water. After buying a water tank, her income inflow will remain positive and growth will be realized.

loans.use: She wants to buy a water tank to store water for irrigation in a dry season.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region. He relocated to Sumgayit city with his wife and one child. He has owned his butcher shop for the past seven years. Isa is applying for a loan to increase the amount of goods at his shop as well as to purchase new scales.

loans.use: To increase the amount of goods and buy scales

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga is a married mother of four. Her husband is an experienced designer and painter. He designs T-shirts and wraparounds sold at local stores that attract tourists, and she runs the business.

loans.use: Purchase of brushes, paints, and materials wholesale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 40 and has 4 sons aged 5 to 14. Her main business is raising ducks. She buys eggs and breeds the ducks at her house. With the help of TYM she has been able to increase her flock to 1,000 ducks. Now she wants to buy an incubator to breed more and under stable conditions. She also needs to buy vaccines, since her home province Nghe An was hit by the bird flu.

loans.use: buy an incubator for raising ducks

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José Raúl (in the center of the photo) is originally from a place called Creel in the state of Chihuahua. He is married and has three small children. His wife is a nurse and works in a town near Creel. To take care of his little ones and obtain the resources the family needs, José started his carpentry workshop next to his house. Fortunately, the good work he does has helped him increase his sales and now, in order to fill all the orders, he uses the help of two employees.

In order to imoprove the quality of his service and to offer more detailed work José needs tools, for which he is requesting a loan for $475, which he promises to repay in 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help this family. They thank you very much for your generosity and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

José Raúl (al centro de la foto) es originario de la localidad de Creel en el estado de Chihuahua, está casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos, su esposa es enfermera y trabaja en un pueblo cerca de Creel, para estar al cuidado de sus pequeños y obtener los recursos que necesita su familia José inició su taller de carpintería al lado de casa. Afortunadamente el buen trabajo que realiza le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas y para cubrir sus pedidos ahora cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleados.

Para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y brindar trabajos más detallados José necesita de herramienta, para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Oger

texts.en:
Oger is a butcher in Marcory, which is south of Abidjan. He is 34 years old and has been running his butcher business for more than 8 years. He has a slaughterhouse and a butcher table where he resells meat in the market.

Oger wants to purchase some cows for the end of year period when the demand for protein and meat is very high for Christmas, New Year's, and AId el Kebir. He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,050.

Oger is dynamic and honest. He works very hard and he has been a very good performer in AE&I's microcredit program.

loans.use: Oger wants to purchase cows

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen B.. I want to have a loan for my husband who is a rickshaw driver.  He will use this loan to pay all the remaining installments of his rickshaw . This way he will no more have to pay heavy interest rate to the moneylender, if he manages to pay him upfront.
 I am a textile designer and I make designs on ladies shirts with sequins and other ornaments. Moreover, I am a mother of seven, five of whom attend a local school whereas the other two will be enrolled in school in a near future.Our economic conditions are not very good and we need to earn a better living for ourself.

loans.use: Pay for the installments of the rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his milk selling business

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Venancia Justin. She is married with three children, ages 8, 12, and 13. In 2001 Venancia established an African clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of African clothing.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat M. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, is married with 5 children and has a high school diploma. Muhabbat has an agricultural business. She owns a piece of land where she plants wheat. She wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоева Мухаббат Умбаровна проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 51 год. Замужем имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее.Домохозяйка, занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли, который засеивает пшеницей. Планирует получить кредит для покупки семян пшеницы и удобрений. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seedsa and fertilizer

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo is 27 years old, single and earns a living as a jeweler and merchant. He completed his High School education at a public school in his native city of Luque.

Alejo used to work in his parent's butcher shop where he used to deliver the customer's orders. Currently he has a small workshop in his house, where he makes different types of gold and silver jewelery such as bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc.

In the future, Alejo would like to obtain a college degree and open a large jewelery store in his city's downtown area, since he has great skills and has several clients that order pieces every month which they resale.

The loan will be used to purchase materials such as pure silver, copper, wire and a few tools he is in need of.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Alejo es soltero tiene 27 años es de profesión joyero y comerciante; culmino sus estudios secundarios en un colegio nacional de su ciudad natal, Luque.

Alejo trabajaba con sus padres en la carnicería que poseían, en donde el realizaba los repartos de pedidos de clientes. Actualmente cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa, en donde reliza todo tipo de joyas en plata y oro, como brazaletes, collares, anillos, etc.

En el futuro le gustaría seguir una carrera universitaria y montar una joyería grande en el centro de la ciudad, ya que posee muy buenas técnicas de trabajos y varios clientes que mensualmente le solicitan joyas para vender.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales tales como plata pura, cobre, alambre y algunas herramientas que necesitaba.

loans.use: Purchase precious metal such as silver, gold and a few tools.

loans.name: Nora Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is married. Her husband works in transport and her children are now grown and no longer live with her. Even so, she wanted to embark on a project that would allow her to generate more income to help her husband with the household expenses. Three years ago she started selling jewelry from a catalog. At first she sold to relatives and friends; over time her clientele has grown and she has achieved good sales.

Nelly is currently requesting a loan for $575, which she will repay in 6 months and will invest in the purchase of merchandise to sell. With your help Nelly will continue her progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly esta casada su esposo trabaja como transportista y sus hijos ya son mayores y ya no viven con ellos, aun así ella deseaba emprender alguna actividad que le permitiera generar mas ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Inicio hace 3 años con la venta de joyería por catalogo, vendiéndole a sus familiares y amigos, con el tiempo su cartera de clientes se ha incrementado y ha logrado buenas ventas.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Nelly seguirá con su negocio

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia E. is forty-two years old. She is married and has two sons and three daughters who are currently in school. Anastasia owns and operates a grocery store, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She enjoys running her own business and is motivated to work hard, because she dreams of a better future for her children. However, Anastasia is constrained by insufficient capital. She is therefore requesting a loan to be able to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, and other items to increase her sales and income. Anastasia is a member of a community group called Nyame kye Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Abilio Guillermo

texts.es:
Mr. Abilio B. is a 54-year-old married father of a 2-year-old-son. Mr. B.’ wife looks after their son and the house. He and his family live in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua.

Mr. B. has been working as a driver for ten years. He needs this loan for home improvements such as building a cement wall that used to be made of wood.

He plans to finish building his cement house in order to provide his young son with more safety.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Abilio tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Hialeah, tiene un niño de 2 años de edad, su esposa es quien se encarga de cuidar la casa y el niño.

Don Abilio trabaja como conductor y lleva diez año laborando en esta profesión. El préstamo lo requiere para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, como es la construcción de una pared de concreto que anteriormente era de madera.

Sus planes es terminar de construir su casa de concreto, para darle mayor seguridad a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Build cement wall

loans.name: Tarangire Group

texts.en:
Hamida, 37 years old, is a mother of three girls. They are 12, 9, and 7. She is widowed and raises the children on her own. She runs a clothing store called 'Babiki' in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She has operated the business since 2003 and works from 9am to 4pm daily. She earns about $120 a month. With this loan from Kiva, Hamida hopes to renovate her business. By adding a new frame and supporting structure she will be able to increase the size of her business and add more inventory. She has taken out three loans from Tujijenge previously and successfully paid back all of them.

Hamida is the group leader of the Tarangire group. Along with five other members, who operate in the clothing, charcoal, and food sector, she will share this loan. The group members take out the loan together, and guarantee each other's payments. Therefore, the repayment of the loan is guaranteed.

loans.use: To renovate the business and add a new frame to her shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives on Ave. José Antonio Chambilla in the Neighborhood Alianza Mazocruz. She is 33 years old and she studied until the fourth year of secondary school. She is now married and a mother of three children.

She is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez in the District of Santa Rosa of the Province of Collao, Region Puno. With the first loan, she bought ingredients to prepare foods, and little by little she went increasing her capital. Changing businesses two years ago, she is now dedicated to selling appliances like: radios, recorders, televisions, DVD, and spare parts.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy three TVs with DVDs, two normal DVD players, converters, and spare parts for appliances.

Doña Maria always works with the support of her husband. Her dream is to make her business grow and sell in other markets like Capazo, Huaytiri, and others. She always liked doing business; she began doing sales when she was eight years old.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria vive en la Av. José Antonio Chambilla s/n Barrio Alianza Mazocruz. ella tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto año de secundaria es casada y madre de tres hijos.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez del Distrito de Santa Rosa de la Provincia del Collao, Región Puno, con el primer préstamo compró víveres para seguir preparando viandas ( comida ), poco a poco fue aumentando su capital cambiando de negocio hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de artefactos como : radios, grabadoras, televisores, DVD y repuestos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 03 DVD con pantalla, 02 DVD normales, conversores, repuestos para artefactos.

Doña Maria siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Su sueño es hacer crecer más su negocio y vender en otras ferias como Capazo, Huaytiri y otros, siempre le gustó hacer negocio, ella empezó a vender desde la edad de ocho años.

loans.use: Buy DVD systems, converters, and spare parts for appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials and products for her small beauty salon.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 52 años, un padre muy responsable, mas aún, cuando la madre de sus hijos los abandonó, desde entonces  su mayor anhelo es darles una buena educación a ellos.   En horas de la mañana, todos días prepara los alimentos de sus hijos, y luego se va a trabajar  a su chacra hasta horas de la noche.  Desde muy niño se dedicó al campo, le gusta la actividad que realiza, pero lo que le falta son herramientas adecuadas para sus cultivos, aun así ha sembrado maíz con dificultades.   Alfredo se desvela por la educación de sus hijos desde hace tres años, ellos son el motivo de su trabajo y esfuerzo.  Desea adquirir herramientas de trabajo para la chacra, que le permitan limpiar de su chacra, de ese modo agrandar sus tierras para ser mejor aprovechadas.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 52, is an exceptionally responsible father. When the mother of his children abandoned them, he decided that he would provide the children with the best possible education. In the early hours of each day, he fixes meals for the children and then sets out to work his land, working until nightfall. He's been farming since he was a small boy, work that he likes. He needs better tools to cultivate his land, though, because he can only plant maize now with difficulty. Alfredo worries day and night about his children's education; they're the reason for his sweat and toil. He wants to buy work tools for the farm so that he can clear it. By clearing it, he can expand his land and better provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for farming business.

loans.name: Mrs. Nhy Sorung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of twelve people is located in Pou Khvet Village in Takeo Province and Mrs. Nhy S. is a village bank president. She is a fish seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. Mrs. Nhy S. is a 52-year-old widow with two children who are all attending the local school. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% to Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha D. is a group leader of six members who all live in Trabek village in Kampong Chhnang province.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

Aside from this plantation, he is a fish seller in the local market.  Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.  Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy more fish to re-sell.  He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.  

His wife, Mrs. Meas Chakriya, is a pig breeder.  Mr.Chantha D. is 23-years-old, and he does not have a child yet.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These four members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add his savings to buy more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Oliana

texts.en: Oliana M., 30, is married with two children.  She has four years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the villagers and general public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 US).  SPBD loans are Oliana’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, soy sauce, onions, garlic, plastic plates, tissues, and pots

loans.name: Irshad Begum M. Sharif Group

texts.en:
Irshad begum baji is 48 years old, married, and has resided in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Growing up, she unfortunately could not attain education due to her family’s financial difficulties. She is currently married to M. S., a sweetmeat maker. He has owned his own store for the past 28 years. Irshad baji is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. All of her kids are currently attending the local school, and one of her sons is memorizing the holy book “Quran-e-Pak”.

Irshad baji is a very responsible lady. She helps her husband at the family business, making sweetmeats. She has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is applying again for a loan to buy materials (sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits) to expand her husband’s sweetmeat business.

She joined her current loan group with several women in her local community, all of whom are seeking to expand their family businesses. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Atharan baji wants a loan to expand her sweetmeat selling business. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business. Ashran baji wants a loan to drive an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat selling business

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en: At the age of 38, Neneta C. has to find ways to earn a living to provide for the needs of her family. Her husband died 2 years ago, leaving her with 6 children. Currently, she is into buying and selling bananas; at the same time, she joins her neighbor in their traditional system of gold mining. Her first and second loans from HSPFI were used for family expenses and helped her finance her small business. She wants to engage in ready-to-wear buying and selling and needs PHP 11,000.00 as capital. She wants to see all her children finish their studies and open up a ready-to-wear store of her own.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Doña Gladys es una mujer de noble corazón y muy cariñosa, sobre todo con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos a quienes ha tratado siempre de ofrecerles lo mejor para su desarrollo, y gracias a la casa que logró instalar, sus hijos han crecido bajo un techo donde pasaron los mejores años de su infancia. Su deseo de progreso la condujo a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que con el tiempo ha aprendiendo a manejar y ha administrar, pues en un inicio tenía deudas por falta de pago, pero se percató que lo más importante es ser constante en el cobro y atender muy bien a sus clientes. Después de obtener experiencia  fue creciendo poco a poco y ahora está a punto de ser una de las jefas de promotoras de la línea que vende, pues su gran capacidad la llevaron a ser una de la mejores consultoras de belleza. Estos resultados la motivan a seguir adelante, y espera que con el tiempo no solo sea una empleada más, sino ser una directora y tener un stand de diversa variedades de productos para que las personas no tengan que esperar la entrega de sus pedidos sino tener la facilidad de encontrar los mejores productos en su tienda. Gladys trabaja con MFP más de cuatro años, este es su octavo préstamo, y junto a sus compañeras de grupo, trata de seguir trabajando con mucho compromiso y responsabilidad. Ella con los 800 soles que solicita aprovechará las ofertas de los catálogos y adquirirá grandes cantidades de productos para venderlos a mejores precios y generar ingresos adicionales en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very noble-hearted and caring woman, especially with her husband and their four children, to whom she has always tried to offer the best for their development. Thanks to the house she was able to build, her children have grown up under a roof where they have passed the best years of their childhood. Her desire to advance led her to work selling cosmetics, which she has learned to manage over time. In the beginning, she was owed many debts, but came to realize that being constant in collection and attending to her customers was most important. After obtaining some experience, her business grew little by little and now she is about to become one of the head promoters of the line she sells, as her great abilities have made her one of the best beauty consultants. This motivates her to continue advancing, and she hopes that with time she will not be just another employee, but rather a manager with a stand of diverse products so people will not have to wait to place orders--they will have the convenience of finding better products in her store. Gladys has worked with MFP for more than four years; this is her eighth loan. Along with her group companions, she strives to keep working with much commitment and responsibility. With the 800 soles she is soliciting, she will take advantage of catalog discounts and acquire greater quantities of products to sell them at better prices and generate an additional income in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rubenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rubenia M. es una dama que desde hace 15 años inició su propio negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el municipio de Somotillo donde actualmente vive y atiende en su pulpería que tanto ha invertido en ella.

Sus inicios fueron un poco difíciles como todo negocio pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha venido mejorando su situación y hoy en día ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería y de esta forma continuar mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubenia M. is a lady that 15 years ago started her own grocery shop business in the city of Chinandega, specifically in the municipality of Somotillo where she currently lives and works in the grocery shop where she has invested so much. Her beginnings were tough as in any business but as times went by were was able to improve her situation and today she came to Ceprodel to request for a loan to purchase items for her store and, that way, continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa D. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse d’ignames, une denrée très comestible à au Togo. Elle désire avec ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des ignames pour la revente. Son activité consiste à aller acheter des ignames dans les fermes venir les livrer aux détaillants et aux détenteurs de bar restaurant. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawa D., age 40, is married and the mother of three. She sells yams, a very edible item in Togo. She would like to use this loan, her first with FECECAV, to expand her business by buying some yams for resale. Her work consists in going to buy yams from farms and coming to deliver them to retailers and pub owners. She’s counting on this opportunity to change her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams for resale

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: DAOUDA S. EST UN VIEL HOMME QUI EST EMPLOYE DANS UNE BOULANGERIE A THIES.IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE CINQ ENFANTS.AVEC CE PRET qu'il demande il veut acheter un four d'occasion qu'il souhaite utiliser chez lui pour avoir des revenus supplémentaires.
texts.en:
Daouda S. is an older man who works in a bakery in Thies. He is married and the father of 5 children. With this loan he wants to buy a used oven that he intends to put to work in his home to make supplementary income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of an oven

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul A. is a lovely 43-year-old divorced mother raising two children. She runs a small business at the local market, selling many types of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Ugul is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of goods and expand her merchandise selection.  She believes this will improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day, but most importantly, to enable her children to have a better future - one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Ugul and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new fabrics for her market shop.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun P. is 20 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has been blessed with a lovely young child who is still not in school. She and her husband are local rice cultivators. Besides the farming work, Khun P. raises a few sows for their piglets to sell, which is the main source of the family's income. Khun P. will take out a loan from Kiva's partner HKL in order to buy an extra sow to raise its offspring and to purchase a cart to make transportation easier during the approaching rice harvesting season.

loans.use: To buy an extra sow to raise its offspring

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia P. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 49 years old. Delia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Delia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en: Ernalyn D. is from the village of Zone 1, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Ernalyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ernalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ernalyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a sewing machine to engage in a new business. This loan will be the 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to engage in a new business

location.town: Zone 1, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta M. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 65 years old, is widowed, and has eight adult children.

Laureta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Laureta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Laureta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline J. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 35 years old. Evangeline is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Evangeline raises livestock (pigs) for sale. Evangeline has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in a new business of buying and selling jewelriy in the local community. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a new business of buying and selling jewelry

loans.name: Barna's Group

texts.en:
Pay On Time is a group of 5 borrowers led by Barna M. who live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. Barna is 40 years old and married with 5 children ages 8-22. She also cares for 7 children who were orphaned in the war. Barna was unable to attend school, although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Barna’s sells dry goods, including palm oil, ground nuts, paper products, and toiletries that she buys wholesale in nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers. She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to expand her business so that, one day, she can have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business, Barna dreams of sending her younger children to school.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil, ground nuts, and paper products

loans.name: Mirna Yolanda

texts.es:
la sra. MIRNA YOLANDA J. se dedica al comercio, vende ropa para dama, caballero y niños como ser pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, ropa interior, trajesitos, calsonetas, calcetines etc. el producto lo vende de manera ambulante en diferentes comunidades circunvecinas a Villa Santa y tambien vende en su casa de habitación,  tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y desde que inicio con el negocio su condición de vida a mejorado en gran manera,  vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos.
Su compañero de hogar es contratista de madera y aserrador de la misma, ya que esta es una zona 
con abundante bosque de pino.
Doña Mirna, expresa sentirse muy agradecida ya que todo por los momentos le esta saliendo y esta vendiendo mucha mercaderia, por tal razon desea un credito y asi comprar mas ropa al por mayor ya qye las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas y desea complacer a todos.

loans.use: compra de ropa para dama, caballero y niños

loans.name: Believe

texts.en: Believe makes lovely hair for her clients in her salon.She also sells hair extensions.she hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.She is a young and hard working woman.She is 31 years old and married with 2 children.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ledenisa

texts.en:
Ledenisa C. is from the village of Anonang, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Ledenisa is married and has two school-aged children. Ledenisa sells "alimango" (crabs) on a retail basis. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling crabs in the local community. Ledenisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ledenisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ledenisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional crabs to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ledenisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay tuition for her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: José Serafín

texts.es:
El señor José Serafín A. es padre de familia y dos hijos pequeños de edad a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la diferencia de una vivienda ya que actual mente está pagando renta y le está pidiendo que desocupe la casa, y el mejor desea tener su propio patrimonio y un lugar seguro para su familia. Es por eso que está solicitando su cooperación y así su familia tendrá su propia casa.
Don José Serafín trabaja para una canal de televisión en el departamento de productor y camarógrafo, esté ingreso es para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito. 

La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Enedelia Vázquez y un hijo, ya que cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor José Serafín A. el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Serafin A. is a family man with two small children, whom he wants to give the best. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for a house, since currently he is paying rent, and they are asking him to vacate the house. He desires to have his own patrimony and a safe place for his family. For this reason, he is requesting your cooperation, and this way his family will have their own house. Mr. Jose Serafin works for a television channel in the department of production and filming. This income is for his family, and in part will be used to pay back this credit. The person that appears in the picture is his wife, Mrs. Enedelia Vazquez, and one of their children, since Mr. Jose Serafin A. was at work when we visited his house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the difference of acquiring a home through a governmental credit

loans.name: Emilce

texts.en:
Emilce S. is 33 and married to Lopez Tranquilino, a professional mechanic, with whom she has two sons, aged 13 and 7 years.
About six years ago, Emilce decided to open an ice cream stall in her neighborhood. She needed to make some money because her family was going through a very difficult time financially. She decided to expand her stall to include other merchandise also. 
Now Emilce has a pantry fully stocked with a variety of goods. Thanks to her business, she was able to buy a small van to transport the goods she buys from her local market, thus avoiding delivery costs. She hopes to continue expanding her business and working with the Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sofy Azam Group

texts.en:
Hazra, 47 years old, wants to take out a loan for her bakery. She is a married woman with seven children who are in school. She needs this loan to buy wood for her business and other necessary materials.

Hazra is the leader of S. A. Group. There are four members in this group. Maryna wants to take out a loan for her quilt business. She wants to improve the business. Marzya wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Nargis wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business. She is new in her business and wants to develop her business to make a good income.

These woman are requesting a group loan of 30,000 afghani. With this loan, they can enlarge their businesses and support their families. They want to make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas, 33 years old, has a rice farming business. He is the father of three children, the eldest of whom is six years old. Tomas tills a one-and-a-half-hectare rice field to support his family. He lacks capital and has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., in order to request a loan. He has requested 15,000 Php to support his business. With the money he receives, he will buy farm supplies and fertilizers for his farm, ensuring a successful harvest. The loan has a low interest rate and is not burdensome to him.

loans.use: To fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Ndèye Mama

texts.fr: Ndèye Mama S. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de neuf enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PEYRISSAC depuis neuf ans et demis et y a bénéficié de 17 prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit restaurant et de faire le commerce de volaille. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Mama S., age 48, is married and the mother of nine children. She's been a member of the Village Bank BOUCOTTE PEYRISSAC for nine years and obtained 17 loans that she managed and repaid well. Her loan enables her to develop a small restaurant and to sell poultry. She contributes to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her ability to invest

loans.name: Rafael Antonio's Group

texts.es:
Rafael U. es trabajador de una estación de combustible en el municipio de Condega. Es muy trabajador y ha tomado la decisión de duplicar sus esfuerzos en el trabajo porque tiene una finca donde siembra tomates. Por esta razón es que solicita el crédito, para ser utilizado en la compra de fertilizantes para la siembra de hortalizas. 

Rafael es soltero y tiene un hijo y en edad escolar siendo este pequeño el que le impulsa a trabajar arduamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio U. works for a fuel station (PETRONIC) as a driver, and he also washes cars. Rafael will use this loan to buy fertilizers because he has a tomato crop planted on his parents’ farm. The objective of the fertilization is to get great output and more earnings from his harvest. Rafael is single. He lives with his life partner and his school-age child. This is the third loan that he has had with Ceprodel. Rafael says that the previous loans have been a big help. He has purchased household appliances that he needs in his house, and he has paid for some personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith C. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Judith is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. Judith is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Eugenia es viuda, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Eugenia tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Caceres en donD. venD. abarrotes en general y cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
El sueño D. Eugenia son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Kuskanchik Communal Bank. Kuskanchik means “All Together” in Quechua. Eugenia is a 50 year old widow with 4 children. She has a stall in the Mariscal Caceres Market where she sells groceries and grain on a daily basis. Eugenia needs a loan of 1000 soles with which she would buy rice and sugar. Eugenia's dream is to have a home based shop.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos ya independizados, actualmente vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años al transporte publico en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el cubre rutas dentro de la ciudad de Olmos y sus caseríos. Estas unidades son de mucha ayuda en la zona ya que son el unico medio de transporte que utilizan los pobladores de las zonas rurales para llegar a sus caseríos.

Segundo es una presona muy entregada a su trabajo, el nos comenta que esta actividad le hace sentir util, activo y que disfruta mucho de ella. El problema es que los caminos de la zona son muy accidentados y esto siempre causa daños en los vehículos.
