En esta ocasión, su mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas técnicas que necesitan de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Segundo es muy conocido y respetado por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive. Ellos lo consideran una personas bastante responsable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudarlos cuando lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Segundo is 62, married, and with three grown children who are on their own. Currently he lives with his wife in the Olmos district, located in Lambayeque province, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past four years he has worked in public transport with a mototaxi (motorized vehicle used to transport people and cargo). He covers the routes inside the city of Olmos and its farm villages. These transports are a big help in the rural areas where they are the only means of transportation that the poor can use to get to their farms. Segundo is very dedicated to his work. He tells us that this work makes him feel useful, active, and he really enjoys it. The problem is that the rural roads are very rough and this always causes damage to vehicles. Now his mototaxi has begun to experience some technical problems that urgently need repair to be able to run correctly. That is why he is asking for a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 new sols. He plans to use it to repair and maintain his vehicle. Segundo is well-known and respected by the neighbors in the area where he lives. They consider him a very responsible person who is always ready to help them when they need him.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintence expenses of his mototaxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional equipment like cups and buckets

loans.name: Mary Fe

texts.en:
Mary Fe A. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Mary Fe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to make her handmade adornments

loans.name: Five Traders Group

texts.en:
Mamusu F. (left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Mankay village about 22 years ago. She is married to a security guard and the couple has two children who are not of school-going age. For over two years now, Mamusu has been selling fish.

This is the first loan that Mamusu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Mamusu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy fish wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale to add to her inventory

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice A. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 35 years old. Janice is married and has three school-aged children. Janice owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Janice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Janice is requesting her first loan, for 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Mrs. Sobon Naov Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group has twenty people who have selected Mrs. Sobon N. as its leader. They are located in Kaoh Reah Leu village in Kandal province and will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sobon N. was born in 1980. She sells fruit at her local market to earn money to support her family. Since her business in going well she wants to expand so she is seeking a loan to buy more papayas to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sophak Toem, is a farmer who rents a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. They have two small children.

loans.use: To buy more papayas to resell

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en: Magrate is 38 years old and married with two children aged 15 and 7.  She has been selling second-hand clothes for two years.  She was previously transporting clothes from the neighboring country, Uganda. She decided to leave the business because it was not very economical because of high transport cost. She has been saving part of her income with a group in Faulu Kenya.  The group members guarantee each other's loan and she has requested a loan for 80, 000 KES. This loan will be used to buy dresses, jackets and trousers for resale. She hopes to buy a plot of land to build residential houses in the future. Magrate describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia M.  is currently in the business of selling saddles, clothes and women's handbags at the market and is requesting a loan to stock women's headdresses and some pairs of shoes to sell.  

Lucia is 53 years old and married. She has seven children and three of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend her business by building another shop for a supermarket business.

loans.use: Stock women's headdresses and some pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eligio tiene 70 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Wenceslaa Amarilla quienes forman una familia de tres varones y una mujer las cuales todos ya se encuentran casados, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos y también tiene una despensa en su domicilio, negocio el cual administra con su esposa.
Es una persona que ha trabajado toda la vida y gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia puede gozar de una vida tranquila y sin aprietos económicos junto a su familia.
Don Eligio solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos y mercaderías para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eligio is 70 years old and married to Wenceslaa Amarilla. They have raised a family of three sons and one daughter, all of whom are now married. Eligio works buying and selling bricks, and he also has a small general store in his home, a business which he manages together with his wife. He is a person who has worked all his life, and thanks to his effort and perseverance, he can now enjoy a peaceful life without economic stress together with his family. Eligio is requesting the loan to buy bricks as well as merchandise for his store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials and merchandise to sell, such as canned and packaged foods, dairy products, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Raquel De Fatima

texts.es:
Raquel de 55 años, ella tiene un taller de costura, es madre soltera y vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil).

Inicio con el negocio porque necesitaba solventar los gastos de su familia, comenzó a coser ropa y poco a poco pudo comprar una maquina de coser. Trabaja todos los días hasta que termine todos los pedidos de ropa. Con el préstamo comprar una maquina de coser para tener mas producción de ropa. 

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y comprar mas maquinas para tener mas producción de ropa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 55 years old. She has a tailoring shop. She is a single mother and she lives in the region of Primavera de duran (a suburban region located farther than Guyaquil). She started her business because she needed to cover the family's expenses. She started making clothes and soon she was able to purchase a sewing machine. She works every day to complete the orders she receives. With the loan she requests she will pruchase a sewing machine to complete her projects faster. In the future she hopes to expand her business and purchase more sewing machines and increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
el sr. Oscar Armando G. P. se dedica al servicio de transporte de personas, posee un Taxi, actualmente tiene casi dos años brindando este servicio, pero lo hace solo con personas conocidas, ya que no tiene permiso ni numero para poder circular libremente como Taxi, osea que el por las mañanas se encarga de transportar personas a sus trabajos y en las tardes igual los lleva a sus casas.
en estos momentos esta realizando los tramites necesarios con Soptravi y la Dirección Ejecutiva de Ingresos  para poder realizar tramites de cambio de placas, porque ya tiene quien le alquile el Numero de Taxi.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar repuestos y arreglar el carro para dar un buen servicio cuando ya este listo como Taxi.
Soptravi y la DEI exigen que el carro debe de estar en buen estado para dar el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando G. P. has a taxi and provides services. He has been doing this for nearly two years but he only works for people he knows, because he does not have an official taxi license or number and cannot legally solicit freely. He takes people to their jobs in the morning and takes them home in the evenings. He is currently working with Soptravi and Dirección Ejecutiva de Ingresos (DEI) to obtain an official taxi license plate, because he has found someone who is willing to provide him with a taxi number. He will use the money from this loan to buy repair parts that he needs to fix up his car so that he can give better services when his taxi becomes licensed. Soptravi and DEI rules state that the vehicle must e in good repair in order to be used as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem V. is 24 years old and lives with his wife in the Takeo province. He is a construction worker building a house and is able to make about US $3 every day. His wife is a garment factory worker and makes US $3 per day as well. Since Sem V. spends a lot on transportation, he is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike as his way to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Carla Lilian

texts.es: La señora Carla es cliente antigua la actividad a la que se dedica es la comercialización de prendas de vestir, específicamente la de compra y venta de pantalones poleras y chamarras las mismas que las adquiere de la ciudad de Santa Cruz y las distribuye en varias zonas de la ciudad de la Paz, entrega su mercadería a crédito. Ella vive con sus dos hijas las cuales se encuentran en etapa de estudio.  El destino del crédito es el incremento de mercadería por mayor la cual en época de navidad sube de precio, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carla is an old client of Emprender.  She buys and sells clothes, specifically pants, shirts, and jackets.  She buys the clothes in Santa Cruz and distributes them in various zones in La Paz, making money off the merchandise.  She lives with her two daughters, who are in school.

She will use this loan to grow her inventory since the prices raise during the Christmas season.  Carla is a young hard-working woman.  She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support they’ve given her.

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell

loans.name: Mayra Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

La señora Mayra que es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal,  también antes de este fue fundadora de un Banco  Comunal en Rocafuerte su tierra natal. Ella tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 13 – 5 y 3 años de edad,  el mayor esta en colegio, otro en escuela y el menor aun no tiene edad para estudiar. Estudio en la Universidad en la cual se graduó de Lic. En Auditoria. 

Esta ama de casa para sacar a sus hijos adelante se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (perfumería, artículos de belleza y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 11am y en las noches. Además realiza trabajos  de asesoría contable trabajo que aprovecha para vender sus productos, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas cuando los productos salen más baratos y que cuando pasa la promoción los vende a precio normal con lo que se gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos e invertir en los que estén de oferta ya que estos  le dejan mayores ganancias.
 
Su sueño es darles a sus hijos una buena educación
texts.en:
The “Ceibos” communal bank meets every two weeks in the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of Portoviejo, a marginal urban zone whose residents are engaged in a variety of activities.

Mayra is a founding member of the communal bank.  Prior to this she was also a founding member of a communal bank in Rocafuerte, her place of birth.  She is 35 years old, a single mother of three children who are 13, 5 and 3 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the next one is in elementary school; the youngest is still not old enough to go to school.  She studied in the university graduating as an Auditor.

In order to support her children, this housewife sells Yanbal brand products (perfumes, beauty supplies and women’s accessories).  She works daily from 8am until 11am and in the evening.  She also works doing accountancy jobs and takes advantage of these occasions to offer her products for sale.  She tells us that she buys items when they are on sale and when the sale is over she resells them at regular price thereby earning a bit extra income.

This loan is to buy products and invest in those that are on sale because they are the ones that produce higher profits.

Her dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and Yambal brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan S. is a 24-year-old village woman who has a job as a fish seller. Her husband (pictured) repairs vehicles. The couple has one child. Kan S. buys fish from wholesale suppliers and other fisherman and sells retail. She earns approximately of $3 a day. The main income for her family comes from her husband who wants to buy old or second-hand motorbikes to fix and resell to make more profit. She said that she wishes to encourage her husband’s business, but does not have enough money, which is why she is asking for a loan.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle to fix up and sell.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo, de 47 años, enviudo hace 8 años y junto a sus 3 hijos: Goldi, de 22, Maryerli, de 19 y Devie, de 17 años de edad; sale adelante. Él vive solo en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Este excelente padre de familia, trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, a los que mira cada 15 días, ya que ellos realizan sus estudios superiores en la capital. 

Su principal actividad es la agricultura, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello, sus principales cultivos son de café y plátanos, los que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pero sus producciones de café la entrega íntegramente a la cooperativa de su localidad. Pero está actividad no le proporciona muchos recursos, ya que tiene que mandar mensualmente una suma considerable de dinero. Por ello Oswaldo, viaja constantemente a Pucallpa, donde realiza obras civiles como: cunetas, pistas, carreteras. 

Para más adelante desea comprar más hectáreas de café y de esa manera invertir en los estudios de sus hijos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y agradece a su banco comunal por el apoyo que le brindaron en los momentos que más necesitaba y como presidente de su comunidad trabajará con honestidad e igualdad. 

Ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de 17 sacos de abono que le falta, para esparcirlos en sus plantaciones de 4 hectáreas de café, que oscilan entre S/. 48.00 soles cada una, asimismo invertirá en el pago a los peones quienes le ayudarán a sacar la maleza y aplicar abono en el campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Oswaldo, who is 47 and was widowed 8 years ago, is advancing, together with his three children, Goldi, who is 22, Maryerli, 19, and Devie, 17. He lives alone in his own house, located in the community of Sanchirio, in the central Peruvian forest. He is an excellent father to his family. He works very hard to bring up his children, whom he sees every 15 days, since they are working on their higher-level studies in the capital. 

His principal activity is agriculture, which he has already been working at for 10 years. His main crops are coffee and bananas. He sells the bananas at the wholesale market in his city, but he turns over his entire coffee crop to the cooperative in his area. But this business doesn't give him much return, and he has to send a considerable amount of money (for his children's education) each month. For this reason, Oswaldo travels constantly to Pucallpa, where he works on civil projects, such as on ditches, tracks, and highways.

In the future, he wants to buy more hectares of coffee and in this way have more income to invest in the education of his children. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is thankful to his community bank for the support that they have offered at the times when he most needed it. As president of his community bank, he will work with honesty and fairness. 

He is planning to invest this loan in the purchase of 17 sacks of compost, which he lacks, and which he will spread on his 4-hectare coffee plantation. They cost around 48 PEN each. He will also use part of the loan to pay his field workers, who help him weed and spread manure on his fields.

loans.use: Buy 17 sacks of compost

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Basilides E. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She sells noodles, soft drinks, toothpaste and other kinds of products.

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Basilides is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man and the father of one child who attends school. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in iron production for over six years. He started his own business in 2006.  His work is very delicate and he works hard to satisfy the needs of his family. Over the years, he has been able to build a good business reputation. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase special iron machinery that will facilitate his productivity. This machinery will help him deliver his goods faster and expand his business operations. He is planning to continue expanding his business and he is positive about the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase special iron machinery

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

La señora Ligia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, además se desempeña como presidenta del mismo función que desempeña con mucha responsabilidad y agrado. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante de carne.

Ella es consultora de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además vende calzados de las marcas Azalea y Dicaza, trabaja todos los días desde las 13h30 hasta las 19h00, ya que en las mañanas tiene que atender a su esposo que está muy delicado de salud. Su trabajo consiste en estar a cargo de surtir a 12 vendedoras que están a su cargo a quienes tiene que tomarles los pedidos y entregarles los productos. Lo que es la línea de zapatos los compra en Quito.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: zapatos de ambas marcas y productos Yanbal para sus ventas personales. Sus sueños son ser directora de Yanbal. .
texts.en:
The members of Avenida del Ejército communal bank meet every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known since many years ago as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Ligia is a founding member of the bank.  She also is the group President, a job she does with much responsibility and pleasure.  She is 57 years old, married and has four adult, independent children.  Her husband is a meat merchant.

She is a Yanbal consultant (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She also sells shoes of the Azalea and Dicaza brands.  She works every day from 1:30pm until 7pm because during the mornings she has to take care of her husband who is in delicate health.

Her work consists in stocking 12 sellers she’s in charge of and from whom she takes orders and delivers their products.  She buys the line of shoes in Quito.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: shoes of both brands and Yanbal products for her personal sales.  Her dream is to become a Yanbal director.

loans.use: To buy shoes and Yanbal brand products.

loans.name: Mirzoahmad

texts.en:
Mirzoahmad is married and has one child. He sells rice in the local market. His stall is well known for the good prices he offers, and his affordability compared to market prices. Mirzoahmad knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them the best quality of goods. He has been selling rice for a total of 25 years, with consistent profits. 

Mirzoahmad is requesting a loan of 7700 Somoni to increase the assortment of his goods. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profit. We believe that Mirzoahmad's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.   
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more rice for resale

loans.name: Jeanvier

texts.en: Jeanvier is 68 years old and has 8 children; her eldest was born in 1970 while her last was born in 1994. Jeanvier owns a store where she sells several items such as cooking oil, matches, soap and sugar. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. She plans to save all her profits in order to build a house.

loans.use: Buy inventory of soap, cooking oil, and matches.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman living in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. Florence has operated a cloth-selling business for the past year, selling from door to door to her neighbours. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business but hopes to establish a boutique shop from which to sell clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase 50 pairs of lessos (Kikois) to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation.

loans.use: To purchase 50 pairs of lessos (Kikois) for sale.

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo, de 43 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad el Regadío, localizada en el departamento de Estelí, es casado, tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, de oficio agricultor, también comerciantes. Lleva 2 años en el negocio de destace de res.
Inicio en la agricultura en la comunidad el Regadío, ayudándole a su papa en el cultivo, arriar ganado a los 6 años de edad. Estudio la primaria en su comunidad de origen donde asistían todos los día caminando ida y vuelta, ya que la escuela queda algo lejos de du casa así mismo con la secundaria hasta lograr culminar su secundaria.  Después de eso tuvo que  trabajar para poder sobrevivir y se dedico al destace de cerdo y luego el  ganado. Con la primera vaca que compro y vendió le quedo una ganancia de C$4000 córdobas. Así logro trasladarse con su negocio hasta el centro de la comunidad el Regadío, municipio de Estelí, para vender carne a los mercados locales de Estelí, sin dejar atrás  la agricultura que es la actividad que aprendió desde niño.  
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado, ya que con esto espera aumentar sus ventas al igual que su número de clientela.
Dentro de sus planes esta volverse proveedor exclusivo de carnes para los supermercados. Su meta próxima es poder etiquetar su producto con el nombre de su carnicería  darle una mejor presentación a su producto para atraer mas clientes fuera de Estelí y poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 43 years old. He is from the community of El Regadío, located in the departament of Estelí. He is married and has 4 children. He is a farmer by profession, as well as a merchant. He has been in the cattle butchering business for 2 years.   

He started in agriculture in the community of El Regadío, helping his father with the crops, driving cattle at 6 years old. He went to primary school in his home community, walking there and back every day, since the school was a little far from his house. He did the same in secondary school, until he finished secondary school. Afterwards, he had to work to be able to survive and he began to work in butchering pigs and later cattle. With the first cow he bought and sold he made C$4,000 cordobas. He also was able to transfer his business to the downtown of the El Regadio community, town of Estelí, to sell meat in the local markets of Estelí. He dis this without leaving farming behind, the activity he learned as a child.  
 
He is asking for the loan to buy cattle, since in this way he hopes to increase his sales as well as his customers. 

Among his plans is becoming the exclusive provider of meat to the supermarkets. His next goal is to be able to label his product with his butcher shop's  name, giving his product a better appearance to attract more customers outside of Estelí and be able to offer a better future to his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Korir

texts.en:
Korir, 25 years old, has been practicing mixed farming for the last 4 years in Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. His farm is currently producing milk and eggs, which are sold to the local market.

Korir has requested this loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use to transport his milk to the local market. His major challenges have been poor roads, diseases and not enough food for his animal. The extra income from this loan will help improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rachel Edith

texts.es:
Doña Rachel, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, donde administra un comedor llamado “Bendiciones de Dios”, ella vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, este negocio lo inicio por su madre, hace 10 años, con un horario de 7:00am a 5:00pm, de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para acondicionar mejor el comedor, mejorando sus paredes y volviéndolo más atractivo, esta inversión aunque no es su producción, pero si le ayudara para que sus clientes se sientan en un ambiente mejor y le visiten más a menudo.
Su objetivo es mantenerse bien en el negocio, tratar de solventar sus deudas, y ser independiente.
texts.en:
Rachel is 43 years old and lives in San Miguel where she runs an eatery called 'Benediciones de Dios' (God's Blessings).  She lives with her family: her husband and two children aged 11 and 15.  She started this business through her mother 10 years ago.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm, from Monday to Sunday.

Rachel is requesting a loan to better fit out her eatery, improving her walls and making it more attractive.  This investment will not affect her production but it will help her to make her customers feel that they are in a better environment and they will visit more often.

Rachel's goal is to keep running her business well, to try to clear her debts and to be independent.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her eatery

loans.name: Mawoulé Group

texts.fr:
MAWOULE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres font tous partie d'une même association de femmes. En vue d'accroître le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. 
La représentante du groupe, Mouibatou Justine (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Mouibatou Justine s'est installée avec sa famille à Atrokpocodji, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis près de six ans.Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Mouibatou Justine vend depuis quinze ans déjà, des poteries et diverses plantes médicinales à son domicile. Mouibatou Justine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Tori. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs obtenus. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mouibatou Justine désire, ensemble avec ses autres membres, obtenir un autre financement.
texts.en:
Mawoulé is a group composed of three women. They are all members of the same women's association. In order to increase their activity level and better meet their customers' demand, the group members came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for a loan.

The group's representative, Mouibatou Justine (raising her hand on the photo) is married to Pascal. They provide for three children, all attending school. Two of them are their own children. Nearly six years ago, Mouibatou Justine settled with her family in Atrokpocodji in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. The parents provide together for their family. Mouibatou Justine has been selling from her home, for 15 years already, earthenware and medicinal herbs. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Tori. She is a long-standing client of Alidé and has repaid her previous loans on schedule. In order to strengthen her activity and meet her customers' demand, Mouibatou Justine and the other members of her group want to get a new loan.

loans.use: to buy a diversified set of earthenware and a sizeable quantity of medicinal herbs.

loans.name: Digao

texts.en: F. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 53 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, F. runs a business selling fish in the community. F. has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. F. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. F. is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by F. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Mary  Wanjiku

texts.en: Mary is 70 years old and married to Samson, a farmer. She has been doing crop farming and raising livestock for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.65,000. This is her fourth loan cycle from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production and sale. Mary intends to use the anticipated profits to rent a piece of land to grow more vegetables and hopes to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, age 44, earns a living by running a general store, where she sells both food items and daily-use products in her local community. Marieta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,560 PHP a month. She and her husband have four school-aged children and live in the city of Mobod, Oroq. City. 

In 2010, Marieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marieta has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional food products, such as bags of rice and corn grits, to offer for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional food products, such as bags of rice and corn grits, to offer for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season it becomes difficult for her to operate her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and coconut. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and coconut.

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.en:
Sharaf is 26 years old and he is married. He is engaged in selling men’s sport shoes. Sharaf works hard and he tries to expand his business and increase his working capital in order to make a good profit. He would like a loan of 4500 TJS  to purchase new fashionable men’s sport shoes. Sharaf is thankful to Kiva lenders who will support him and allow him to keep his family in good living conditions. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new men’s sport shoes

loans.name: Omar Leonardo

texts.es:
Omar Leonardo tiene 44 años, es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos de 12 y 15 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Omar se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca  en tierras propias. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y educar a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Omar Leonardo is 44 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and his children, who are 12 and 15, in El Progreso, in Chillanes canton.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located 15 minutes from our Chillanes office and has 13 members.  This is the third loan that they are requesting from Cooperativa San José.  The members of this bank are farmers who grow cacao, corn, bananas, soy and cassava.

Omar is a farmer who grows cacao, corn, bananas, soy and cassava on his own land.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help Omar to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for his crops.  Loans have supported him and helped increase his crop production.  He has faced challenges such as illnesses amongst his workers, pest infestations and plant diseases.  His dream is to enjoy good health so that he can continue working and educating his children.

In his spare time, he enjoys going for walks with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for his crops

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto aprendió la labor de las colmenas desde sus 20 años gracias a su tío, que cuando fallece le hereda el negocio y con este es con el que ha podido mantener a su familia.

El genera en cada cosecha de miel varios empleos y por esto el quiere crecer su negocios para así poder darle a otras personas trabajo y además mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

El se sueña con un gran negocio para cuando conforme su familia y tenga sus hijos heredarles el negocio y así puedan seguir trabajando y generar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Rigoberto learned the art of beekeeping in his 20s, thanks to his uncle.  When he passed away, he willed the business to him and it has allowed him to support his family.

Several employees harvest honey and he wants to grow the business in order to provide jobs to other people.  He also wants to increase his income and improve his quality of life.  He dreams of having a grand business so that when he forms his family and has children, they will be able to inherit the business and also create jobs for others.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia es una madre de familia de 38 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de su padre, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Ofelia desde hace algunos años se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte de adelante de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Ofelia con trabajo y esmero a logrado sacar adelante poco a poco a su familia, algo que le da mucha alegria y tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a 38-year old mother. She lives with her two children in her father’s house, which lacks basic services, in the Tambogrande district, which is in the department of Piura. This region is known for its agricultural, ranching, and craft-making activities.

For several years, Ofelia has raised and sold farm animals (pigs, sheep, and poultry). She raises them in the pens she has in the front part of her house. She feeds them a balanced diet of grains and natural grasses, and once they have completed their growth cycle, she sells them to her customers or in the various markets in the region. With the profits, she will be able to cover her family’s financial obligations.

She has requested a loan of 1500 PEN ($550) from Edpyme Alternativa to buy healthy feed. Once she has fattened up her stock, she will sell them to her customers, and with the profits she earns she will repay the loan she has been awarded and improve her quality of life. With work and care, Ofelia has managed to get her family ahead bit by bit, which gives her lots of happiness and peace of mind.

loans.use: To buy healthy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Irma Angelica

texts.es: Irma Angélica es una mujer muy trabajadora desde hace 11 años es costurera donde realiza trabajos como levantar bastillas,  colocación de cierres, vestidos de novia y quince años, vestidos de graduación y mas. Ha ce unos años su esposo tubo que salir de la ciudad cuestiones de trabajo por lo que Angélica se quedo a cargo de sus 3 hijos hombres por tal motivo opto por trabajar en casa para no descuidar los quehaceres del hogar. En este momento Irma necesita de un préstamo para comprar tela, hilos y otros para seguir con su negocio  ya que de sus ganancias obtendrá dinero para la operación de un hijo de 11 años.
texts.en: Irma Angélica is a hard-working woman and has been a seamstress for the past 11 years where she does works such as: hemming, placing zippers, dresses for weddings, sweet 16, graduations, and more.  A few years ago her husband left the city in search of a job, meanwhile, Angelica stayed in charge of her 3 sons; using that as motivation she opted to work from home so as not to stray from household chores.  At this time Irma needs a loan to purchase fabric, thread, and other things in order to continue with her business.  With her earnings she will have enough money for her 11 year old's operation.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the business

loans.name: Wesly

texts.en:
Wesly is 28 years old, married, and together they have two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. He applied for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs, wheat seeds and also land preparation. 

With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams to be a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, not withstanding limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Jenny es socia del banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, este lugar cuenta con una gran belleza natural y su gente es muy hospitalaria,  su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. 

La Señora Jenny tiene 24 años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra pero independientes.

Nuestra socia tiene en un centro de copiado y papelería, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, se dedica a esta actividad hace 2 años.

Es su segundo crédito en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de útiles escolares y artículos de oficina para su papelería.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que le faltan puertas y ventanas.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the “El Cruce hacia el Futuro” communal bank.  She lives in Sinincay Parish.  This place has much natural beauty and its inhabitants are very hospitable.  Its cuisine is quite varied.  Residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.

Jenny is 24 years old, married and has no children yet.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They do not own a house.  They live in her mother-in-law’s house but independently.

She has a copy center and stationery shop.  She works Monday through Friday from 8am until 7pm.  She’s been in business for two years.

This is the second loan with the communal bank and she’ll invest it in the purchase of school supplies and office supplies for her stationery shop.  Her goal is to finish building her house; it still needs doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and office supplies.

loans.name: Gema Mylu

texts.es:
Gema continua trabajando como recepcionista, pues su ahnelo es la construccion de su casa propia, es por tal razon los financiamiento ha sido para aumentar de inventario al comprar mucha mercaderia en cosmeticos, logrando captar mas clientes, mejores ventas.
con este nuevo prestamo sera destinado, para la compra de ropa nueva variada, de dama, niño y caballeros, asi como algunos pedido de cosmeticos. Ya que tiene el ochenta por ciento encargado, y no ha podido comprar ya que parte del capital lo tiene invertido en cosmetico.
Como meta es seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio, apoyar  a su familia, y ahorrar para poder comprar su terreno propio y construir su casa que junto  asu esposo espera lograrlo.
texts.en:
Gema continues working as a receptionist as her dream is to build her own home.  She has used her loans to increase her stock levels, buying a lot of merchandise (cosmetics).  This has enabled her to gain more customers and improve her sales.

Gema will use this new loan to buy a range of new clothes for men, women and children.  She will also make some cosmetics orders.  She already has eighty percent of her merchandise ordered but hasn't been able to buy it as she has part of her capital invested in cosmetics.

Gema's goals are to continue growing in her small business, to support her family and to save up so that she can buy her own plot of land and build her own home.  She hopes to manage this together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Mirna De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Mirna De La Cruz ella trabaja en la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Tiene 8 años en su negocio pues la mayoría de sus clientes saben de los buenos productos que elabora. Lo más resaltante de esta actividad es que ella siempre esta preocupándose por proporcionar la mejor calidad de sus tortillas.  La Señora Mirna trabaja todos los días para obtener ingresos para su hogar. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de cal, maíz, comal, bolsas, servilletas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirna De La Cruz prepares and sells tortillas.  She has been in business for eight years and most of her customers are familiar with the fine products that she makes.  The thing that stands out most about her business is that she is always concerned about providing the best quality of tortillas.  

Sra. Mirna works every day in order to generate household income.  For this reason, she is requesting this loan in order to buy lime, corn, a griddle, bags, napkins, and other products.

loans.use: to buy lime, corn, a griddle, bags, napkins, and other products.

loans.name: Ajarkul's Group

texts.en:
Ajarkul, 50, is the leader of this group. She has been working as a nurse in a local hospital for the major part of her life. For the past five years, since her husband’s death, Ajarkul and her oldest son are also raising and reselling cattle. 

She has always seen the high potential of raising livestock in the village of Kyzyl Suu in Issyk Kul province due to its highland pastures. The fresh air and favorable climate create nice living conditions for local livestock. Earning 3000 soms a month assists her with covering major expenses for her youngest son who is a third grade student. 

The expansive household of Ajarkul has attracted a lot of attention from local and foreign wholesale dealers. The process of reselling is intensive this current season and Ajarkul is busy with buying young calves and sending them to pasture. The short term goal is to buy several more young livestock for further fattening and reselling. She is hopeful of future success of her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a married woman with one child. Teresita is 52 years old and is residing at Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Teresita is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for nine years. Each month, she earns 3,260 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to resell. Teresita has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Teresita wants to expand her business and for her child to finish school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell.

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children. For the past 6 years, Dan has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, which sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Dan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more meat for resale, and will help Dan to generate greater profits and buy food to feed his family. Dan hopes that in the future he will be able to open more branches of the same business. 

Dan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for resale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4  filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Gaza para o Distrito de Boane quando casou, é domestica e apenas gere o salario do marido ha mais de 15 anos que tem um salario de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 24.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra do murro da sua casa(areia, cimento, pedra,blocos  e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e comprar uma viatura para transportar a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fatima was born in the Chibuto district, Gaza Province, in Southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom attend school.  She completed school through the 7th grade but dropped out due to her parents' financial situation.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports a nephew who lives with her.  

She left Gaza for the Boane district when she got married.  She is a housekeeper and only her husband earns a salary. His monthly salary has been 5.000.00mt for over 15 years, which they use for household expenses and savings in their bank account (BIM).  Fatima has never had a loan with another bank and learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  

This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 24.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials to continue building the wall of her home (sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)  She promises to make her payments on time and in the future hopes to finish construction and purchase a vehicle to transport her family.  She plans to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase materials to continue construction on the wall of her home (sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)

loans.name: Goorgoorlu Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 JUILLET 2003. Il  est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Fatoumata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de poulets de chaire. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de payer ses dettes et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Goorgoorlu solidarity group was formed on July 22nd, 2003. It is made up of 13 women who all live in the same area and are all traders.

Fatoumata, standing on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group´s leader. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She is an experienced saleswoman who has sold broiler chickens (chickens raised specifically for meat production) for several years.

This loan will increase Fatoumata´s working capital and will allow her to buy some chicks and increase her business activity. She will use her profits to pay off her debts and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy broiler chicks.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora, la Sra. Epifania contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 2° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
Epifania nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de verduras de gran variedad. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles de esa forma una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que atravesar. Dentro de sus metas está tener un local propio donde vender sus productos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas y demás tipos de verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecerse.
texts.en:
This groups is called “Las Emprendedoras” (The Lady Entrepreneurs) and is located in the city of Itá, thanks to the fact that the director, Epifania, who contacted the advisor from “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) at a weekly meeting, about the program.  She was able to get 16 women who work comfortably together.  They’re already in their second cycle in the program.

Epifania tells us that she sells vegetables in large quantity.  Thanks to this work, she’s been able to help her family and provide them with a dignified life, free from deprivations like the ones she had to deal with.  One of her goals is to have her own shop from where she can sell her products.

She is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, jocotes, onions and other types of vegetables to stock up.

loans.use: to stock up on vegetables.

loans.name: Adzo Edem

texts.fr:
Adzo est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 1 enfant.
Adzo travaille comme coiffeuse revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle coiffe, vend des mèches, du savon défrisant et des sacs de sortie pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Adzo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de sortie et des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adzo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adzo is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to a reseller. She has one child.

Adzo has been working as a hairdresser and reseller since 2009. She does hair, sells hair extensions, hair relaxing soap and handbags for all types of customers in her shop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Adzo has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy handbags and hair extensions. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Adzo would like to expand the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure her family's self-fulfillment.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair relaxers, and handbags.

loans.name: Mercedes Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita en Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 5 hijos, cuatro  de ellos ya son  mayores de edad y el ultimo de 17 años que  estudian en colegio, cuatros de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella como buena esposa trata de ayudar a su esposo en lo que más pueda, por eso realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el mismo que se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y verduras el mismo que lo realiza cuatro días de la semana en un mercado de Manta, el señor se desplaza desde muy temprano a dicho mercado con la finalidad de comprar a comerciantes mayoristas y luego realizar sus ventas a las personas que asistan a este centro de abastos a comprar los productos para el consumo diario.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque se divierte con sus compañeras y por la ayuda que le dan.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito y espera utilizarlo al igual que el anterior para dárselo al esposo para que lo utilice en su negocio, nos cuenta que gracias a los créditos ellos pueden salir adelante y que con las ganancias pueden darles una buena educación  a sus hijos para que ellos tengan un gran porvenir.

Sus sueños es algún día tener un bazar o una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets every two weeks in La Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a canton known for the famous straw hats that are highly regarded both within the country and abroad.


We met Mercedes, 46, in this place.  She’s married and has five children.  Four of them are already adults and the youngest, a 17-year-old, is attending school.  Four of her children still live with her.   Her husband is a merchant.

As a good wife, she tries to help her husband in everything she can.  Because of this she’s taking out this loan to help with her husband’s business.  He’s a fruit, vegetable and legumes merchant.  He sells four days a week in a market in Manta.  He heads out to the market very early in order to buy from wholesalers and then sell to people who come to this supply center to buy items of daily consumption.

The loan will be used to buy fruit, vegetables and legumes.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 10 years and likes it because of the help they give her.

She is repeating the loan and hopes to use it like she did the previous one, to give it to her husband so that he can use it in his business.  She tells us that thanks to the loans they are able to get ahead and with the profits are able to provide a good education for their children so that they can have great futures.  Her dream is to someday have a clothing store or a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes and vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria se ha caracterizado por ser una persona luchadora y pujante para sacar sus 2 hijos adelante y superar las adversidades que le ha traído la vida desde la muerte de su esposo.
Luz Maria ahora madre soltera cabeza de familia, quiere que sus hijos tengan todas las necesidades básicas satisfechas, sin embargo a menudo sus ingresos son muy bajos y no le permite acceder a esto. Luz Maria quiere que su negocio crezca y se consolide en su sector, para que así sus ventas aumenten y le genere mayores ingresos que los actuales.
Luz Maria tiene un gran sueño y es el que sus 2 hijos puedan acceder a una carrera de educación superior y puedan estudiar una carrera que les brinde la posibilidad de acceder a un empleo bien remunerado. Para esto, Luz Maria sabe que tiene que aumentar sus ingresos actuales, por lo que pretende vender más productos en su negocio.
Luz Maria tiene desde hace aproximadamente 1 año un café Internet que ya se ha reconocido en el sector por tener una muy buena atención, y ahora Luz Maria quiere que en su café Internet pueda ofrecer productos de papelería, pues sus clientes constantemente preguntan por ellos.
Luz Maria actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de productos de papelería, por lo que espera que un crédito le permita acceder a la compra de productos de papelería como cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, entre otros y pueda así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y genere mayores ingresos.
Luz Maria espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente y pueda mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos, y en futuro puedan acceder a una buena educación.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is known for being a hard fighting and energetic person in order to bring up her children and overcome the adversities that life has brought her since the death of her husband.

Luz Maria is now a single mother and head of the family. She wants her children to have all the basic needs satisfied, but at times her income is very low and she is not able to do it. Luz Maria hopes her business grows and becomes established in her location in order for her sales to increase and to generate more income than she has at the present time.

Luz Maria has a big dream and it is that her two children can have access to higher education and can study for a career that will provide the possibility to gain well paid employment. For this, Luz Maria knows that she has to increase her current income, so she wants to sell more products in her business.

Luz Maria has been working for approximately one year in the internet cafe and she is already known in the area for having good service and now Luz Maria wants to offer stationery products in her internet cafe because her customers are always asking for them.

Luz Maria currently does not have enough working funds in order to buy the stationery products, which is why is is hoping for a loan in order to be able to buy the stationery products such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, and other items and she can then satisfy the needs of her clients and earn more money.

Luz Maria hopes that her income will increase considerably and she can improve the quality of life for her two children and in the future they can access a good education.

loans.use: to buy stationery products to offer her customers the products they require

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 51 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maura has a general store business in the Philippines. Maura requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Maura has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Hugo Adiel

texts.es:
Hugo se siente muy satisfecho al tener resultados positivos después que invirtió el crédito anterior en su negocio, la cosecha de granos básicos ha sido muy abundante y no tuvo problemas con las plagas, sus ganancias han mejorado, su familia se mantiene unida y con el mismo número de miembros.
Para mejorar su negocio solicita un nuevo crédito con el que comprara un caballo, lo hace con la finalidad de agilizar sus actividades y mantener la continuidad de su negocio.

loans.use: comprara un caballo, lo hace con la finalidad de agilizar sus actividades y mantener la continuidad de su negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more animals for the butchery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a dairy calf

loans.name: Faamigi

texts.en:
For the past six years, Faamigi has made a living in elei, traditional fabric printing. With many years of experience, Faamigi has increased the number of her loyal customers, whose stores cater mainly to tourists. Her business is a success.

She works two days a week and purchases material from wholesalers at an affordable price. One of the best parts of her business is that after six years her sons are now the designers and printers. She creates mainly T-shirts and lavalavas.

loans.use: Purchase of paints and brushes; labor

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en: Abdul Karim is fifty years old and married with four children.  Since getting a salaried job is difficult in the post civil war country Sierra Leone, Abdul decided to run his own small business to generate income for the family.  He owns a small general shop in the town of Mogburaka in Sierra Leone. With his first loan with SMT, he was able to expand his business. He is dedicated to expanding his business further and provide for his children needs.

loans.use: Increase inventory in small general store

loans.name: Juan Domingo

texts.en:
Juan Domino A. Franco, 34, started his business seven years ago. After high school, he studied for two years specializing in automobiles. He is an electrician for all types of vehicles, including trucks, cars, and buses. Most of his clients are passers-by. He usually has more clients when it is cold out, and less when it is warm out. It takes him approximately two hours to finish his work on each vehicle.

Juan is also the father of 4 children, 3 of whom are students. His wife is a licensed nurse, but currently unemployed because there are very few available jobs in her field. For now, she stays at home to look after their children.

With the help of his loan, Juan will be able to pay for rent for his business as well as purchase more wrenches and small parts to fix cars.

loans.use: Purchase wrenches and to help with rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his supplies

loans.name: Hortencia Group

texts.es:
The clients of the Hortencia group come from the village Tzucubal Ixtahuacan, which is quite far from the urban center and completely rural. Because of this, many of the women are quite timid at first, but after some time and funny stories, the ladies reflect their real personalities, those of self confident and very determined women.

Many of our clients in the communal bank Hortencia come from a very humble past. They have worked as weavers on a tiny scale, in the fields harvesting corn, fishing or washing clothes. However, when Friendship Bridge gave them the opportunity for a loan, they decided to change their future.

The majority of these clients are asking for a loan of approximately $300 US dollars. This reflects that these women are having business success. The success of their businesses can also be seen as a product of their constant work. The loan that this group is requesting will be their tenth from our institution.

The women will primarily use their loans to buy raw material in order to make typical dresses and in order to purchase and sell them. Although the credit that the majority of the women will receive will be invested in fabric and thereby could cause a saturation of the market, these clients are confident in the success of their business because Nahualá weaving is in great demand due to its quality and beauty.

Doña Lucia Quiché would love for her business to expand so that she could buy a car and not have to carry her merchandise to market every day. Manuela T., the treasurer of the communal bank, says that she wants her business to grow so that she can ensure the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Las clientas del grupo Hortencia vienen de la Aldea Tzucubal Ixtahuacan, la cual esta muy retirada del área urbana y es rural en esencia. Debido a eso, muchas de las clientas reflejan una actitud tímida al comienzo, pero luego de unas cuentas bromas ellas reflejan su verdadera personalidad, una de confianza en si mismas y muy determinante.

Muchas de nuestras clientas dentro del banco comunal Hortencia tuvieron un pasado muy humilde. Ellas han trabajado como tejedoras a pequeña escala, en el campo cosechando mazorcas en las milpas, pescando o lavando ropa. Sin embargo, cuando Friendship Bridge les dio la oportunidad de un préstamo ellas decidieron cambiar su futuro.

La mayoría de las clientas están solicitando un crédito de un monto alto de aproximadamente de US$300. Eso refleja que las clientas están teniendo negocios exitosos. El éxito de sus negocios también se puede ver como un producto a su constancia de trabajo. Este préstamo que van a solicitar va a ser su décimo préstamo con la institución.

Las señoras van a usar sus préstamos principalmente para la compra de materia prima para producir trajes típicos y para la compra y venta de ellos también. A pesar de que la inversión del crédito de la gran mayoría de señoras vaya a ser invertido en tejidos y pueda causar una sobre saturación de mercado, las clientas están confiadas en el éxito de sus negocios porque los tejidos de Nahualá tienen una demanda asegurada por la calidad y belleza de estos.

Doña Lucia Quiché le encantaría que su negocio se expandiera para que así ella pudiera comprar un carro y no tener que llevar su mercadería todos los días al mercado. Manuela T., la tesorera del banco comunal dice que ella quiere que su negocio crezca para que así ella pueda asegurarle la educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for making huipiles (traditional dresses).  To sell traditional clothing, dresses, and skirts.

loans.name: Numon

texts.en: Numon N. lives in Yova; he is married and has 5 children. Numon N. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he is a serious and strongly motivated client.  At MLF Microinvest, loan amounts are increased for those who show business stability and increase their income. Numon has a business including the raising and selling of sheep as well as meat and sheep-hair production. He wants to purchase a pedigree ram for further sheep raising and meat production (it is supplied to bazaars). Mr.N. requests a loan of 3,100 TJS (US$900) for a pedigree ram purchase that allows him to significantly increase the family income and to further expand the business.

loans.use: Pedigree ram purchase

loans.name: Nohbala

texts.en: Nohbala G. drives a large pickup truck in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Nohbala is 37 years old and is married with three children. He has been working in this field for the last five years. He is currently looking for funding so that he can make repairs and improvements to his truck.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his truck.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Miss. Vanny S. is single and lives with her parents. She has four brothers and four sisters. She and her family live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Two of her sisters weave silk at home and one of her brothers works at a company in Phnom Penh. Vanny has been a silk weaver since 1995. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $150. She will use this money to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Yanet's Group

texts.es:
Miriam and Yanet have been members of the Communal Bank Ayllu, which means "Familia" in Quechua for 4 and 8 months respectively. Mirian is 27 years old, lives with her partner and has a 1 year old son. Along with her sister, Miriam has been raising and fattening cattle for about a year. The cattle is purchased in the animal fair and she sells them in the city of Lima. Additionally, Miriam and her husband have auto mechanic shop.

Yanet, on the other hand, is 30 years old, married and has two children. She has a small alterations shop at her home and also works as an assistant at a garment workshop. Additionally, Yanet also has a small grocery store.

Miriam and Yanet need loans for 600 soles and 1500 soles. They will be used to purchase balanced food for animals and a flat-bed sewing (mending) machine. Their saving will be used to start a new business and to set up her own garment workshop.
