Miriam's dreams are to have a store where she sells lubricants, to build her house and that her children become professionals. Yanet's dreams are to have her own garment workshop, build her house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Miriam y Yanet pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa “Familia” en quechua hace 4, 8 meses respectivamente.

Miriam es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Miriam junto a su hermana se dedican al engorde de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza hace 1 año, el ganado es comprado en las feria de animales y la venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Lima. Además Miriam junto a su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz.

Mientras que Yanet es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Yaneth tiene un pequeño taller de composturas de prendas de vestir en su casa y también trabaja como ayudante en un taller de confecciones. Además, Yanet tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

Miriam y Yanet necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento balanceado para animales y comprar su maquina remalladora.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán para iniciar un nuevo negocio e implementar su taller de confecciones. Los sueños de Miriam y Yanet son tener una tienda de lubricantes, taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase balanced food for animals and a flat-bed sewing (mending) machine.

loans.name: Jonathan Arnulfo

texts.es:
Jonathan Jiménez was helping his father in his taco business until he decided to start his own business, motivated by the family's economic situation and his desire to better himself. He started 5 years ago with the aim to provide his parents with economic support for the family while establishing his own economic independence and bettering himself in life. At various times in the past, he had considered going to the USA to work, but his business has motivated him to stay in his community.

He is requesting a loan for $500 which he will repay in 6 months . He will use the loan to buy a property to house his business. With your help Jonathan will continue to build his taco business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jonathan Jiménez le ayudaba a su padre con el negocio de tacos hasta que decidió iniciar su propio negocio debido a la situación económica familiar y al deseo de superarse. Comenzó hace 5 años debido a la situación familiar y con el deseo de brindar apoyo económico a sus padres y lograr tener independencia económica, el deseo de superarse en la vida, aun que había pensado en varias ocasiones irse a los estados unidos a trabajar, pero su negocio lo ha motivado a quedarse en su comunidad.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un mueble para su negocio. Con tu ayuda Jonathan seguirá con su taquería.

loans.use: Buy a property to  house his business

loans.name: Yurina De Los Angele

texts.es:
Yurina S. U. has worked with the Fundación Leon Institution for three years, obtaining five loans total. She is the single mother of a little girl who lives with her relatives. She sells general merchandise and also works in conjunction with her father, a tailor, in the clothing business. She provides materials to her father, who creates the pieces that Yurina then sells. Additionally, she sells products such as cosmetics, underwear, gold-plated items, children's clothing, etc. With this financing, she intends to buy fabric and general supplies with the goal of offering a better selection now that a favorable time for commerce is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yurina S. U. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres años obteniendo cinco creditos, Ella es madre soltera tiene una niña tierna ella vive con familiares, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general ademas trabaja en conjunto con su padre en la confección de ropa ya que su padre es sastre por tanto ella le provee de los materiales el papa elabora las piezas y ella las vende, ademas ella vende productos como: cosmeticos, ropa interior, oro laminado, ropa de niños etc. Con este financiamiento pretende comprar telas y productos en general esto con el fin de tener una mayor oferta ya viene una buena temporada para el comercio.

loans.use: Working capital, fabric and clothing, cosmetics, gold-plated items, and more.

loans.name: Umbrella Komeh Avenue Group

texts.en:
Abdul is the group leader and the group has been functional for two years as a savings and rotating club. Abdul is 42 years old and married with 4 children, all in school. Abdul said that his dream is to see his children through their education so that they will be able to take care of him in his old age. School expense is the largest budget item for Abdul and he works hard to meet his budget.

Aminata Kabbia sells shoes and both members would like to expand their businesses to generate more income. Therefore, they are requesting a loan of Le.1,600,000

loans.use: Increase stock of basic medicines, and shoes

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Mr. Salif Y. is 49 years old and lives with his two wives and seven children, in Sanoubougou I, a district in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). After several unsuccessful businesses, he specialized in selling sound system equipment and accessories (radios, cassettes, solar panels, parabolic antennae, etc.), which he has now been doing for 10 years. He gets his supplies from Bamako and sells his things for cash or retail wholesale in his shop located at the bus station. His clientele mainly consists of bus travelers and several young music-lovers in the city of Sikasso. In order to obtain complementary resources to be able to diversify his business, he decided to try Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program, which just granted him his first individual loan. With this loan, he plans to buy 15 radios of different brands, 2 solar panels, 3 boxes of batteries, and 200 audio cassettes. The expected profit is around 250,000 CFA francs, which will be used to pay interest on his loan and to reinvest in his business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Salif Y. a 49 ans et vit avec ses deux femmes et ses 7 enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Après plusieurs activités économiques sans succès, il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de materiels de sonorisation et accessoires (radios, cassettes, panneaux solaires, antennes paraboliques etc...) depuis maintenant 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne géneralement à Bamako et vend ses articles au comptant en détail ou en demi gros à Sikasso dans sa boutique sise à la gare routière. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de voyageurs de routiers et plusières jeunes mélomanes de la ville de Sikasso. Pour obtenir des ressources complementaires afin de diversifier son activité, il decida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso qui vient de lui octroyer son premier pret indivuduel. Avec ce pret Il compte acheter 15 radios de marques différentes, 2 panneaux solaires, 3 cartons de batéries blindées et 200 cassettes audio. Le bénéfice envisagé est de l’ordre de 250 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: To purchase radios, solar panels, batteries, and cassettes

loans.name: Miriam Yanina

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad.

Miriam es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Miriam tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Quinuapata, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, pollo, artículos de librería, regalos, En un inicio su tienda estaba en la casa de sus suegros y hace 2 meses se mucho a su casa, que construyo en el ultimo año, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija y su esposo.

Miriam necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, aceite y leche.

Miriam sueña con tener una tienda al por mayor, sus hijos sean profesionales y ahorrar dinero para su vejez.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Miriam is a member of the Communal Prosperity Bank. Miriam is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children; Miriam has a shop in her home in Quinuapata where she sells groceries, vegetables, chicken, gifts, etc. The shop began in the home of her in laws and 2 months ago she moved it to her new home which was built in the last year (done with the help of her daughter and her husband). Miriam needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, milk and oil. Miriam dreams of having a wholesale shop, having children who are professionals and being able to save money for her old age.

loans.use: Miriam needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, milk and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restart her small business of selling sandwiches and juices.

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
En la zona de villa Adela, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Las conquistadoras” Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por diez mujeres, trabajan de manera organizada hace un año.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Las Conquistadoras, son de todo tipo, una de  ellas tiene una farmacia, otras realizan tejidos de chompas, también se  dedican a venta de accesorios para el cabello, venta de maletines, venta de mandiles , entre otros.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, para  poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
In the region of Villa Adela, in the area bearing the same name, there is an association named "Las Conquistadoras". They are a very happy group of ten women that hae been working together for the past year. The occupations held by "Las Conquistadoras" are of all sorts: one runs a pharmacy, others knit shawls, others sell hair styling products, bags, and aprons, among others.

They have stated that they require working capital to purchase their products and supplies in wholesale, so to expand their businesses and to improve their earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Require working capital to purchase products and supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov K., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Ny, 26, live along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2001 and have two sons, who study at the local school.

Pov has been a motor taxi driver for seven years. He carries goods and people from his village to the market. His wife has been a tailor for three years. Pov needs money to buy a trailer for his motorbike, so that he can drive a tuk tuk. This will give him an opportunity to earn more money than driving a motor taxi. So he is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a trailer for driving a tuk tuk.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike trailer for driving a tuk tuk

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny S. is a farmer and lives in Phdau Chum Koeut village in Kampong Cham province.  She owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice. 

On this plantation, she can earn a little rice revenue to provide a better life for her family.  In order to improve her living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase five piglets to start a pig breeding business, and pig food for her breeding. 

Mrs. Ny S. is 33-years-old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase five piglets to start a pig breeding business, and pig food for her breeding.

loans.name: Nasareta

texts.en: Nasareta K., 25, is married with 1 child.  She has many years of experience preparing and selling porkmeat with bread rolls. She sells to the people in her village and to the general public six days every week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  With this loan she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala.  SPBD loans are Nasareta’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Loan will be used to buy ingredients to run her pork meat with bread roll business.

loans.use: Purchase mutton, pork, flour, yeast and cooking gas

loans.name: Bunnarith

texts.en:
Mr. Bunnarith H., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Sokmoeun Soy, 32, live in a small village off National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children attends school and another one is still young.

Bunnarith has been driving a motor cart for two years. He carries garment factory workers from his village to the garment factory, and from garment factory back to his village. His wife has been a garment factory worker since 1991. Bunnarith is requesting a loan of US$300 to pay for his house remodeling fee.

loans.use: To pay for his house remodeling fee.

loans.name: Bui's Group

texts.vi:
Bùi Thị L. A. sinh năm 1981( Mã số: 010105030023 ) gia đình chị có 4 người, vợ chồng chị có một con còn nhỏ. Chồng chị có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng, A. hiện đang là đầu bếp cho một khách sạn ở Hà Nội. Còn chị, hang ngày đi bán hang quà bánh cho học sinh có thu nhập theo ngày. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/ tháng.Với món vay trả dần theo tuần là rất phù hợp với gia đình chị và tạo cho vợ chồng chị có thói quen tiết kiệm nên A. chi rất thích và muốn tham gia lâu dài tại tài chính vi mô Bình minh.
Lần vay vốn này, chị tham gia mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ. Cùng vay vốn với chị còn có: 
 Ngô Thị A. sinh năm 1970, ( Mã số: 010105030019) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán trứng gà, chổi tre,…. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/ tháng.
 Mai Thị N. sinh năm 1957( Mã số: 010105030020 ) . Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, thu nhập bình quân vủa gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi ao cá.
 Hoàng Thị Thường sinh năm 1958. ( Mã số: 010105030021 ) Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị klhoảng: 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Vũ Thị Lương sinh năm 1982 . ( Mã số: 010105030024 ) Chị có nghề đan chiếu thu nhập bình quân khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để mua nguyên vật liệu đan chiếu.
texts.en:
Bui T. L. A. (ID:010105030023 ) was born in 1981. Her family has four members, with one child at young age. Her husband has a stable monthly salary, he is currently a chef at a hotel in Hanoi. She sells sweets and cakes to school children to get a daily income. The average income of her family is about VND4,000,000 per month. A loan with weekly repayment is suitable to her family and creates a saving habit, therefore she is interested in a long term participation with Binh Minh Micro Finance. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 for her petty trade. Other members in the group include:

Mrs. Ngo T. A., born 1970 (ID:010105030019), wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 for petty trades (hen's eggs, bamboo brooms, etc). The average income of her family is about VND2,000,000 per month.

Mrs. Mai T. N., born 1957 (ID:010105030020 ). Her family main business is agricultural, with the family's average monthly income of VND3,000,000. She wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 to invest in her fish pond.

Mrs. Hoang T. T., born 1058 (ID: 010105030021 ), wishes to borrow VND4,142,000 to raise chickens. The average income of her family is about VND3,000,000 per month.

Mrs. Vu T. L., born 1982 (ID: 010105030024). She weave mats with average income of VND2,500,000 per month. She wishes to borrow VND 4,142,000 to buy materials for mat weaving.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For petty trades

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene sesenta y dos años no obstante su alegría es contagiante y el optimismo con que mira hacia el futuro también. Ella junto con su esposo maneja una zapatería  ubicado en un local propio situado dentro de un mercado.

Desde 1991, que se animaron a poner un negocio propio. Anteriormente su esposo trabajaba en un a compañía como electricista. Una vez que abandono aquel trabajo por su jubilación no dudó en abrir una zapatería pues él ya tenia conocimientos sobre refacción de zapatos. 

Maria lleva cinco años contando con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, gracias a ellos a podido implementar mejor la zapatería. Por ahora desea mantener la producción y cantidad de trabajo. Por otro lado, ella también es propietaria de un auto que lo hace trabajar como taxi para poder contar con un ingreso más de dinero y con ello poder pagar los estudios de su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Maura is 62 years old, but her happiness and the optimism with which she looks towards the future is contagious. She, together with her husband, manages a shoe store located in their own shop in a market. In 1991 they decided to venture out and set up their own business. Previously her husband worked for a company as an electrician. Once he left his job on retirement he didn't hesitate to open up a shoe store because he had shoe-repair knowledge and skills. Maura has been with EDAPROSPO (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 5 years, and thanks to them she has managed to improve the shoe store. For now she wishes to maintain the production and quality of the business. She is also the owner of a car that she uses as a taxi to be able to have a second source of income, to be able to pay their youngest son's tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for the shoe store.

loans.name: Mujeres Habiles Group

texts.en:
Josefina P. R. is the leader of a group called “Mujeres Habiles,” which means “Able Women” in English. This is Josefina’s second loan with Esperanza and she is hoping that this investment in her business will help it grow. She sells a variety of products in her store, such as bathroom products and intimate wear.

Josefina and her husband of seven years, Julio, have two children, ages five and six. Her goals are to improve and expand her business and be able to buy more products to sell. Eventually she would like to be able to buy a place to house her business, which is currently run out of her home. Another goal is to buy supplies in bigger quantities. When not working or spending time with her family, Josefina loves to read.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy more supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El sr. FRANCISCO, es natural de la provincia de Urubamba en el distrito de chincheros en la comunidad de qollana, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos en transporte público de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio alterna sus actividades principales que son la agricultura y la ganadería con el servicio de taxi en la ruta de Cusco a Chincheros y Urubamba, el socio tiene 39 años de edad, es casado con la sra. Sonia que también es nuestra socia, ellos tiene 4 hijos de (14, 13, y 2 gemelos de 9) años; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y un ganadito.

El sr. Francisco esta muy agradecido con el préstamo otorgado y reitera su compromiso de cancelar su deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Mr. FRANCISCO is a native of the Urubamba province, in the qollana community of the chincheros district, located 1 hour and 10 minutes from Cusco by public transport. The parter alternates his main activities between agriculture and livestock, with a taxi service route between Cusco to Chincheros and Urubamba. He is 39 years old, and is married to Mrs. Sonia who is also a partner. They have 4 children (14, 13, and 9 year old twins). Our partner requests a loan to buy spare parts and livestock. Mr. Francisco is very grateful for the loan and he reiterates his commitment to cancel his debt within the scheduled time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts and livestock.

loans.name: Dexie

texts.en: Mrs. Dexie E. is a 48-year-old from Poblacion Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter/ farmer and blessed with two children. She started a business with a minimal amount of capital. Being a member of Paglaum MPC, she was able to acquire additional capital for her business. She sells snacks to neighbors, friends and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business. Now she wants a loan of PHP 7,000. Determination in life is what she has. Her heart’s desire is to have a small stall for a sari-sari (variety) store and to send their children to school and witness them be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas and ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Aelerjon

texts.ru: Эргашев Элёржон-молодой человек1985 года рождения ,женат имеет 2 детей ,жена  Холбоева Шахноза .Клиент берёт кредит  для расширения  своего бизнеса . Элёржон  занимается купля продажей и откормом  скота .Ему в этом помогает отец . Дополнительно Элёржон  занимается  выращиванием и переработкой сельхозпродуктов , чтобы пополнить свой семейный бюджет.На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить 2-х  бычков, откормив их в течении3-4 месяцев, продаст их за хорошую цену.
texts.en:
Born in 1985, Aelerjon A. is married and has 2 children. His wife is Shahnoza Kholboeva. He requested this loan for business expansion. Aelerjon is involved in livestock feeding and sales. His father helps him with this business. In addition, Aelerjon is involved in growing and processing of agricultural products in order to subsidize his family budget. He plans to use this loan to purchase two bulls, feed them for 3-4 months and then resell them at a good price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Oeurn C., 33, has been selling groceries in front of her house for nine years. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, plastic goods, canned food, and sweets for kids. She earns around $3 income per day. As another income source, her husband raises pigs as well as distills white wine from their home. This couple has a teenage child who attends school and is still under their care. Oeurn C. is requesting a loan to purchase additional piglets to breed. With the remainder of the loan she will buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to breed.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia R. is a 60 year old widow with three adult children. She is from Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental and has been a member of Paglaum MPC since last January 2008. She demonstrates excellent performance in terms on loan repayments.

She would like a loan in the amount of Php 5,000 to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store, such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks, and other household items. She hopes to enrich her family's way of living and expand the business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Majengo Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is a 29-year-old woman, who is married and the mother of 3 children. Her children are aged 9, 6 and 2 years.

Grace has her own grocery business selling drinks like soda and beer. She has had this business for 4 years. She works for 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Grace’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer for her shop. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Grace hopes to expand her business.

Matha S., another member of the Majengo borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business.

Martha Elieke, also a member of the Majengo borrower group, has requested a loan of 200,000 Schillings for her business of selling vitenge and kanga (fabric).

loans.use: To buy more beer

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif was born in 1960. He is married. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, now settled in Baku city.

Sixteen years ago, he started taxi business. Now he needs s loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the spare parts needed to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts needed to improve his taxi business

loans.name: Cagumbay

texts.en:
Cagumbay E. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Cagumbay is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Cagumbay owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cagumbay has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cagumbay joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cagumbay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Cagumbay is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cagumbay from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Aguedo Candelario

texts.es:
Candelario tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el pueblo joven Carlos Stein, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El y su esposa son propietarios de un negocio de reparación y venta de anteojos, tienen un pequeño puesto en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de Chiclayo (el principal mercado de la ciudad), donde venden sus productos todos los días, también los vende los fines de semana en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ellos compran su mercancía en la ciudad de Lima y en Guayaquil (Ecuador).

El año anterior dejaron temporalmente su negocio para dedicarse a la agricultura en la ciudad de Tumbes, pero no les fue bien, por lo que este año regresaron a continuar con su actividad habitual, actualmente desea invertir en la compra de más anteojos para mantener su negocio por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su anhelo más grande es crear a futuro una óptica en un local más amplio y con lo que perciba de este negocio terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una mejor educación a sus menores hijos.

Candelario es muy estimado por sus vecinos que lo consideran un padre de familia carismático, luchador y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar en el momento que se le necesita.
texts.en:
Candelario is 40 years old, lives with his wife and two children in the town of Carlos Stein, district of José Leonardo Ortiz, located 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He and his wife are owners of an eyeglass sale and repair shop. They have a little place in the outer part of the Mercado Modelo de Chiclayo (the main market in the city) where they sell their products everyday; he also sells them in the weekends in the city of Ferreñafe. They buy their merchandise from the cities of Lima and Guayaquil (Ecuador).

Last year, they temporarily left the business to farm in the city of Tumbes, but things did not go well, so they came back to their eyeglass business. They want to buy more glasses to keep their business, which is why for the first time they are requesting a loan of 1500 soles.

His greatest wish for the future is to have a bigger place for their optical business and whatever profit they get, they hope to finish building their home and provide a better education to their young children.

Candelario is very well respected by his neighbors who consider him a very charismatic father, a fighter who is always ready to help in a moments notice.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eyeglasses to expand his business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Justina es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Justina vende frutas, verduras de manera ambulatoria de casa en casa, además Justina brinda el servicio de llamadas telefónicas, tiene 6 equipos.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de equipos de celulares.
Los sueños de Justina son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener local propio y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Millennium Community Bank. She is a 40-year-old mother of five children and lives with her common-law husband. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables door to door, and also offers telephone services in her neighborhood. She has six phones. Justina is requesting a loan of 900 soles (approximately $325), which she plans to invest in the purchase of cellular phones. Her dreams are to provide her children with a good education, to have her own store and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cellular phones

loans.name: Onaghise

texts.en: A. sells hair extensions materials, provisions and clothes. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She has been in the business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N120000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks  to sell

loans.name: Cecilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora CECILIA DEL ROSARIO C. B., tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS AURORAS EN ACCION. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria,  es madre conviviente y tiene un hijo de 1 año y 3 meses de edad. La socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles comprò productos de belleza como: lociones, cremas, labiales, joyas, polvos, rubores, etc. 
Con este crédito de 300 nuevos soles comprará también productos de belleza como: colonias, labiales, joyas, talcos, etc. para tener en stock y poder así vender con mayor facilidad y aprovechar que al comprar en ofertas logrará una mayor ganancia.
Cecilia sueña con aumentas sus ventas y ahorrar al máximo para así poder tener el capital  suficiente para  alquilar un puesto en el  mercado y vender ahí también sus cosméticos.
texts.en:
Sra. Cecilia del Rosario C. B. is 35 years old and lives in the District of Salaverry, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Auroras en Acción”. Cecilia completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She is in a common law marriage and has a child who is 15 months old. She sells cosmetics and used her first loan of 300 soles to buy beauty products such as lotions, crèmes, lipsticks, powders, blush, as well as jewelry.

Cecilia is requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy additional beauty products such as colognes, lipsticks, talcum, as well as more jewelry. She would like to take stock of these items so that she can sell them more easily and generate more earnings. Cecilia dreams of increasing her sales so that she can save as much money as possible to build up her capital. She hopes to rent a stall in the market where she can sell cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: El señor José Gabriel O. y su esposa la señora Claudia Gabriela y su pequeñito forman una familia joven pero unida trabajando para un mismo fin, que es el estar cómodos y comprometidos en su hogar, el labora para una empresa en el área de almacenista desde hace 2 años, su esposa por su parte trabaja para un despacho como secretaria desde hace 4 años. Juntos están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su vivienda para brindarle a su casa una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
José Gabriel O., his wife Claudia Gabriela, and their little son make up a young but united family who are working toward a common goal: to be comfortable in and committed to their home. He has worked as a warehouse stock person for the past two years and his wife has been a secretary for the past 4 years. Together they are seeking financing to build a wall in front of their home to provide it with better security.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Señor José P. C. es una persona que labora en la Dirección General de Ingreso. Es Casado tiene dos hijos. Este cliente ha obtenido dos créditos con CEPRODEL el que ha utilizado para mejora de la vivienda y la compra de un aparato de topográfica el cual lo utiliza en su desempeño laboral. Es una persona con un excelente  record crediticio. Es una persona trabajadora y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sr. José P. C. works for the Director General of Income (the local tax authority). He is married and has two children. José obtained two previous loans from CEPRODEL that were used for home improvements and the purchase of a topography apparatus that he uses for his job. He has an excellent credit record and is known for working hard and making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase topography equipment for use in his job

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie B. is from the city of Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old. Connie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Connie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Connie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Connie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Connie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Connie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth sells foodstuffs like tomato paste, rice, oil, beans and drinks. She has been in business for the past ten years and with this trade she assists her husband with the children's upbringing. Ruth is a faithful LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to enable her to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks in bulk, which will enable her to meet customers' demands while increasing her profits. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Ruth is 49 years old and has five children. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gloria Bernice

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Bernice, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Gloria Bernice, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, lleva 08 años en el negocio. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en el cumplimiento de sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Gloria Bernice belongs to the communal bank "Brigada Ramírez in the Lamas district of the Lamas province, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 45 years old, and has two children who are dependent on her.

Gloria Bernice decided to sell prepared meals from her own home, which is well set-up for serving her customers. She has been in this business for 8 years. She tells us that she has good takings everyday, thanks to the delicious flavor of the food that she makes. Her main customers are residents of the city, passers-by, and regulars who know her well. She can count on a good reception.

Currently, she is continuing with this same business and is very happy with the work that she does from day to day, selling from 6:00am to 2:00pm. She attends to her customers herself, with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy supplies for the daily preparation of her foods, such as rice by the kilo, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, crates of chickens, vegetables, and also some tools for running her business and giving better attention to her customers.

She wants to keep moving ahead, and she has many dreams and goals in her life such as running her own well equipped grocery store. At the same time she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the realization of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy food preparation supplies

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Before the loan, Leonora R. worried how she was going to support her children. Now, she doesn’t worry anymore because CEVI is providing her loan in her “buy and sell” business. Leonora sells firewood in their village. She sold it by bundles and the income, which she gained from her business, was really helpful in paying the school and basic expenses in their home. She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She chooses CEVI because they are not just providing loans but they provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Chidi

texts.en: Chidi is a businessman. He sells textbooks to his customers at retail prices. He hopes to own a big bookstore in the future. He loves this business because it gives him the opportunity to meet one-on-one with his customers. Chidi is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more textbooks to sell. He sells for long hours to enable him put food on his table to feed his children. He is 45 years old and married with five children. His eldest child is 10 years old. He is always happy when he sees his children excelling in school. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad.
Doris es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Doris tiene un puesto alquilado en el mercado chorro en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Doris necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Doris sueña con construir su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales y ser mayorista de carne.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter. Doris has a rented space at the Chorro Market where she sells meat every day.

She needs a loan of 1800 PEN in order to buy pigs. Doris dreams of building a house, seeing her children become professionals, and becoming a meat wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Frutos De Vida Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado Frutos de Vida y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos se dedican a diferentes negocios independientes tales como: repostería, fabricación de monturas y espuelas, costuras, venta de ropa usada, leña y carbón y reciclaje de cobre, bronce y aluminio.
La socia entrevistada fue María Magdalena, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra sentada en 1º fila, en el 4º asiento de izquierda a derecha. Ella vende materiales reciclables como cartón, botellas, metales, fierros y chatarras (como las latas de bebida), negocio al cual se dedica desde hace 39 años. Tiene 2 hijos ya adultos y su hija también pertenece a este grupo y vende comida rápida. 
María Magdalena invertirá este préstamo en mercadería, ya que ella no solo recolecta, sino que también compra lo que necesite. Además tiene la motivación de comenzar con la venta de papas fritas en un carrito que armó de a poco con préstamos anteriores, el cual se ubica en su casa. Para ello comprará aceite, papas, papel, aderezos (ketchup y mostaza) y servilletas. 
Para ella ha sido muy importante trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un gran apoyo económico, moral y motivacional, gracias a las reuniones semanales de grupo en donde comparte con sus compañeros y aprende sobre cómo debe administrar su negocio. Para María Magdalena es muy importante mantenerse ocupada y útil, ya que hace un tiempo tuvo depresión y su negocio le ayudó a recuperarse.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.  Si bien esta zona fue dañada por el reciente terremoto que afectó a Chile, este Banco Comunal no sufrió graves efectos por el mismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Frutos de Vida. It is made up of 18 members, residents of the city of Temuco. They work in different independent businesses such as: pastrymaking, manufacturing of saddles and spurs, sewing, selling used clothes, firewood and charcoal, and recycling copper, bronze and aluminum. The member who was interviewed was María Magdalena, the president of the group. In the photo, she is seated in the first row, fourth from the left. She sells recyclable materials such as cardboard, bottles, metal, iron, and scrap (such as beverage cans). She has been at the business for 39 years. She has two adult children and her daughter also belongs to this group and sells fast food. María Magdalena will invest this loan in merchandise, since she doesn't only collect but also buys whatever she needs. She also has the motivation to begin to sell french fries in a cart she outfitted a little with previous loans. The cart is at her house. For this she will buy oil, potatoes, paper, condiments (ketchup and mustard), and napkins. For her it has been very important to work with Fondo Esperanza. It has been a big financial, moral and motivational support, thanks to the weekly meetings in which she shares with the other members and learns about how to manage her business. For María Magdalena, it is very important to stay busy and useful. Some time ago she was depressed and her business helped her to get better. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is 670 kilometers from Santiago ( the capital of Chile). It has a series of lake beaches and very striking native flora and fauna. It's worth noting that in this region live 50% of the Mapuches, an indigenous group that exists in our country. This area was damaged by the recent earthquake that affected Chile, but this communal bank suffered no ill effects from it.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Oil, potatoes, paper, condiments and napkins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional used-clothing for her business

loans.name: Sanchez

texts.en:
Sanchez A. I. is from the village of Malintubuan, Labaoson Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 35 years old. Sanchez is married. To make a living, Sanchez owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Sanchez has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sanchez joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Sanchez has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Sanchez is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which wI. be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This wI. be the 2nd loan taken out by Sanchez from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another computer for her son's architectural business

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 53 años,  es una mujer muy trabajadora,  vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas y cigarros, durante todos los días se ubica en la puerta de un casino, ubicado a 6 cuadras de su casa.  Es así que todas las tardes se avoca a esta labor que le gusta mucho, y por las mañanas trabaja como empleada del hogar  en la casa de una vecina. De esta manera con el desempeño de su trabajo y su  negocio de golosinas Cirila, ha sido un gran apoyo  para su esposo, y  juntos  han construido un sólido hogar. La labor que más le gusta  es la comercialización pues se distrae bastante, y para más adelante tiene pensado adquirir un kiosco y de ese modo mejorar la condición de su negocio.Este es su doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y asegura que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas pues ha sido beneficioso  en el desarrollo de su negocio. En su grupo, es una socia muy responsable, por lo que se ha ganado el respeto de sus compañeros.Cirila tiene planeado  incrementar su mercadería en golosinas, y de ese modo quiere ofrecer lo mejor  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cirila is 53 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children. For six years, she has sold snacks and cigarrettes. Every day she sells in the door of a casino, located 6 blocks from her house. Every day she does this work that she likes a lot and mornings she works as a house employee in a neighbor's house. This way, with her job and her snack business, Cirila has been a big support to her husband and together they have been able to build a solid home. The work that she likes the most is selling; it is interesting to her. In the future, she plans on having a kiosk and in this way improve her business. This is her twelfth loan with MFP and she assures us she will make the payments on time since the loans have been beneficial to the development of her business. In her group, she is a very responsible member. She has earned the respect of the other members. Cirila is planning on increasing her snack merchandise, and in this way offer the best to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise and snacks for her business

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Moa P., 52, is a low-income person currently living in Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she sells some cooking supplies to the neighbors from her home. Typically, she is earning an average of $3 a day as support for her family. Moa P. is married to Beung Ponh, age 57, a land trader. He also helps his neighbors buy a plot of land for a commission. This older couple now lives with three single children; one of whom works in construction and the others are attending school. This is the second loan Moa P. has requested. She will use this loan to buy more grocery items and to buy rice, in bulk, which she will sell out when the commanding price is high.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items and to buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 28-year-old young man from Jenin. He is married and has a one-year old son. Khaled works for the National Palestinian Authority. He was married 3 years ago and is still trying to furnish his house, which is a hard task with the basic salary he receives. Therefore, he took a $1500 loan from FATEN to pay for home furniture.

Khaled's house is very simple and consists of the very basic needs and lacks a lot of of furniture. Khaled is thinking of taking another loan after finishing with the home furniture, and of starting a business as a second source of income, so he can afford a better living standard and secure his wife and son's life.

In the picture, Khaled is leaving FATEN's office.

loans.use: Pay for home furniture

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina, D. 46 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su esposo Evaristo (54), con quien tiene 3 jóvenes hijos, D. los cuales sólo vive con Neykel (7), pues sus dos hijos mayores, trabajan D. manera independiente.DesD. hace 8 años, se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería, junto a su esposo, quien todos los días desD. las 5 D. la mañana se dirige al campo a labrar sus chacras, donD. siembra papa, alverja, maíz, alfalfa y diversas verduras. Mientras que ella atienD. a las 4 vacas que crían, y D. donD. extraen leche a diario, que les sirve para elaborar unos deliciosos quesos, que venden en las tiendas D. la localidad , o también envían a familiares  para que los comercialicen en las ferias semanales D. la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar verduras porque pueD. disponer D. ellas, no solo para comercio, si no también para su consumo personal. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar  un centro recreacional  turístico en la casa donD. vive, también desea  construir una casa en la ciudad, para alquilar cuartos, y generarse mejores ingresos.Es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y dentro D. su grupo comunal, trabaja D. manera activa, y siempre habla D. la honradez, por eso es muy respetada por todos los integrantes, que son personas solidarias y responsables.Albina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D.  varios sacos D. guano que necesita  para esparcirlos en sus cultivos ya desarrollados D. alverja, alfalfa y maíz, D. esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Albina, age 46, lives in her own home in the company of her husband Evaristo (54), with whom she has 3 children. Of her children, she lives only with Neykel (7), because her two older children are working independently. For the past 8 years, Albina has worked in farming and ranching together with her husband, who goes out every day starting at 5 in the morning to work in their fields, where they plant potatoes, peas, corn, alfalfa and a variety of vegetables. Meanwhile, Albina takes care of the 4 cows they are raising, which produce milk every day. Albina and her husband use the milk to make various delicious cheeses. They sell the cheese in local stores and also send it to some relatives who sell it in the weekly markets in the city. What Albina likes most is planting vegetables, because she can use them not only to sell, but also for the family's personal consumption. For the future, she plans to construct a recreational facility for tourists in the house where she lives. She would also like to build a house in the city in order to rent rooms and generate a better income for her family. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is a very active member within her communal bank. She is always talking about honesty, for which she is highly respected by all of the members, who are people of great solidarity and responsibility. Albina plans to invest the funds she is requesting in buying several sacks of guano, which she needs to fertilize her fields that are already planted with peas, alfalfa and corn. In this way she hopes to continue making good progress.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying guano to improve the productivity of her planted fields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of soap to sell to her customers

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
la señora Deysi M. vive en la aldea Laure Abajo en San Lorenzo, tiene 11 años de vivir en dicho lugar, ahi se establecio junto con su familia,  ya que el huracan mitch le arrebato su casa y a tenido que luchar para poder crear nuevamente su hogar.
 
Deisy se dedica a la comercializacion de productos de la canasta familiar y tambien vende refrescos.
su negocio lo aperturo hace unos tres años.
Deisy es una persona muy humilde y honesta, vende sus productos en su casa en donde los vecinos compran jabon, cuajada, queso, paletas, ropa y plasticos a demas vende flores para la epoca de el dia de los santos. 
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos al por mayor de varios tamaños, 3 litros, 2.5 litros, 2 litros, 1.5 litros, 1.25 litros, 1/2 litros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deisy M. lives in the village of Laure Abajo in San Lorenzo. She has lived there for 11 years. She settled there with her family after Hurricane Mitch destroyed her house. She has had to struggle since then to establish a new home. Deisy sells basic groceries and soft drinks. She opened her store about three years ago. Deisy is a very humble and honest person. She sells her products from home where her neighbors come to buy soap, cottage-cheese, cheese, popsicles, clothes, plastic items. She also sells flowers for the Saint Days. She will use the funds to buy soft drinks at wholesale in 3, 2.5, 2, 1.5, 1.25 and 0.5 liter sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Sartawi De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Sartawi de San Roque”, se ha organizado y capacitado para iniciar su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana, este nuevo grupo consta de ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón,  a la cabeza la señora Virginia como presidenta. 

La  señora Virginia refiere que es su primera experiencia en nuestra institución, ella como el resto de la asociación fueron invitadas por las promotoras.  El negocio que lleva adelante requiere de conocimiento y una gran habilidad para negociar, pues la venta de fruta debe ser rápida y oportuna, caso contrario la mercadería se hecha a perder.  Su tía es  quien le enseñó a negociar con la fruta, a la fecha tiene  cuatro años en el mismo.

Para este crédito está solicitando Bs.2000, lo que le permitirá comprar variedad de frutas por mayor y llevarlas a vender por menor a la extranca de Río Seco, de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde;  lo bueno es que cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñada.

La A.C. “Sartawi de San Roque” cuenta con ocho integrantes que también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: venta de abarrotes, tejido de mantas, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas, tejido de guantes y chompas, tienda de barrio, tejido de todo, venta de vinos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Sartawi de San Roque” has been organized and trained to start their first loan cycle with the Panamericana Community Center. This new group consists of eight members, seven women and one man. The group is led by Sra. Virginia who acts as President.

Sra. Virginia is reporting on her first experience with Pro Mujer. She, like the rest of the group, was invited to join by the program promoters. Managing a business requires knowledge and the ability to negotiate. Since Virginia sells fruit, she must act in a prompt and timely manner or else she risks losing merchandise sales. Her aunt taught her about the fruit business, and to date, she has been in operation for four years.

For this loan, she is requesting 2000 BOB so that she can acquire a variety of fruit at wholesale that she can sell later at retail at the market in Río Seco where she works from 7am until 6pm. What is good is that she has the help of her sister-in-law.

The Communal Association “Sartawi de San Roque” has eight members who also have their own businesses which include selling groceries, weaving blankets, selling fruit, weaving gloves and sweaters, managing a neighborhood store, and selling wines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Esther María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jasmines en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal los Jazmines.

La señora Esther tiene 42 años y está casada hace 12 años, de esta linda relación procreó dos hermosos hijos de 10 y 11 años los cuales estudian en la escuela, su esposo tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en el Cantan Rocafuerte,  vive en la casa de sus suegros.
 
Es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, una amiga la invito y le ha gustado por su seriedad y por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Ella al igual que su esposo hace cinco años también puso una tienda en la casa donde vive y dice que le va bien. Trabaja todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, tiempo que comparte entre su trabajo, su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos ya que tiene que ayudarles en las tareas escolares.

Espera utilizar este crédito para surtir aun mas su tienda ya que sus clientes le piden productos que a veces no tiene y es así como va a utilizar su crédito para ganar más clientela.
 
Sus metas son que su negocio crezca, darles una buena educación a sus  hijos y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Los Jazmines (The Jasmines) communal bank meets in the Los Jasmines neighborhood of Portoviejo, Manabí department capital, known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarinds, every two weeks. Esther, 42, has been married for 12 years and has two beautiful children who are 10 and 11 years of age and are in school. Her husband has a grocery store in Rocafuerte canton. She lives in her in-laws’ house. This is her first cycle in the communal bank; a friend invited her to join and she’s liked it because of its seriousness and the ease with which loans are obtained. She, the same as her husband, set up a grocery store five years ago in the house where she lives and she says she does well. She is open for business every day from 6am until 7pm and during this time she also does her housework and cares for her children because she has to help them with their school homework assignments. She expects to use the funds to stock her store even more because her customers request products that she sometimes doesn’t have so she will use the loan to get more customers. Her goals are that the business grows, to give her children a good education and to own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, cheese, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling snacks for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Francisco Foquisso

texts.pt:
Francisco foquisso M. nasceu na Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, é casado pai de 3 filhos de 9, 13 e 14 anos todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria com sua família não responsabiliza se por ninguém, e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt por mês pois conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é negociante. 

Saiu de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha a procura de emprego. Primeiro trabalhou como empregado domestico durante 2 anos, mais tarde consegue um emprego melhor na Escola Secundária da Namaacha como Assistente Técnico, ainda com possibilidades de dar continuidade com seus estudos. Recebe um salario de 4.900.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda da sua esposa que é comerciante consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os três primeiros empréstimos de (5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 10.500.00mt) foram usados para habitação (legalização do terreno e inicio da obra).

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para manutenção de energia e pintura da sua casa.
texts.en:
Francisco Foquisso M. was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has three children ages 9, 13 and 14 years.  All the children go to school.  He lives in his own house with his family and is not responsible for anyone else, and he manages to save 1,000 meticais per month with the help of his wife, who is a businesswoman.

He left Inhambane to move to Namaacha District in search of work.  First, he worked as a domestic worker for two years.  Later, Francisco got a better job at Namaacha Secondary School as a Technical Assistant, where it is even possible for him to continue his own studies.  He receives a salary of 4,900 meticais per month, which he applies to household expenses.  With the help of his wife, who is a businesswoman, he even manages to save some money in his bank account.

Francisco has never had loans with other banks.  This 10,000 meticais loan is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his second with Kiva.  He intends to buy construction material (iron, cement, sand, stone and other materials) to continue work on his house.  The first three loans (for 5,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 10,500 meticais) were used for housing (securing the title to the land and beginning construction).

He is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of schedule and request a new loan to set up electrical service and paint his house.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stone, etc.)

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia  D. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Pandacan, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  food vending and a sari-sari store. She has 3 children who are between 33 and 37 years old.

Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials for business so that she can continue to save up for future assistance to her grandson to finish his studies. Delia D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody C. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Melody is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melody owns and operates a retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice in the local community. Melody has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melody joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melody is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Melody from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, D. 56 años, hace 1 año que enviudó. Y aunque se siente solo, no deja D. trabajar. Ya que su razón D. vivir son sus 4 hijos, a los que educa solo en su casa propia, ubicada en L. comunidad D. Santa Rosa Yapas. Este extraordinario hombre, que con una sonrisa borra sus preocupaciones, y trabaja con ahínco para apoyar a su familia, cuenta que hace 7 años que se dedica a L. agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan D. café y plátano, los que después D. cada cosecha venD. su producción en L. ciudad D. L. Merced y Santa Ana, donD. viaja constantemente. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es poder distraerse y concentrase en L. mejora D. sus cultivos, ya que según afirma, aún le hace falta su esposa, quien era su “socia, amiga y compañera”.  Pero en honor a su memoria el desea más adelante, concretizar los objetivos que se plantearon, uno D. ellos es L. obtención D. más terrenos agrícolas, donD. pueda sembrar en mayores cantidades. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y se siente agradecido, con su banco comunal, que le dio las fuerzas necesarias en está etapa difícil D. su vida. Ha pensado invertir el crédito en L. compra D. varios sacos D. abono para el café que está sembrando, ya que muy pronto trasplantará las plantas D. café D. su vivero.
texts.en:
Freddy is 56 years old, and became a widow one year ago.  And although he feels lonely, he doesn't stop working.  His reason for living are his four sons, whom he educates alone in his own house, located in the community of Santa Rosa Yapas.  This extraordinary man, that with a smile can erase all worries, and works hard to support his family, has been in agriculture for seven years.  His main crops are coffee and bananas, which after each harvest he sells his production in the city of L. Merced and Santa Ana, where he constantly travels.  

What he likes most about his work is that he is able to distract himself and concentrate in improving his harvests, since he still misses his wife, who was his "partner, friend, and companion".  In honor of her memory, he hopes to get ahead, and set the objectives that he is thinking about.  One of them is to obtain more agricultural land, where he can sow in greater quantities.  

This is the fourth loan with MFP, and he feels grateful for his community bank, that gave him the necessary strength in this difficult stage of his life.  He is thinking about investing the loan in the purchase of several sacks of fertilizer for the coffee that he is growing, since very soon he will transfer the coffee plants from the nursery.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Lom

texts.en:
Mrs. Lom C. (shown in the photo with her loom), is a widow with one son and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home and the other two work in a garment factory. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Mrs. Lom C. has been a silk weaver since 1979. She has already asked for one Kiva loan, and now she is asking for another loan of $700 to purchase weaving materials for  her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is a 42-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, a pig-raising business, and a fish businesses. She lives in Purok Paglaum, Barangay Taba-ao, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store, pig fattening and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. 

Marites is now borrowing PHP 16,000 to use in her businesses. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Marites aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Funds for her businesses

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 9, 6 años y el menor de 6 meses, los dos mayores están en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar en algo a los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, el cual tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad de Portoviejo en el que vende legumbres y frutas, trabaja de martes a domingo desde las 3h00 hasta las 13h00, sus productos los comprar en el mercado de mayoristas en la misma ciudad.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Ella lleva 8 años en el banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar en algo en la carga de la familia, ella se desempeña como secretaria del Banco. Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal in Picoaza parish, city of Portoviejo.  This is a very commercial zone well known for its traditional festival of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where we found Rosa, 35.  She is married and has three children who are 9, 6 and 6 months of age.  The two oldest are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who, wanting to help out with household expenses, is taking out a loan for her husband’s business.  He has a stall in the city of Portoviejo’s market where he sells fruit and vegetables.  He works from Tuesday through Sunday from 3am until 1pm.  He buys his products at the city’s wholesale market.

This loan is to buy fruit, vegetables and leafy green vegetables.  She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and likes it because the loans have helped her somewhat to meet household expenses.  She is the bank’s Secretary.  Her dream is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr:
Âgée de 55 ans, Madame Sabine Dembélé vit avec ses coépouses, ses beaux frères, belles sœurs, beaux parents et leurs 6 enfants dans  la famille de leur feu époux  à Keleya, un des chefs lieu de commune rurale de la préfecture de Bougouni, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Sabine est matrone de son état, exerçant au Centre de Santé Communautaire de Keleya.  En plus de cette activité professionnelle, elle excelle dans l’achat vente d’articles divers tels les matériels en plastique (tasses, glacières, assiettes, louches etc.)
Sabine a une grande expérience de ce secteur et elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Keleya et environs. Elle est à son premier individuel avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Sabine  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 douzaines de glacières de différentes dimensions et quelques de louches et d’assiettes.
Elle s’approvisionne  au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente aux marchés de Keleya et de Sido les jours de foires, essentiellement en espèce et en détail à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Madame Sabine Dembélé compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, contribuer aux dépenses de la famille élargie et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Fifty-five year-old Mrs. Sabine Dembele lives with the co-wives, her brothers-in-law, her sisters-in-law, and her parents-in-law and with the 6 children of their late husband in Keleya, one of the larger rural communities in the Bougouni prefecture, third administrative region in the Republic of Mali. 

Sabine is a matron, practicing at the Community Health Centre in Keleya. In addition to this professional activity, she also sells a variety of plastic merchandise (cups, plates, ladles etc.)

Sabine has a great deal of experience in the sector and she is very well liked and solicited in Keleya and neighboring regions.  She is on her first individual loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Sabine plans on using her loan to purchase 2 dozen coolers of various sizes and some ladles and plates.

She makes her purchases in Burkina Faso and carries out her sales in the markets in Keleya and Sido on fair days, usually in cash and on credit to a diverse and varied clientele. 

Mrs. Sabine Dembele expects to earn a monthly income of 100.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan, to contribute towards the expenses of their extended family, and to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic merchandise.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, tiene 42 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus tres hijos, en su casa propia y lo que más desean es salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 8 años, es la repostería de bocaditos y tortas, que los preparaba para los cumpleaños de sus familiares y eventos que se realiza en el colegio que estudian sus hijos,  y desde entonces fue haciéndose conocida en su barrio. En la actualidad la mayoría de sus vecinos requieren de sus servicios, es por ello que su trabajo se esta siendo cada vez más rentable.
