En vista de ello su hija Escarlet de 15 años le sugiere “colgar las fotografías de la variedad de su repostería en la Web”, pero ella primero piensa implementarse con accesorios primordiales e indispensables  que le permitan realizar acabados impecables a sus decoraciones, ya que solo así dice” ganarse buena imagen y después en adelante instalar su local  en su casa propia”. Es su octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, demostrando compromiso y comprensión con los integrantes de su asociación. Jenny, con el crédito que solicita, comprará insumos y accesorios de repostería, de ese modo asegura que mejorará su trabajo y aumentará sus ganancias.
texts.en: Jenny is a very hardworking and cheerful woman. She is 42 years old lives with her husband and three children. They live in their own home and what they want is to improve their standard of living. For more than 8 years she has been working at a bakery to sell snacks and sandwiches she prepares for family member's birthdays and other events held in her children's school. Since then she became known more and more around her neighborhood. At the moment the majority of her neighbors require her services so her business is becoming more profitable. Based on this, her 15 year old daughter Escarlet suggests she "posts photographs of the variety of meals she make on the internet," however Jenny has in mind to first stock up on essential materials that will make excellent decorations. That way she can "develop a decent image and in the future install the bakery in her home." This is the eighth loan she has requested from MFP and has demonstrated commitment and understanding with the members of the association. With the loan she is requesting, Jenny plans on buying materials and bakery accessories to improve her business and increase sales.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients to make cakes and snacks.

loans.name: Abla  Jacqueline

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Jacqueline  a 28 ans et est mère de 2  enfants.  Elle fait le commerce de pagnes et produits de beauté pour   participer  aux besoins  de ces enfants.  Elle a commencé son activité en 1989 et  s’approvisionne  au grand  marché  de Lomé.   Elle    habite quartier  Dzifa-kpota  où elle exerce son commerce.  Elle demande un prêt pour  acheter  de nouveaux lots de pagnes et produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Ms. Jacqueline is 28 years old and the mother of two children. She sells pagnes (colorful print fabrics) and beauty products to provide for her children. 

She started her business in 1989, and gets her stocks at the grand market of Lomé. 

She lives in the Dzifa-Kpota district, where she also conducts her activities. She is seeking a loan to replenish her stocks of pagnes and beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle to resell

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem S., 40, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 33 on food and USD 50 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Ladies That Overcome Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama DAMAS QUE SE SUPERAN debido a que con el credito recibido todas sus integrantes tienen la finalidad de superarse día a día en sus negocios, principalmente haciendo una mayor inversion en sus negocios. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Delia Margarita Z., tiene 43 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida (antojitos mexicanos) desde hace 8 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en su negocio, principalmente en materia prima (maiz), y de esta forma hacerlo crecer. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al credito recibido piensa hacer mayor inversion en su negocio y de esta forma comenzar a tener mas ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia, debido a las altas ventas que tiene, piensa establecerse en un local que esta cerca de donde actualmente se ubica.
texts.en: This group is named Ladies that Overcome because with the loan that they receive, each of the members have the ability to excel day after day with their business. Located in Hidalgo, Mexico, this group is made up of ten members. Señora Delia Margarita Z., is 43 years old, she went to school through high school and is now a merchant, she does not have any children. Señora Delia sells food (typical mexican snacks) and has for the past eight years. She is seeking a loan to invest in her business, she will buy mainly in raw ingredients (corn) and and in this way grow her business. Delia is excited to apply for this loan because she sees the investment going into her business and believes that because of it she will begin to see more earnings that will permit her to have a better quality of life for her and her family. With high sales she thinks about establishing her business in a permanent location nearby.

loans.use: To invest in raw ingredients for their food business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto E. M. de 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos. Jorge se dedica al transporte escolar y al transporte nocturno en la zona de Lourdes Colon del Departamento de La Libertad. Él posee dos microbuses que son sus principales herramientas para trabajar. Jorge es un hombre confíable, honesto y trabajador. Es muy reconocido en la zona y muchas personas lo prefieren por ser un hombre responsable, amable y muy dedicado en su trabajo. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en el mantenimiento de sus unidades de transporte ya que por el uso al que los somete, requieren de materiales que para Jorge es difícil comprarlas con medios propios. El Crédito lo solicita para la compra de llantas, pastillas para frenos, aceite, filtros, entre otros materiales necesarios para el buen funcionamiento de sus unidades de transporte. De esta manera podría seguir prestando su servicio de transporte que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto E. M. is 30 and he lives in his own house with his wife and their three children.  Jorge drives a school bus and also drives a microbus at night in the Lourdes Colon area of the La Libertad department.  He has two microbuses that are what he uses for work.  Jorge is a trustworthy, honest and hard-working man who is known in the area and many people prefer a responsible, friendly man who is dedicated to his work.  He has decided to request a loan from Integral to be able to keep up the maintenace of these buses since with all the use they are subjected to,  the microbuses need parts that are hard for Jorge to buy with his own money.  He will use the loan to buy tires, break pads, oil, filters, etc which are some of the necessary items that are needed to keep the buses in good shape.  In this way he can continue with his transport business since that is the only income that he has to support his family.

loans.use: To buy tires, brake pads, oil, filters, and other necessary items to keep up the good functioniong of his microbuses

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Hilda B. is in her early thirties, married, and the mother of two children, one attending school and the other a baby. Hilda owns a cow whose milk she sells, a business she has operated since 2008. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Hilda's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to establish a chicken business and a pig business, neither of which succeeded. She then bought the cow for milk-selling. Having repaid all of her previous loans, she will use this one to repair an enclosure for pigs. Her dream is to one day have a big farm for a variety of animals.

Hilda will share this loan with her loan group "Parachichi" which has a total of 16 members. The group members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Hilda is second from the right in a blue and white dress.

loans.use: to repair an enclosure for pigs.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe JIGUIYA sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits à travers AWA. 
AWA, compte acheter avec son  prêt,  7 chargements de charrettes en fruits auprès des paysans et au grand marché de MEDINE, auprès des grossistes.
Les fruits sont revendus au  marché de HAMDALLAYE et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA, qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the JIGUIYA group are all married. They average 39 years of age and 3 children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is their 3rd collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institute, in order to meet the needs of their customers. Past loans have been repaid with no issues. This group of women is in the fruit business through AWA.
AWA intends on buying 7 cartloads of fruits from farmers and at the big market of MEDINE, from wholesalers.
The fruits are then sold retail and for cash, both at the market in HAMDALLAYE as well as door to door to a clientele of men and women.
She expects to make a monthly profit of 90.000FCFA, which will be mostly used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita, age 48, runs a used clothing store, selling second-hand clothing items to members of her local community. Marianita has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. She is widowed and has five school-aged children. The family lives in the  village of Pob. 2, Oroq. City. 
 
In 2008, Marianita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothing products to offer for sale. This loan will be the third taken out by Marianita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of lemons to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in which she sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Jasmin has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell. In the future, Jasmin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like pants, t-shirts, blouses etc. to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hard-working, single 32-year-old. For the past three years, he has been selling second-hand clothing to support himself. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his business. He wants to open other shops in the next five years. His dream is to expand his business into wholesale.

He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal La Gran Amistad, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen a trabajar diariamente en la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
Doña María tiene 46 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los cuales 5 son casados e independientes, sus tres últimos hijos son de 18, 15 y 10 años de edad, su hija de 18 años trabaja para sus gastos personales, su hijo de 15 años estudia el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora conduciendo su propia unidad de bus, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, trabaja en esta actividad diariamente de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. En su casa cría chanchos y gallinas que lo vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal  15 años y el dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de carne de cerdo y credos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es de seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "La Gran Amistad."  She lives in Cumbe parish, a place with a cold climate and a beautiful view of nature.  The people there are very friendly and maintain their culture and the traditions of their parents; they work in retail trade, livestock and agriculture, and many of them go out each day to work in the city of Cuenca.

Maria is 46 years old, married, and has 8 children.  Five of her children are married and independent, and her 3 youngest children are ages 18, 15, and 10.  Her 18 year-old daughter works to cover her personal expenses.  Her 15 year-old is in school, and her youngest daughter is in a small school in the city.  Her husband works driving his own bus.  The house that they live in is their own property.

Maria has been working selling pork meat for 15 years.  She does this work daily from 8am until 8 at night.  In her house, she raises pigs and hens that she sells in her community.

Maria has been in her communal bank for 15 years, and she will use the money from this new loan to buy pork meat and pigs so that she can continue with her business.

Her goal is to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy pork meat and pigs

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
Maria lives and works in the Santo Domingo section of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. With 500,000 inhabitants, Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador.  Despite the size of the city, the pace of life in the city is tranquil. The city is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock- the largest in the country.

Maria is a hard-working, 26-year-old single mother. She lives alone with her 5-year-old son in the Rio Verde parish and supports herself and her child without any support from his father. She spends her spare time at home with her son.

This is Maria's first microfinance loan from Kiva and Kiva partner Fundación Alternativa.  Maria owns a restaurant that sells sausage and hot dogs and would like to expand her business. She will use her loan to buy more tables and an oven to cook chickens. Maria learned the business from friends, but she works alone, six hours a day.

Maria is certain this loan will help her expand her business and increase her household income. Maria dreams of one day owning her own home, and providing her young son with an education that will allow him to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy an oven and tables for her restaurant

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is a father of three children. He has been doing farming for the past four years. He was trained in how to do rice farming by his cooperative.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice farming.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Kenga faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting goods to his place of operation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is married with 1 child.  He is 31 years old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor.  
To earn his living, Ricky owns a small retail business.  He has had this business for four years.  Each month, he earns approximately PHP 3,600.00. He has requested a loan of P10,000. Ricky has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months.

In the future, Ricky hopes to be more productive with his business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted grocery items

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 4 years, Hadijah has been working hard to manage her clinic, which administers herbal medicine. 

To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more herbs, and will help her generate greater profits and meet her basic needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to become self-reliant. 

Hadijah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more herbs.

loans.name: La Beneficencia 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth  es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ha criado junto a su pareja y padre de sus hijos; todos aun viven en su humilde vivienda, en una comunidad rural a las afueras de San Pedro de Macorís, cuya población está conformada por habitantes haitianos, quienes emigraron buscando una mejor estabilidad económica. Elizabeth trabaja con la finalidad de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y poder darles un mejor futuro. 

Elizabeth se ha dedicado a la venta de calzado, desde hace varios años, este es su octavo préstamo con Esperanza Internacional, y ha sido miembro de su grupo desde hace 4 años. Elizabeth está planificando comprar zapatos, sandalias, tenis, para hombres, mujeres y niños. Junto a los demás miembros de su grupo, llamado la Beneficencia 4 & 5, han generado nuevas actividades de negocio para su comunidad, dedicándose a la venta de cosméticos, productos comestibles, ropas, salones de belleza, entre otras.

Unos de sus sueños es tener su propia casa y ahorros suficientes. Los beneficios de su negocio planea re-invertirlo y así poder hacer crecer su negocio, aumentando sus ventas y su clientela.
texts.en:
Elizabeth has three children.  She has raised them together with her life partner, the father of their children.  They all still live in her humble house.  They live in a rural community in the outskirts of San Pedro de Macorís.  Its inhabitants are comprised of Haitians who emigrated looking for improved financial stability.

The reason that Elizabeth works is to help get her family ahead, to educate her children, and to be able to give them a better future.  Elizabeth has been selling shoes for several years.

This is her eighth loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She has been a member of her group for four years.  Elizabeth is planning to buy men’s, women’s, and children’s shoes, sandals, and tennis shoes.

Together with the other members of the group called Beneficencia 4 & 5, they have generated new business activities for their community by selling cosmetics, food products, and clothes, and by having beauty salons, among other businesses.

One of her dreams is to have her own house and sufficient savings.  She plans to reinvest the profits from her business in order to be able to make her business grow by increasing her sales and her customers.

loans.use: to buy different types of shoes.

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz, 50, is the leader of this group. She resides in a southern small town of Uzgen with her husband and three children. Jyldyz’s husband is employed as a cab driver and earns up to 6,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) per month, while her oldest son is making a living working in Russia and invests about 10,000 soms in the family budget per month. Jyldyz wants her children to be educated and pursue great careers, so she makes her best to invest as much as possible in their development. 

Jyldyz is currently cultivating and retailing agricultural products like sunflower and corn. The market demand for them is quite high this year, so she receives up to 15,000 soms of profit monthly. She’s already managed to buy electrical supplies for the house and is applying for a loan from Kiva in order to buy sheep for further fattening and reselling. Her biggest wish for the future is to buy a good land and build the house of her dreams.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for breeding.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan is a married woman and the mother of a single child. She lives with her husband and her lovely child in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap. Chan is a farmer, and she is also a staff member of an organization that provides poor families with jobs and helps increase their incomes. She is able to earn an average of $5.00 per day through her work.

This is Chan's first loan request with Kiva. She wants to use the funds to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides to keep her potato crop growing well. She intends to use the increased profit she’ll earn to enroll her child in a local school and to save some money to expand her farmland in the next few years.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides for her potato crop.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Dovi est une femme  âgé(e) de 63 ans. Elle est veuve et a 05 enfants en charge. L’ainé à 40ans et le dernier a 28ans.
Dovi travaille comme revendeuse de cure dents depuis 1984. Elle vend à ses clients dans un marché de la place.
Dovi a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cures dents. 
Dans les prochaines années, Dovi voudrait accroitre son chiffre d’affaire afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Dovi is a 63-year-old woman. She is a widow and has five children in her care. The oldest is 40 and the youngest is 28.
Dovi has worked as a retailer selling toothpicks since 1984. She sells to her customers at a market in the area.
Dovi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy toothpicks.
In the coming years, Dovi would like to increase her sales in order to buy more merchandise. She says that with the profits, she intends to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy toothpicks.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Saliou est marié et âgé de 51ans. Il vit au Sénégal dans l’une de ses communautés villageoises. Il s’active depuis plus de 25 ans dans le commerce c'est-à-dire la vente de téléphones portables et d’accessoires. Il pratique aussi la   réparation de téléphones portables.  C’est un passionné  de son activité. A travers ses revenus il gère deux familles. Il est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il habite. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de cartes téléphoniques et d’accessoires  de téléphones portables qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif est  de  renforcer  son local  pour mieux développer et rentabiliser son  activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus pour pouvoir maintenir la bonne gestion de ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Saliou is married and 51 years old. He lives in Senegal in one of its village communities.

He has been active for over 25 years in retail trading, in particular the sales of mobile phones and accessories. He also repairs mobile phones. He is passionate about his business, and his income allows him two support two families.

He is member of the branch office of U-IMCEC of the locality where he lives. He has already repaid a previous loan, and is now requesting a loan of 300,000 francs destined to purchase phone cards and accessories for mobile phones for resale.

He aims to build up his workshop so he can better develop and maximise the returns from his trade activity. This funding will allow him to increase his income so he can continue to properly assume his family responsibilities.

loans.use:
achat de crtes téléphoniques et d'accessoires de téléphones portables a revendre.
buy telephone cards and mobile phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single mother of two children, aged 27 and 29.  To earn a living, she runs a pub. She has operated the business for six years.  She has built a good relationship with her customers.  This has helped her to grow her clientele.  She also does dairy farming to supplement her income.

Lucy hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy beer and soda.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina  es casada con el señor   Pedro y con quien procreo siete hijos quienes ya todos están casados.

    Ella  solito l préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes como son: harina, queso, leche, levadura, entre otros para la elaboración de panes en donde lleva trabajando   treinta y dos  años nueve meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello logrado mejorar mucho sus ingresos para su hogar.

   Quien lo inspiro en esta actividad fue ella mismo ya que desde pequeña  comenzó trabajando y  desde entonces le agrado la idea de elaborar panes y así se ha estado poyando  con su familia.

  Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad y el préstamo ella pueda seguir trabajando para continuar adelante con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina is married to Pedro, with whom she had seven children, all of which are already married.
She requested the loan in order to purchase supplies such as flour, cheese, baking powder, etc., for making bread. She has been in this line of work for 32 years and 9 months and she reports that it is going well, since it has allowed her to get a much better income for her home.
Her inspiration for this business was herself, because she started working when she was young and since then she has enjoyed the idea of making bread. That is the way she has supported her family.
Her biggest wish is that through this business and this loan she is able to keep on working and getting ahead with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
In her late 30s Hamida, who is married with three children, has been selling vehicle oil for about ten years now. Working from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hamida’s fourth loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She used the previous loan, since repaid, to purchase vehicle oil, and is now requesting a new loan for the same purpose. Hamida’s dream is to one day build her own house.

Hamida will share this loan with her loan group, "Hakika," which has 17 members. The group members will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more vehicle oil for her  business.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is from Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, a widow and has one adult child. 
To make a living, Matilde owns and operates a food vending business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. Matilde is requesting a loan of 5,732 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her food vending business. 
In 2009, Matilde joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Matilde's future plans are to have her own car and run a successful business.

loans.use: gain additional capital for her food vending business.

loans.name: Laura Isela

texts.es:
La señoritita Laura se dedica  cuenta con un ciber internet desde hace dos años estudio la Lic.  En informática.
Es una señorita muy inteligente trabajadora con deseos de  triunfar en su negocio. Tambien se dedica a la  venta de refrescos, bolis y paletas de hielo.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  más computadoras y cables de conexión y memorias USB.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyar a los jóvenes que desean crecer con sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
Laura has been working in an internet cafe for two years.  She studied computer science.
She is a very intelligent and hard-working woman with the desire to succeed in her business.  She also sells sodas, ice-pops, and popsicles.
She asked for the loan to buy more computers, extension cords, and USB cables.
She gives thanks to the foundation for supporting young people that want to grow their small businesses.

loans.use: buy computers for an internet-cafe and sodas, ice-pops, and popsicles.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio Gregorio pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Gregorio continua trabajando en una empresa de reciclador,reciclando papeles,metal,plasticos entre otros,el socio Gregorio cuenta con una unidad de transporte con el cual trabaja y transporta lo reciclado,el socio Gregorio lleva años en este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,el socio Gregorio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio Gregorio requiere el préstamo para la compra de metales,vidrios,plasticos entre otros.


El  socio Gregorio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The partner is a member of the community bank “silkinchany.” The bank is located in the community of Angostura in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The partner continues to work in the recycling company, recycling paper, metals, plastic and other items. The partner depends on a unit of transport with which he works and transports the recyclables.  The partner has worked in this area for years and he is doing well thanks to effort he puts in everyday. The partner wants to continue working in order to continue to support his family. 

The partner needs the loan to purchase matals, glass, and plastic among other items.  The partner is grateful for the help that he has been granted and he promises to be disciplined with his payments and quotas.

loans.use: to purchase metals, glass, plastics, and other items.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали активный, ответственный и сильный 30 летный дехканин. Он из района Джоми. Муродали женат и отец троих детей. Детям 10, 12 и 15 лет. Они учатся в средней школе района. Муродали младший сын в семье. У него имеется старшие братья. У них большая и дружная семья. Они поддерживают друг другу. Муродали трудится на большой земельный участок. Он занимается земледелием. Ему было 15 лет, когда он начал заниматься земледелием. Ему помогает его братья. Муродали сейчас готовить землю к новому посеву урожай. Он хочет обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный и богатый урожай. Ему не хватает денежных средств для приобретения больше количество минеральных удобрений. По этой причине Муродали просит кредит. Вы можете поддержать его во время.

loans.use: Для купли минеральных удобрений.

loans.name: Ivon Maritza

texts.es:
Ivon es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Ivon y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.
Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata is married with three children.She runs a  hair dressing business in a busy area of Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam.She has employed two people in her business. In normal business days,her saloon is usually flocked with customers.She need to add some comfortable sitting chairs to hold these customers on the queue.She also usually in short of hair dressing materials.The equipments used for hair dressing need to be highly sterilized to reduce the risk of HIV transmission and other skin deseases.To effectively run her business she need an additional working capital of USD 750

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresiah would like to buy a water tank to store clean water

loans.name: Faamamalu

texts.en: Faamamalu is a young married mother of three children.  In her backyard she has a vegetable garden that she faithfully tends to ensure that she can afford her children’s school fees.  She grows many different kinds of vegetables and takes them to the local market three times a week.  She can bring in approximately ST 150 – 200 (about USD 75) from these trips to the market.  Having repaid her initial loan in full, Faamamalu is now applying for a second loan to purchase additional seeds and bulbs to expand the variety of vegetables she grows.

loans.use: Buy seeds and bulbs

loans.name: Ruth Rudicela

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ruth Rudicela and I am a businesswoman. I have a small business where I sell clothing, located in the plaza of my city. I have several years experience, and thanks to this business I am able to help cover household expenses and also have time to care for my son. I currently need to stock my store a little bit more, because my sales are improving and I would like to offer a wider variety of products to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola Mi nombre es Ruth Rudicela, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño de nogocio de venta de ropa, ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio pued contribuir con los gastos familiares, gracias a este negocio puedo atender a mi hijo, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas el negocio ya que las ventas mejoran entre mas variedad de producto puede uno ofrecer al cliente.

loans.use: To purchase pants, jeans, men's shirts,  children's clothing, underwear and other items.

loans.name: Mirna Lila

texts.es:
My name is Mirna Lila R., and I have a business selling purses and backpacks for children. I have had this business for 8 years. I sell at offices and to my neighbors in my community. My best customers as the young people that work in offices. With the income I get from the purse sales, I help my husband with the monthly expenses we have in our household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Mi nombre es Mirna Lila R. tengo un negocio de venta de carteras y mochilas para niños. Este negocio lo tengo hace 8 años. Yo vendo a las oficinas y a mis vecinos de mi comunidad. Mis mejores clientes son las jovenes que trabajan en oficinas. Con los ingresos que tengo sobre la venta de cartera ayudo ami esposo con los gastos mensuales que tenemos en nustro hogar.

loans.use: To buy purses and backpacks for children.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28, married with 2 children and she takes care of 4 other children. For the past four years she has operated a retail store. Right now her inventory is sparse but she hopes to use a new loan to restock her inventory. She sells fresh baked goods and soft drinks. She is reserved but hopeful. She recently lost several of her front teeth and she is hopeful to get to the dentist and have them replaced. She is a lovely soft spoken person who has a kind heart.

For the past year she has been receiving loans and has been able to repay without any problem. When asked what is her dream for the future she cautiously smiles and says that she has a small plot of land and would like to one day build her home on it. With her kind spirit, I’m sure she shall achieve her dream.

loans.use: Agnes plans to use her loan to restock her inventory of fresh baked goods and beverages

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a young artist of 19. She studied art in high school, and now works in a studio from 6:00 to 11:00 pm constructing and painting "Manualidades en Trupan", crafts made on a special type of wood found in Peru, which vary from beautiful paintings and woodcarvings to colorful jewelry boxes. She can produce a painting for about nine Soles ($3) and sell it for 15 Soles ($5), and she can produce a jewelry box for six Soles ($2) and sell it for 10 Soles ($3.25).

Cecilia found out about her village bank from her mom, who is also with Finca. She has been with them for three months now, and will use this loan of $150 to buy materials such as wood and paint. She loves what she does and is looking forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy wood, paint, and other materials needed for her paintings

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N., 68, is a widow and lives with her two children in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife.  Her two children cover all the expenses by working as fishermen. Recently, Mrs. Em N. requests a loan to purchase fishing tools for her children and use the remainder to buy a motorcycle to transport their fish to market.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools for her children and use the remainder to buy a motorcycle to transport their fish to market

loans.name: Nasuti C(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Ruth is 32 years old and married with three children. Ruth and Annet have grocery stores. Ruth wants to use the extra busines profits to pay school fees for her children and improve her current business. Fatumah sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to expand the business. Linda ia a hair dresser, while Keti sells second-hand clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items and pay school fees

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov S. (pictured with her mother), 34, and her husband, Mr. Meng Leang, have been married for over ten years. They have two children; one son and one daughter, both who are studying in primary school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. S. has been in the business of selling flowers and bananas since she was young. She takes jasmine flowers from her farm and some she purchases from a farmer in her village to sell atthe Chba Ampov Market in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises pigs and cows. He would like to set up a new business cleaning in the village. The couple hopes that both businesses will be able to support her children through school.

Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to set up a motorbike cleaning shop for her husband.

loans.use: To set up a motorbike cleaning shop

loans.name: Siros

texts.en:
Siros M. and her husband, Neang Ham, have been married for seven years. They have two sons. One of their sons is in school and the youngest one stays at home. Their house is located along the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. and her husband have been fishing since they were young. They fish in the Mekong River and sell the fish at Prek Anchanh Market, about five kilometers from their village.

Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for the first time. She is asking for $150 to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina works day to day with a lot of insistence to be able to cover all the necessities, she dedicates herself to the shearing of wool from sheep to market it and leather for the shoemakers, if you go to the Huamanmarce annex you will see her there working shearing the wool. This is a small workshop that Maximina has fixed for work, and in the afternoons she dedicates herself to the decoration of aprons. Maximina’s dream is to better her production and to open a store. The loan will be invested as capital.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Maximina día a día trabaja con mucho empeño para poder brindar a los suyos todo lo necesario, se dedica a trasquilar la lana de las ovejas para comercializarlas a los proveedores y el cuero a aquellas personas que hacen zapatos, si van al anexo de Huamanmarca verán allí a una mujer trabajadora trasquilando la lana. Este es un pequeño taller que Maximina ha habilitado para trabajar, y por las tardes se dedica a elaborar mandiles.El sueño de Maximina es mejorar su producción y aperturar una tienda, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando porque desea ver a sus 3 encaminados por la senda del éxito, el préstamo será invertido como capital en su próxima campaña de venta.

loans.use: To increase her capital to increase her production.

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi M., 54 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2006. Two out of her four children are still living in the house. All of them, however, get their jobs. Before, Mrs. M. and her husband worked at the village's engineering office. When the place disintegrated, Mrs. M. discussed with her husband to borrow money and open their own small shop and use their existing skills. Their business turned out very good. Each month Mrs. M. earned 150 USD from selling iron doors and the farming machines. Besides, she also breeds pigs and chickens, and sells coffins. In order to open the scope of her shop, Mrs. M. wants to borrow 625USD to buy more iron.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị M., 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2006. 2 trong số 4 người con của chị M. hiện vẫn sống cùng bố mẹ. Các cháu đều đã đi làm. Trước đây chị M. cùng chồng làm ở hợp tác xã cơ khí của địa phương. Khi hợp tác xã giải thể, chị M. bàn với chồng vay vốn mở xưởng phát huy tay nghề sẵn có. Công việc diễn ra rất thuận lợi, mỗi tháng chị thu nhập khoảng 150USD từ bán cửa sắt, máy tuốt lúa. Ngoài ra chị M. cũng chăn nuôi lợn gà và bán quan tài. Với mong muốn mở rộng thêm quy mô của xưởng, chị M. vừa làm đơn xin vay 625USD mua sắt làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy iron

loans.name: Saroeurn Chum Group

texts.en:
Mr Saroeurn C. is the leader of this group of five in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a security guard in a company. His wife, Mrs Nai Ros, is an egg seller in the local market. Since Mrs Nai Ros’s business is improving, she needs to expand it. Unfortunately, Mrs Nai Ros does not have enough money to purchase more eggs to sell, so her husband, Mr Saroeurn C., requested a loan to buy more eggs for this purpose.

Mr Saroeurn C. is 43 and the father of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining six attend school. He will share this loan with the members of the group.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs for his wife to sell for an income.

loans.name: Koassi

texts.fr:
Mr. Hoassi A. B. was born on August 1st, 1970, in Aneho, in the district of Lacs, Togo where he started his profession. Since1997 he has installed and maintained grinding machines in various neighborhoods. The grinding machine is a necessity in Togo as it transforms corn into flour in order to prepare pate (corn dough) which comprises the basic food in Togo. It is a thriving business which allows him to earn revenue.

The first business loan that he made has been completely repaid. He is requesting this second loan to enable him to purchase spare parts such as ten (10) grinding wheels and three (3) drive motors. This will allow him to service and keep his customers by being able to repair their broken grinding machines.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 1er août 1970 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs au Togo, monsieur A. B. Koassi est commerçant de profession. Depuis 1997 il a mis en place des moulins dans de différents quartiers qu’il gère. Le moulin est une machine très indispensable au Togo car il sert à transformer le maïs en farine afin de pouvoir préparer la pâte qui constitue une nourriture de base au Togo. C’est une activité très florissante qui lui permet de tirer des revenus.

Il a une fois obtenu du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des pièces de rechanges telles que 10 paires de meules et 3 dynamos afin de pouvoir réparer les moulins qui sont tombés en panne afin de ne pas perdre ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for grinding wheels

loans.name: Ni Luh Kanten

texts.id:
Ni Luh Kanten started her business, to raise 2 piglets, with IDR 200,000 to purchase each piglet. She at first raised the piglets traditionally, by tying them on a tree, but now she has had a semi-permanent cage. The high price of piglet and the fodder has ever made Ni Luh Kanten confused and stopped the business that make her family’s economic condition shocked, for the family only depends on the income earned from her husband who works as a labor. Finally, with the support from his husband, Ketut Sarnen, Ni Luh Kanten started to fulfill her cage with piglets again, with the capital earned from the loan from Dinari. The loan was deployed to purchase 4 piglets, IDR 300,000 each. The rest of the loan was used to buy fodder. Now, Ni Luh Kanten is optimistic with the business, and hopes that the business will be able to change their economic condition, as well as to support the the education for her children.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana DK, Kiva volunteer.

Dari dua ekor ternak babi yang di beli seharga Rp. 200.000,- / ekornya Ni Luh Kanten memulai usahanya. Dari pemeliharaan sistem tradisional (mengikat babi di bawah pohon ) hingga kini telah memiliki sebuah kandang yang semi permanen. Harga bibit babi dan pakan ternak yang mahal sempat membuat Ni Luh Kanten bingung dan mengosongkan kandangnya dan hal itu sangat berdampak pada perekonomian keluarga yang hanya bertumpu pada pendapatan suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai buruh. Untuk mengatasi hal tersebut, akhirnya berkat dorongan dari Ketut Sernen, suaminya, saat ini Niluh Kanten mulai lagi mengisi kandangnya dengan ternak babi baru dengan menggunakan dana pinjaman dari Dinari. Dana yang didapatnya dibelikannya 4 ekor bibit babi yang masing-masing seharga Rp. 300.000.- sedangkan sisa uangnya di belikan pakan ternak seperti dedak padi, dedak gandum dan konsentrat. Ni Luh Kanten kini merasa sangat optimis dengan usaha yang dijalankan saat ini dan berharap modal yang di berikan ini akan bisa mengubah dan memperbaiki perekonomian keluarganya yang sempat terpuruk dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Glinda

texts.es:
La señora Glinda, socia del Banco Comunal “María Magdalena”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Distrito de Juanjui. Tiene una quinta y alquila cuartos a personas que trabajan y a estudiantes que llegan de otros lugares. Decidió  alquilar sus cuartos porque ya no tiene ningún hijo a su cargo, además tiene que mantener su casa y los gastos que ello requiere.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará  baldes de pintura de varios colores para darle mantenimiento y poder alquilar, ya que depende mucho de la presentación de ellos para que la gente solicite sus cuartos y darle un buen precio.

La señora Glinda tiene 67 años, es una mujer amigable y siente que tiene más libertad de decidir. Espera que con estos ingresos mejorar su calidad de vida. Su meta es tener su casa arreglada para satisfacer las necesidades de los inquilinos y las demás personas que lleguen a solicitar sus cuartos.
texts.en:
Glinda is a member of the Communal Bank "María Magdalena," she lives in the San Martín area, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui state. She has a boarding house and rents rooms to people who work and students who come from other places. She decided to rent her rooms because she doesn't have any children to take care of, in addition she has to maintain her home and meet her expenses. With this loan for S/. 1,800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy pails of various colors of paint to maintain her rooms and be able to rent them, as much depends on the presentation of the rooms so that people request her rooms and are willing to pay her a good rental price. Glinda is 67 years old, she is a friendly woman and feels that she has liberty to make decisions for herself. She hopes that with this income her quality of life improves. Her goal is to have her house fixed to her renters satisfaction to meet the needs of her renter and other people who may arrive to rent her rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paint to paint rooms she rents.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Rose M. from Mwnza. Married with four children between the ages of three and ten, Rose has been running a shop since 2006. Assisted by her husband, she sells salt, soaps, sugar, eggs, maize flour, wheat flour, and biscuits. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, currently earning about $200 per month.

Rose is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy soda, water, lotions, soaps, vouchers, rice, cooking oil, and wheat flours. In the future, she plans to increase the range and quantity of stocks. Rose thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy soda, water, lotions, soaps, vouchers, rice, cooking oil, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy S. is 22 years old, married, and has one young child. She started farming in her village more than 3 years ago. Her husband, Mr. Thy Shorn is 26 years old, and he operates a music service. He provides music in customers’s homes for ceremonies or wedding parties. Thavy requests a loan of 800,000 Riel ($200) to purchase a generator for her husband’s business.

This group includes four other entrepeneurs. They all live in Tongrong Commune, Kompong Cham Province, in Cambodia. Mrs. Sras D., 20, is a farmer. She requests a loan of 600,000 Riel ($150) to buy a generator. Mrs. Yath S. is 46 years old, and also is a farmer. She requests a loan of 600,000 Riel ($150) to purchase fertilizer for the rice crop. Mrs. Nath U., 49, is a local farmer. She requests a loan of 400,000 Riel ($100) to purchase fish to sell. Mrs. HoeU. S. is 43 years old, and grows beans. HoeU. requests a loan of 500,000 Riel ($125) to buy more seeds to plant more beans.

loans.use: Purchase a generator for in-home music service

loans.name: Akossiwa Ahoéfa

texts.fr: Née le 10 décembre 1987 à Lomé, le capital de Togo, Madame A. Akossiwa Ahoéfa est une jeune fille entreprenante.  Elle est célibataire est elle n’a pas d’enfant, donc elle peut utiliser les profits de son entreprise pour subvenir à ses besoins et soutenir sa famille.  Elle achète les produits cosmétiques au Grand Marche de Lomé, et puis elle les revend à Agoè, un quartier au nord de la ville.
texts.en:
Born on December 10, 1987, in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Miss Akossiwa Ahoéfa A. is an enterprising young girl. She is single and has no children and can therefore use the profits from her business to provide for herself and support her family. She buys cosmetic products at the big market in Lomé and sells them in Agoè, an area in the northern part of the city.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina V., 48, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the ice cake candy business. She sells to the villagers and students from the village school 7 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166 USD).  SPBD loans are Avelina’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for renovating her house, and she will be purchasing cement, iron roofing, and a toilet bowl set.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of sugar, coolio, foam cups and packets of lollies for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aminata Doucouré  est âgée de 50 ans, mariée elle vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants  dans une grande  famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménagers dans le quartier Secoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fait  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle faisait le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des céréales. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage elle a maîtrisé les rouages du commerce et a acquis assez d’expériences pour évoluer seule. Elle décida de faire le commerce d’atiéké depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation au marché château  et dans toute la ville de Ségou où ses clients n’en finissent pas. Son Atieké est  soigneusement tamisé avant d’être mis soit dans des sacs ou emballages en plastiques.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro  Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis plusieurs années. Après 5 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels, tous remboursés sans difficulté, elle est son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 3 tonnes d’atiéké en république de la  Côte d’Ivoire. Madame  Aminata Doucouré  vend au comptant et à crédit à une cliente composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA, ce qui lui servira à se prendre en charge et de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Doucouré, 50, is married and lives with her husband and 6 children in a big traditional family with other housewives in the Secoura neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having been unable to attend school for socio-economic reasons, she began working as a petty trader together with her mother who sold cereals. After a number of years of apprenticeship, she became well-versed in the ways of commerce and had enough experience to continue on her own. She decided to sell atiéké 20 years ago and enjoys an excellent reputation in the "château" market and in all the town of Ségou where she has innumerable customers. Her "Atieké" (granulated cassava) is carefully sieved before being filled into sacks or plastic wrappers.

So as to satisfy her clientele and grow her business, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with us for several years. After 5 group loans and 2 individual loans, all reimbursed without difficulty, she is on her third individual loan.

She intends to use this loan to buy 3 tons of atiéké in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire. Mrs. Aminata Doucouré sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which she will use to support herself and pay her children's school fees. Her ambition is to build a house.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing Atiéké (cassava granules) for re-sale

loans.name: Gulzaran M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran M. A.  is 46 years old, married and a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar, Pakistan for 2 years. Her husband's name is M. A. who has a scrap business for 10 years. Gulzaran Baji belongs to a very poor family but her parents taught her to live happily in every circumstance. She delivers the same message to her kids. She is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Gulzaran baji runs a grocery shop to pay off the education expenses for her kids because she wishes to give them a good education. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business. 

She is a group leader for women in her locality. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Zainab Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Jamila baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Madame F. MBAYE est vendeuse de céréales au marché de Bambey au Senegal, une petite ville à 130 km de Dakar.  Son petit boutique est situe au milieu du marché ou tous les gens de Bambey achètent leur nourriture, et elle a beaucoup d’amies qui travaillent a cote d’elle.   Cette dame vivante demande ce crédit pour reconstituer son stock de céréales locales.  Avec cette revenue elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. F. MBAYE is a retailer of grain at the marketplace of Bambey (in Senegal), a small city 130 km from Dakar. Her small shop is located in the middle of the marketplace, where everyone in Bambey buys their food. She has many friends who work at her side. This vivacious lady is asking for a loan to replenish her stock of local grains. With these earnings, she helps her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: San Jose De Viñaca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San José D. Viñaca inicia su cuarto ciclo con 22 socias, todas ellas son D. la comunidad D. San José D. Viñaca, que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. AyaC., la población se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras en mayor proporción y la ganadería. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales, abarrotes en general, verduras y la agricultura, ganadería.

Como es el caso D. Natalia que es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Natalia junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra D. alfalfa, producto que luego comercializan en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. AyaC..

Por otro lado Rosa es casada, tiene 43 años y 7 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra D. verduras, alfalfa.

Mientras que Nery es casada, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Nery se dedica a la agricultura D. alfalfa, verduras, además a la crianza D. cuy.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, ladrillo, semilla, alfalfa y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank San José D. Viñaca begins its fourth cycle with 22 partners, all hailing from the community of San José D. Viñaca, located 40 minutes from the city of AyaC.. Its inhabitants dedicate themselves to raising vegetables, primarily, and livestock. The partners are involved in different activities, such as raising and selling crops and livestock, selling groceries and vegetables. Such is the case of Natalia, who is 47, married and has six children. Natalia and her husband raise alfalfa and sell it in a supply market in the city of AyaC.. Rosa, on the other hand, is 43, married and has seven children. Rosa and her husband raise vegetables and alfalfa. Meanwhile, Nery is 23, married and has two children. Nery raises alfalfa, vegetables and guinea pigs. The partners need different loans for different amounts like $100 USD, $145 USD, $195 USD, $290 USD, for a total of $4300 USD needed in loans at the Communal Bank. Your loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, brick, seed, alfalfa and to pay laborers. The partners' goals are to improve their business and proviD. a good education to their children so they may have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, brick, seed, alfalfa, and laborers' salary

loans.name: Milca

texts.es:
MILCA O. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Luren”, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo  Sisley Nº 495, en el distrito de Callería, ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 51 años de edad, trabaja haciendo manualidades, es muy creativa, su esposo trabaja  en el Magisterio y tienen 4 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de ella..

Ella tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para invertir en materiales para hacer manualidades y ofrecer a algunas amigas. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales para hacer bolsos , carteras, y zapatos; además de financiar el estudio de tres de sus hijos, que la motivan día a día..

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la ayuda a tener un capital financiero con el que puede trabajar, beneficiando directamente a sus hijos.
texts.en:
MILCA O. A., belongs to the Village Bank “Señor de Luren”. Her residence is located in Jr. Guillermo Sisley Nº 495, in the Callería district, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 51 years old, does craftwork, and is very creative. Her husband works in teaching and they have four children who are still economically dependent on her.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. The first loan she had was in the amount of 300 Nuevos Soles, which she used to invest in materials to make crafts to offer to some friends. With this loan of l,000 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in buying materials to make handbags, wallets, and shoes; further, she will finance the education for three of her children, they motivate her daily.

She is grateful for Manuela Ramos, because they help her to have financial capital that she can work with, directly benefiting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to produce purses, wallets and shoes.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married and has seven children, five of whom are still in school. She and her family live in a three-room house with a broken roof and they are in the middle of the rainy season. Martha did not have the opportunity to get a good education as her father died when she was only a kid. This forced her into an early marriage. Added to this, her husband has been having health problems for the past couple of years, leaving her to do all that it takes to keep the family going. She joined GHAPE, a Kiva partner, in 2004 and has since received and repaid loans amounting to 220,000 CFA ($440).

Given a loan of 150,000 CFA, she plans to buy three piglets, pig feed and palm oil for retail. Palm oil is a basic commodity as almost all households use it on a daily basis. This is an indication that there is a ready market. The profit she gets from the loan shall be used to see her children through their academic career and to repair the broken roof of their house which leaks every time it rains.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and toward poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Piglets, pig feed and palm oil

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy sells fruits like pineapples. She also sells roasted beef. 

She is 32 years old and married with two children. 

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N140,000 (US$975) to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.en: R. Muhiddin is 55 years old and lives in Istaravshan with his wife and children. He has a small farm which he has managed to cultivate after much effort. He spends the majority of his time on his farm because he is keeping watch over anything that may happen. He has been working in agriculture for ten years. His wife supports him in their household. Muhiddin has two children and his older one helps him with the household expenses. Muhiddin plans on improving his family’s living conditions so that he can offer them a better future. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizers to use on his crops so that he can sell more produce at a higher price. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm

loans.name: Kossi Adodo

texts.fr: A. kossi pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens s’est lancé dans le commerce en détail de cartes de recharges, il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Vu la manière dont ce commerce prospère pour lui, il veut l’agrandir et demande à WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 5 cartons de cartes de recharges « MOOV », 5 cartons de cartes de recharge « TOGOCELL » et des cartes de recharges « ILLICO »
texts.en:
A. Kossi got into retailing telephone cards to support himself. He does this on foot, walking through the community. In view of the way this business is prospering, he wants to enlarge it and is asking WAGES for a first loan to buy 5 boxes of telephone cards for « MOOV », 5 boxes of cards for « TOGOCELL », and some cards for « ILLICO ».

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing phone cards for resale

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en: Nelsie H. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 47 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Nelsie owns and operates a restaurant, serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nelsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nelsie is requesting a new loan of 14,950 PHP which will be used as additional capital for restaurant expansion. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for restaurant expansion

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Making baskets is a part of 63-year-old But T.’s daily routine. But T. and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at the market. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1980. But T. is an older mother who has seven children. Two of her children are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh. 

But T. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to rent to farmers

loans.name: Cañete

texts.en:
Cañete R. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Cañete is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Cañete owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Cañete has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cañete joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cañete has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Cañete is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used in the same way. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cañete from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 06 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado ovino para engorde.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando pero en comercialización de carnes para enviar a Tacna.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Karla Amarilis

texts.es:
la sra. KARLA AMARILIS S. ANDINO tiene un puesto de venta de frutas, esta ubicado en la orilla del pavimento salida a jamastran y opera bajo el nombre de Frutas "DANIELA" tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar.
Doña Karla, es madre soltera con dos hijos de los cuales dependen a un 100% de ella, Karla cubre los gastos de alimentación, medicina, estudio.
el excompañero de hogar de ella o el padre de sus hijos, es le que se encarga de cubrir la renta de la vivienda, este es un gasto que no sale de los ingresos de doña karla.
doña Karla, es un ejemplo de admirar, madre soltera que lucha con gran esfuerzo en su trabajo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, posee un vehiculo de su legitima propiedad mismo que utiliza para comprar y salir a vender de manera ambulante los productos con que ella se gana la vida.

loans.use: compra de frutas y verduras (sandiias, melones, manzanas, platanos verdes y maduros, tomates, cebollas,

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Since she was a small girl, Gulnora has been entirely dedicated to work. She buys and sells sheep. Until now this has been the most important source of income for her. Her work consists of raising sheep and, after fattening them, she sells them at the best price and makes her profit. In the future she wants to start another business. In the meantime she will continue dedicating herself to sheep raising. Right now she wishes to expand her business and purchase more sheep. That is the reason that Gulnora asked for a loan of 4500 Somoni. You could become an important part in Gulnora family's life, she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.
