In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand a sheep business

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning M. is 51 years-old and happily married to her husband, Sebastian M., 52 years-old. May, their only child, is now 24 years-old. Luningning is a little depressed that May only obtained a low level of education because of a lack of money for tuition fees and other expenses, and the sad part of it is that she settled down at a young age. Luningning doesn't want this to happen to her grandchildren which is why she has promised herself that she will help May in the education of her children.

One source of their income is from the salary received by her husband who works as a laborer. However, although her husband tries hard to earn enough income for them it ends up not being enough. Luningning persists in helping her husband and manages many businesses. She is now focusing on buying and selling detergent soap bars and powder. As a matter of fact, she plans to use the loan that she hopes to receive from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) to buy all the necessary things needed for this business. Other than this business, she also sells dried fish and makes bamboo sticks for extra income.

Luningning never tires of thinking what possible business will contribute to their income because she really wants to improve their way of living. She wants to renovate their house into a much better one but also her main reason for not getting tired is she hopes that, unlike their mother, all her grandchildren will finish their studies up to college.

loans.use: To purchase detergent soap bars and powder.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is 53 years-old and is married to Teodorico G. who works as a farmer. The couple is blessed with six children. Roderick and Heherson are both tricycle drivers; Mary Jane is a full time house wife; Larry is a family driver; Wilbert and Laricbertson are fourth year high school students. Their family resides at the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is near Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela.

She is engaged in farming and vending of vegetables in their village. She sells her products every week at the public market in Cabatuan, Isabela. Her weekly net income is Php 3,000. She desires a loan from Kiva lenders of Php 12,000 which she will use to purchase more fertilizers for her vegetable plantation and also to buy additional products to sell. According to her, we should have patience in order to have bountiful profits.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sard

texts.en: Sard V., 56, is married with five children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she runs a business of selling souvenirs and soft drinks to tourists at a Temple, earning an average income of $7 a day. Her husband always helps his wife in this business. V. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, V. is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a store near the temple to expand her souvenir selling business.

loans.use: buy a souvenir shop hear the temple

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and is married with six children, the youngest being 9 years old. Her husband is a businessman.

Helen loves cooking and so she commercialized her cooking skill by having a restaurant in the market in Agbor, Delta State. Her stall is strategically positioned in the market and this makes a lot of people patronize her stall. She cooks mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods like fufu (cassava dough), rice, beans, boiled yam, stew and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time.

Helen is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Jemila

texts.en: Jemila is 37 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist community on Ghana's central coast. Many people in this area fish for a living, but Jemila runs a roadside store. She gets her goods from the capital, Accra. Jemila has been in business for 11 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy items in bulk to sell in her store

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales menores que luego engorda y los vende en su misma casa, además compra quesos que vende en su barrio.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Los sueños de Felicitas son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of Cori Ayllu community bank, which means Familia de Oro ("Family of Gold") in Quechua. She is 37 years old, married, and has 5 children. Felicitas travels to different regional markets where she buys small livestock to fatten and sell. She also buys cheese to sell in her neighborhood. Felicitas needs a loan of 1,500 PEN that will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Her dream is for her children to have professional careers, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs.

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
Sonia R. es socia del  Banco Comunal Libertad San Bartolo que esta formado por miembros de una familia que buscan mejores dias para sus hijos y la forma de seguir incrementando sus negocios, ella vive en la comunidad San Bartolo de Sigsig, tiene 30 años y se encuentra casada fruto de su unión conyugal procreó tres hijos que se encuentran de  6, 4, 2 años de edad, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad resultado del esfuerzo y trabajo conyugal.

Sonia es comerciante de pollos,  tiene ya siete años es esta actividad y  los  vende pelados y también vivos como le soliciten sus clientes, nos comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio pues recibe muchos pedidos.

Ella lleva tres ciclos trabajando  en la Fundación desde que se entero de los beneficios que ofrece la institución por un promotor de la Fundación;  con el préstamo solicitado comprará  pollos pequeños, maiz y vitaminas  para criarlos y comercializarlos.

Su gran sueño es tener un local propio para vender su producto en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sonia R. is a member of the communal bank Libertad San Bartolo, which is made up of members of a family that are looking for better days for their children and a way to continue expanding their businesses. She lives in the community San Bartolo de Sigsig, is 30 years old, and is married. She has three children; ages 6, 4, and 2. The house that they live in is her own, a result of effort and hard work. Sonia sells chicken for a living, which she has been doing for 7 years. She sells them plucked or live, at her clients' request. She tells us that her business is going very well, as she receives a lot of orders. She has been working with the Fundacion for three loan cycles, since she found out about the benefits that the institution offers through a promoter. With this loan, she will purchase small chickens, corn, and vitamins to raise and market them. Her greatest dream is to have her own place to sell her products in the downtown area of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small chickens, corn, and vitamins to raise and sell them

loans.name: Carol Noemi

texts.es:
La Sra Carol P. es casada posee casa propia una sola hija de 2 años. Es microempresaria es propietaria de un local comercial ubicado en el nuevo circuito comercial Plazita Municipal Bloque 2 local 51 de la Ciudad de Encarnación. 
La misma solicito el crédito a un plazo de 12 meses lo cual se le concedió y lo uso para incrementar sus  mercadería , la misma cuenta con 8 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela y un buen  ingreso. Actualmente aumentaron las ventas en la zona de ENCARNACION por ser zona turística.
texts.en:
Ms. Carol P. is married, owns her house, and has a 2 year old daughter. She is a small business owner and owns a shop located in the new commercial circuit of Plazita, municipal block 2 local 51 in the city of Encarnación. Currently, they are increasing sales in the zone of Encarnacion by making it a tourist zone. She is asking for a loan with a 12 month term which she will use to increase her merchandise. She has a similar loan of 8 months that has allowed her to build a very good clientele and have a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying medicine, acetaminophen, repellants, antacids, and various other drugs.

loans.name: Salvadora Patricia

texts.es: Doña Patricia S. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio el cual consiste en la elaboración y venta de repostería la cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ha luchado en conjunto con sus cinco hijos para salir adelante. Tiene dos años de trabajar con ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos para la compra de materiales de construcción con el objetivo de terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patricia S. is from the town of El Sauce. Gradually, she has been expanding her business which consists of making and selling confections. Her business is located in her home. Patricia has fought together with her five children to get ahead. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and she received three loans which she has used to purchase construction materials with the objective of finishing construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, doors and windows.

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es:
La Señora Juana Isidra G. B. es comerciante del Mercado Central  desde hace 26 años con ayuda de su esposo ella empezo con su negocio  tiene 6 hijas de las cuales dos  dependen de ella,  ella se sacrifica diario vende en el mercado  es una mujer luchadora que siempre ha trabajado en el campo y en su negocio.
La Señora G. invierte en su negocio  ella tambien se ayuda con la elaboración de dulces, ella hace cajetas y bollos en su finca y los viene a vender a su tramo, tambien sus financiamientos les han ayudado a salir adelante y ha invertido a su finquita
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Isidra G. B. is a merchant in the Central Market. Twenty-six years ago, with the help of her husband, she started up her business. She has six daughters, two of whom are her dependents. She sacrifices herself every day to selling in the market. She is a woman who is a fighter, who has always worked in the countryside and in her business. Mrs. G. invests in her business. She also helps in the manufacture of candy and sweets. She makes fudge and buns at her farm, and sells them at her market place. Her loans have also helped her to do well, and have been invested in her small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase merchandise for my business:  tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Time Is Money Group

texts.en:
Edward H. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Time Is Money (in the photo that accompanies this profile, Edward is the one holding the sign). He is thirty years old, married and has three children aged two to four years old. He is also responsible for three nieces. Due to family expenses, he could only continue his education through ninth grade, at which point he had to go into business.

Edward started by selling gas, then decided to get into lumber. For five years now Edward has been selling wood at the Gbengbar Town community in Paynesville, Liberia. He has good relations with his customers which keeps them returning. Edward plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more lumber. His goal is to grow his business into a shop.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts an emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more lumber.

loans.name: Elvie Monarca Group

texts.en:
Elvie M. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Elvie is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elvie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Elshen

texts.en:
Elshen M. was born in 1964, and he is married, with 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  He has now settled in the Absheron region. 

Elshen has been in the home-construction business for 17 years. His father also built houses. Elshen is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials to build houses.

loans.use: To buy materials to build houses

loans.name: Mujeres Comprometidos Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina Mujeres Comprometidas y todas las integrantes se encuentran trabajando y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Una de las señoras muy trabajadoras que esta dentro del comité es la señora María quien se dedica a  Repostería para generar ingresos y ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
En su actividad actualmente le va muy bien y ya que cuenta con este ingreso pero no lo suficiente para el proyecto que tiene que es la de ampliar la habitación de sus hijos solicita del  préstamo para concretar la idea.
texts.en:
This group is named Mujeres Comprometidas and all of the members work and help each other to prosper. One of the women who is very hardworking is María. She dedicates herself to baking to make a living and help her family with the household expenses. Currently, this is going very well for her since she has this income, but it is not enough for the project she is working on, to expand her children's room. She is requesting this loan to make the idea a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks and cement

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia D. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Cornelia is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cornelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cornelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Lailikhon

texts.en: Lailikhon D. is 31 years old. For more than eight years, Lailikhon has been running her own business. She has a small salon where she sells and rents traditional wedding dresses and the national wedding dresses. Traditionally, families in Tajikistan are large; consequently, there are lots of marriages and Lailikhon has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income. Today, Lailikhon requests 4,000 Somoni, with which she is going to purchase new wedding dresses. Lailikhon would like to assure all deciding to support her that she will pay back the loan on time and is grateful to all of you. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new wedding dresses

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es: María Angélica L. H. de 54 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Tacachico, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, de 56 años de edad, quien se dedica a trabajar como agricultor y así mismo vive junto a su pequeña nieta de 13 años de edad, quien estudia por las mañanas y le brinda una pequeña ayuda a María con el negocio. María se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, las cuales hace de lunes a domingo en su casa de habitación, así mismo comercializa granos básicos como arroz y frijoles, y también posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad. Ella es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica a diferentes tipos de trabajo, con el deseo de poder ganar más y así contar con una vida más estable en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de contar con las posibilidades necesarias para invertir aún más en su negocio, comprando maíz por mayor, para elaborar las tortillas y así mismo para comercializarlo, para comprar arroz, frijoles, y así mismo para invertir en la tienda, la cual es uno de sus negocios más fuertes y del cual obtiene más ganancias.
texts.en:
María Angélica L. H. is 54 years old and resides in the town of Tacachico, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, age 56, who works as a farmer. Also living with them is her 13 year old niece who is studying for the future and provides assistance to María in her business.

María works Monday through Sunday at home making tortillas. She also sells dry goods, such as rice and beans, and manages a store where she sells basic necessities. María is a hardworking woman who engages in different business activities because she wants to earn more in order to have a stable life and acquire everything necessary to live better.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can have opportunities to invest more into her business. María plans to buy corn in bulk for making tortillas and to sell. She will also purchase rice and beans for her store, which is her strongest business and the one that generates the most revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn for making tortillas; rice and beans to sell in her store

loans.name: Edmarie

texts.en:
Edmarie D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 44 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Edmarie has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edmarie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. 

Edmarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edmarie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha es una mujer de 55 años de edad, comparte su vida con su esposo Daniel de 54 años y sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace varios años en la venta de ropa y calzados, siendo su método de trabajo por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, es así que viaja frecuentemente al norte del país (ciudad que es conocida por su gran calidad en la fabricación de calzado) para adquirir éstos calzados a un menor precio, además compra ropa, que en su gran mayoría son del gusto del cliente. En un futuro quiere seguir mejorar su negocio para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir la cantidad de ropa y zapatos y con el pedido que tiene con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 55 year-old mother who shares her life with her husband Daniel, 54, and their 4 children in their own home. For a number of years she has sold clothing and footwear. She sells her products by taking orders from her customers. She travels frequently to the northern part of the country (to a city that is well-known for its high quality in shoe manufacturing) to acquire the shoes at a lower price. In addition she also buys clothing according to the tastes of her customers. In the future she wants to continue to improve her business so that she can increase her earnings. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she requests, she will be able to acquire a sufficient quantity of clothing and shoes to fill the orders she has from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more garments to fill orders from her customers

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene, de 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen una hija, Ciomara  de seis añitos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tiene su propia casa. Desde su adolescencia a Rene le ha gustado contribuir con su familia, ya cada mañana se iban a su fuente principal, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, en donde ella labraba la tierra y sembraba, por el cual sus padres le daban propina para su gasto personal. Actualmente produce y comercializa cacao y café, en la cual hace hincapié que todo el conocimiento que adquirió durante su adolescencia lo ha volcado en su negocio agrícola, desde luego que lo está dando buenos resultados económicos, además el producto que los ofrece son primera calidad, y a un precio razonable. Por lo general trabaja con su pareja y juntos hace un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en tiempo de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, con la finalidad de que lo faciliten en la extracción y traslado de sus productos agrícolas hacia los centros de acopio de su localidad, para que de esa manera los pueda vender a sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es abrir un restaurante con la finalidad de que pueda diversificar su cartera de clientes, además de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su  segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su grupo comunal, por la solidaridad que prevalece. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, para que lo dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Rene is 27-years-old. She lives with her partner and has a 6-year-old daughter, Ciomara. They live together in their own home in the town of Quimbiri, located in the lovely rain forest of Cusco. Since she was a teenager Rene has enjoyed contributing to her family. Every morning they would go to their main source of income, the cultivation of cacao, where she worked and sowed the land. For this work her parents gave her pocket money for personal expenses. Currently she produces and sells cacao and coffee. She stresses that all the knowledge she acquired during her adolescence has carried over into her agricultural business and is yielding good economic results. The product she offers is of the highest quality and is reasonably priced. In general she works with her partner and together they make a good working team, but at harvest time she's in charge of her workers and aims to facilitate the extraction and transfer of her agricultural products to the town's commerce center to sell to customers and improve her quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP and she's committed to meeting the payment time line. She's grateful for her communal bank for the solidarity that prevails. With this loan she's requesting she hopes to invest in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers to adequately maintain her cacao and coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her cacao and coffee crops

loans.name: Neida Betzabeth

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo encontramos la ciudadela San Gregorio lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Gregorio.

La señora Neida tiene ya 43 años de feliz matrimonio, fruto de ese gran amor procreo 4 hijos los cuales a pesar de que ya son mayores de edad todavía viven en su casa. Trabaja en una fábrica de chifles de lunes a viernes, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza y perfumería), los mismos que aprovecha para vender a sus compañeras de trabajo.

Tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos automotrices en sociedad  con su hijo mayor el cual además es mecánico y tiene su taller al lado del negocio, lo que facilita las ventas por su cercanía.  Estos repuestos los adquiere de un señor que se los  trae directo de la fabrica y se los entrega al por mayor a menor precio.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar repuestos para carros (parte eléctrica).

Lleva en el Banco Comunal varios ciclos y está muy agradecida de la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le ha brindado y espera seguir así por mucho tiempo mas.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y  poder comprar un carro para hacer las compras directamente.
texts.en:
The members of the loan group San Gregorio meet every fortnight in Ciudadela San Gregorio, in the outskirts of Portoviejo. Neida has been happily married for 43 years and as a result of this great love she has four grown-up children, who still live at home. From Monday to Friday she works in a snack factory. She sells Yanbal products (beauty products and perfumes), also to her workmates. She owns a business that sells car parts along with her eldest son, who is a mechanic and whose garage is next door. This closeness helps sales. She buys the parts from a gentlemen who sells them directly from the factory and gives her a lower wholesale price. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of electric car parts. She has been part of the loan group for a number of cycles and is very grateful to Fundacion Espoir for the support received. She hopes to be able to continue for much longer. Her goals are to continue with her business and buy a car so as to be able to make her purchases herself.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy car repair parts.

loans.name: Ichinhorloo

texts.en:
Ichinhorloo N. lives with her family in Hovd, a western province in Mongolia. There are six people in the family: one daughter, two sons and three grandchildren. One son is a herder in the countryside and another son gets a disability allowance. Her daughter sells fruit.

Ichinhorloo started a grocery store in 2003 in the Han-Ord market, and since 2005 she has operated a grocery kiosk in the Erdeneburen soum [district]. She is an experienced business woman whose goal is to expand her business into a big grocery store. Ichinhorloo is requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase more inventory for her grocery shop. She aspires to a good life.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her grocery shop

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es: Doña Juliana P. O., D. treinta y cinco años D. edad, es una señora casada, tiene tres hijos y dos hijas, Doña Juliana, trata D. apoyar económicamente a su familia, se dedica a la crianza D. animales tales como cerdos y gallinas, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Juliana se dio cuenta que necesitaba comprar más animales para seguir criando y así poD. obtener dinero vendiendo sus animales cuando ya sean granD., pero ella aprovecha sus ganancias vendiendo huevos D. sus gallinas, esta venta lo realiza con sus amigas y vecinas D. su comunidad, por esa razón ella quiere, mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas amigas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 10 años para poder conformar un grupo ya que, mencionado ya viene trabajando desD. hace seis meses, el cual ellas ya, han recibido D. nuevo el segundo crédito, por el cual, ella sigue apoyando, no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, el cual cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. utensilios,  entre otros.
texts.en: Juliana is 35 years old, married, and has three sons and two daughters. Juliana, who is financially supporting her family, works raising animals such as pigs and chickens, and has been doing this for more than 10 years. Juliana realized that she needed to buy more animals in order to continue breeding them and so to obtain money from selling them when they are grown. But she also gets income from selling the eggs from her chickens to her friends and neighbors in her community. She wants to improve her sales and increase her income a little, so she joined-up with some friends that she has known for more than 10 years to create a micro-loan group. They have been working together for six months, and they have already paid back their second loan. She used this to support not just her family but also the people of her community. Each of the women in the group has a different business such as: selling fruits, raising livestock, selling clothes, and selling tools, among others.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorng Y. is a 49-year-old single mother who has been living for years in Kompong Tom province. She was married, but her husband died several years ago. Yorng works from home making furniture which she sells. She has four children, two of whom are in school, and two who are married, live in their own houses and help her make furniture.

Yorng’s furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. Most of her output consists of beds and cupboards, which she accumulates and sells in sets. Recently, Yorng has run out of materials from her stock of wood and rattan, so she would like a loan in order to buy additional materials and more rattan beds to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional materials and more rattan beds to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline C. is from the city of Labo Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aura Olaya

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Libertad #1.
 
Desde hace ya 8 años la señora Aura es socia del Banco Comunal Libertad # 1 y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir ha podido sacar a su familia adelante. Ella tiene 78 años de edad, es viuda y de esa relación tuvo 4 hijos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven aun con ella, uno de sus hijos está enfermo.
 
Ella además de haber sido una gran madre y ama de casa se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene un puesto de comida en el mercado de Portoviejo, prepara deliciosos platos, entre los que los clientes siempre le piden esta el caldo de pata, la guatita, el caldo y seco de gallina entre otros platos que ella con mucho amor prepara, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 23h00, su hija le ayuda en su negocio. Dice que ya tiene su local por muchos años y que siempre le ha ido bien ya que los clientes la prefieren por su sazón.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar arroz, gallinas, gaseosas, y otros productos e ingredientes para preparar sus ricos platos. Sus sueños son que su hijo se cure y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Libertad #1 communal bank meet every two weeks.

Aura has been a member of the Libertad #1 communal bank for eight years. She is very pleased that thanks to the loans she has received from the Fundación Espoir, she has been able to move her family forward. She is 78 years old, a widow and she has four children who are now adults. Two of them still live with her and one of her children is sick.

In addition to being a great mother and housewife, she also sells food. She has a stall in the Portoviejo market preparing delicious meals. Her customers always order these regional dishes: el caldo de pata, la guatita, el caldo y seco de gallina ( dishes made with various parts of cow like the feet and stomach and chicken), along with other dishes. She prepares these meals with lots of love. Aura works everyday from 8am to 11pm. Her daughter helps her with the business. She says that her business has been open for many years now and that her customers prefer her food because of her food’s flavor.

This loan will be used to buy rice, chickens, soft drinks and other products and ingredients needed for her delicious dishes. Her dream is that her son will be healed and he will have good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, chickens, soft drinks and other ingredients to prepare dishes

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
At her young age (31 years old), Lea has become a successful businesswoman. She started her own business using the loan she received from ASHI. It was just a small business then, but because of so many trials in life, Lea strived hard to make it grow and expand. 

Lea feels glad about her business achievement. However, it is not yet stable enough for her to feel financially secure. Without a loan, her business can never grow. Therefore, Lea is requesting another loan in a larger amount to support and maintain her business (e-Load business). 

She hopes that by having this business, she will have more income, have more savings for the future of her only daughter, and will be able to help her other relatives by employing them to work with her in her business.

Her vision of giving her daughter a better future using the proceeds of her business enhanced her eagerness to explore the potentials of her business. Her husband has been so supportive of her business effort. Lea hopes with God’s guidance that she can comply with her loan obligation and give a decent life to her family.

Her long term goal is to secure a stable source of income, and to be financially independent. Lea will use the profits to give a better education to her daughter and save some of it to support and fulfill her business dreams.

loans.use: To support and maintain her business (e-load business).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of three school-aged children. He has almost fifteen years of experience working in construction. He is specialized in completing woodwork and cement projects. His business income is essentiA. to allow him to raise his three children and pay their school fees.  He works hard to be able to satisfy all their needs. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additionA. wood for his newest project. He has high hopes for the future of his business; he is looking to continue expansion of his business in the coming year. In the future, he plans to start working with some construction entrepreneurs in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood for his newest project

loans.name: Nsasa  Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
For the past seven years, 33-year-old  N. Gorette has been successfully overseeing her dairy and pig husbandry businesses in
Nsasa-Mukono. Gorette, whose affiliation is with Nsasa development group, says it was inspiration from her husband that motivated her to set forth. She and her husband are happily married and have two children who both go to school. Prior to starting these businesses she was running a grocery business. She cites hard work and prayers as reasons for her success. These businesses generate 150,000 UGX weekly. With this loan she says she is going to buy a Friesian cow that she anticipates will give her more milk to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur Salif Dembélé  est un homme  qui est âgé de 51 ans et qui vit avec ses 12 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame dans la ville de Sélingué, préfecture de Yanfolila,  Région de Sikasso.
Afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, Salif,  qui entreprena plusieurs activités mais sans succès finit par opter pour le stockage commercialement de céréales.  
Nanti  de 6  années d’expériences dans le domaine, il est très sollicité.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroître, Salif décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Salif  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 tonnes de riz  et 2 tonnes de maïs  auprès des paysans producteurs de Sélingué et environs qu’il stockera au  moins quelques mois. Il effectue sa vente au marché de Dalabala et Bamako, en gros et en détail, au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Salif espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Salif Dembele is a 51-year old man who lives with his 12 children and his wife in a monogamous family in the city of Selingue. It is located in the prefecture of Yanfolila in the region of Sikasso. 

In order to integrate himself into the economy, Salif, who took on several business activities without success, finally decided to concentrate in the sale of cereal grains. 

With the benefit of 6 years' experience in the field, he is highly solicited. 

In order to satisfy an ever growing clientele, Salif decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner), with which he is on his first individual loan. 

Salif plans on using his loan to purchase 3 tons of rice and 2 tons of corn from the producers in Selingue and the surrounding regions. He will store the products for at least one month. He makes his sales in the market in Dalabala and Bamako in wholesale and retail, completing the sale in cash and occasionally on credit. His clientele is made up of women and men. 

Salif expects to earn a monthly income of 50.000 FCFA which will be used to repay this loan, to provide his family's expenses, and to invest the remaining portion in his business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es rentista; vive en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Su vivienda tiene una habitación que funciona como sala, pero con el crecimiento de su familia y el espacio reducido en su vivienda necesita la división de esa habitación para habilitarla para sus hijos; vive en casa propia. Con el dinero del crédito comprara material de construcción, ladrillo, cemento, estuco para dividir la habitación. Esto para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia..  
Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en: Javier lives on income he makes from renting out property.  He lives in Tacagua neighborhood, in the city of La Paz .  His home has a room that is currently used as a living room but with the growth of his family and the reduced space in his home, he needs to divide this room up so that his children can live in it.  Javier owns his own home.  He will use his loan money to buy building supplies, cement and stucco (render) to divide the room.  This will improve the living conditions of his family.  This is Javier's fourth loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy materials to divide up a room in his home so that his children can live more comfortably

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow his business and purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción como arena y piedras para cimientos en las construcciones de las casas, su esposo es el que adquiere la materia prima en las orillas de los ríos mas cercanos para abastecerse de material. Le agrada desarrollar este trabajo porque le permite tener mejores ganancias a comparación de otros negocios, además de que considera  de que esta actividad es muy rentable porque siempre el rubro de la construcción es permanente en su demanda y lo importante en su negocio es  tener más capital disponible para adquirir más materia prima por lo que su deseo es contar  con un almacén más amplio. Es su crédito en MFP, ha tenido una experiencia positiva de créditos en su banco comunal donde valora bastante el desarrollo del habito del ahorro, en la actualidad solicita un crédito individual de la cual se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. En esta ocasión el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más agregados.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  For 8 years, she has been selling building supplies such as sand and stone for making cement that is used in building houses  Her husband stocks the business with raw materials which he acquires from the banks of the nearest rivers.  Eduarda likes this work because it allows her to good profits compared to other businesses.  She also considers her business to be very profitable because the building trade has a permanent demand for supplies.  The important thing in her business is having capital available in order to acquire more raw materials.  Her wish is to have a bigger warehouse.

Luzmila is receiving this loan from MFP.  She has had positive experiences in taking loans as a member of her community bank.  She is particularly happy to have developed a savings habit.  Eduarda is currently requesting an individual loan and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  On this occasion, she will invest the loan money that she is requesting in buying more aggregate materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy aggregate construction materials

loans.name: Pay It Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Pay It” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are small-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Marie K.. Marie was born in Kailahun, a town in eastern Sierra Leone about 50 years ago. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader and her children are in college. 

Marie has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells rice, palm-oil, flour, pepper, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, flour, pepper, margi, salt and more in bulk

loans.name: Sofa

texts.es: Sofa, D. 65 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo Maurelio, con el que tiene 9 hijos; D. los cuales solo cría y educa a 3 D. ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Tiambra. DesD. niña aprendió a trabajar la tierra, cuidarla y producirla, pero cuando tenía 25 años se independizó y emprendió su propio trabajo cultivando arveja y papa, productos  que son vendidos en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, brindándole estabilidad económica a su esposo e hijos. Paralelo a ello, Sofa elabora queso con la leche que extrae D. las 10 vacas que posee, según cuenta, todos los viernes baja a la feria que se realiza en la ciudad, para vender el queso por kilos; en ocasiones viaja a la selva central para vender el producto lácteo a un mayor precio. Ahora ella está pensando sembrar papa D. la variedad “única” y “yungay”, para poder cosechar en una buena temporada y así pagar los estudios D. sus últimos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa D. Tiambra”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el apoyo recibido, en todo estos años D. arduo trabajo con su asociación. Sofa, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono D. corral (orgánico), los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos D. arveja.
texts.en:
Sofa is 65 years old and is a hard working woman.  She lives with her husband and has nine children, three of whom still live at home.  They live in Tiambra.  She leaned to work the land when she was a little girl, but at age 25 she started her own farming business, raising peas, potatoes, which are sold in the main Tarma market.  This helps bring economic stability to her, to her husband, and to her children.

Along with farming, Sofa also makes cheese from the milk from her 10 cows.  She tells us that she takes all of the foodstuffs to the city fair to sell by the kilogram.  Sometimes she travels to the central jungle to sell her milk products in bulk.

Now she is considering planting “única” and “yungay” potatoes to be able to harvest in a good season and be able to pay for her children’s’ educational expenses.  She is a member of the “Santa Rosa D. Tiambra” communal bank.  This will be her ninth loan through MFP, and she is grateful for the support she has gotten over the years.  She will use the money to buy sacks of organic (coral) fertilizer to spread on her pea crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: María Estefa

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a su pequeña hija en el caserío de  Barrio Libre que se ubica en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la Región de Piura, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos, recorriendo también los diferentes caseríos de la zona donde vive. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio ya que desea incrementar sus ventas en la temporada de verano- otoño ya que durante esta temporada la demanda por su negocio aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

María es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old and a single mother who lives with her young daughter in the village of Barrio Libre, which is located in the District of Las Lomas. This farming area experiences significant business activity and is located in Piura region, which is more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

María sells clothes. She offers her products on credit and for cash and sells them primarily to her neighbors and acquaintances. María also travels to different villages in the same district where she lives. This business has been a great help to her family’s finances and has enabled her to maintain her daily way of life.

María wants to acquire more merchandise so that she can expand her business. She wants to increase her sales during the summer and autumn seasons since there is more demand on these occasions. For this reason, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 500 PEN to help her accomplish this goal.

María is a hardworking and earnest young woman. The people who know her admire her drive to succeed and make progress.

loans.use: to acquire more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: ESPOIR est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Mireille. Les membres du groupe résident dans la même zone géographique. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née le 28 Décembre 1982 Cotonou (Bénin), Mireille vit depuis dix ans environs à Kindonou, un quartier de Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Mireille est mariée à revendeur du nom de Ganiou. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mireille assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Mireille a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Mireille exerce cette activité depuis six ans environs, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. Parallèlement, Mireille vend des mèches, des tissus et des produits de beauté dans son atelier situé à Kindonou. Mireille achète ses  produits à Lomé au Togo. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Mireille et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
ESPOIR is a group made up of three people. The president (raising her finger in the photo) is called Mireille. The group members all live in the same area. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group is asking for their first loan from ALIDé.
 
Mireille was born on December 28, 1982. For the last 10 years she has lived in Kindonou, a neighborhood of Cotonou (Benin's economic capital). Mireille is married to a wholesaler called Ganiou. They have two children, both of whom go to school. Together, Mireille and her husband are responsible for the household's various expenses. Mireille left school at the secondary level, then learnt to be a hairstylist. She has been doing this for about six years, which has allowed her to meet her family's needs. At the same time, Mireille sells hair extensions, fabric and beauty products in her shop located in Kindonou. She buys her products in  Lomé, Togo. This first loan will allow Mireille and her group to increase their level of activity, attract more clients and raise their income.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, fabric and beauty products

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif is 31 years old.  He is an Internally Displaced Person who has suffered from the war and has lost everything. He started his new livestock breeding business in Bilasuvar, where he is now living. 

Vasif is married and has two children. He has a great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business together with his wife for 5 years. Vasif would like to expand his business by adding more cows to the ones he now has. This is because he has recently acquired orders from outside his town to supply milk.   He is requesting a loan of 1100 AZN. 

With the additional income earned, Vasif will be better able to meet his family's financial obligations, especially to pay for the future education of his children.

loans.use: purchase two dairy cows and more fodder

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 30 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 11. She earns a living by sewing different styles of clothing. Her business is well organized and she has four years of experience. She works from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day. Delphine employs one person to help her.

Delphine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cloth for sewing clothes. She hopes to increase her profits so she can save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Novederio

texts.en:
Novederio is 29 years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is unmarried with one child. 

Novederio has a pigpen that he raises piglets to be sold in the future. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy animal feed for the piglets.

Novederio has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Novederio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for piglets.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 58-year-old businesswoman married to Kimani, who contributes to the family income. They are blessed with six adult children. Catherine has been buying and selling new clothes for the past eleven years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family members and sustain her business.

Catherine is applying for her second loan with KADET, having repaid the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to add new clothing stock to her business. Catherine will use the anticipated profit from the business to feed her family and to stock up her business. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her family's living standard and to be financially sustainable.

loans.use: to add new clothing stock to her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are in school. Betty lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent and school fees
Betty has a business selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Betty has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: El señor José Alberto desde hace 12 años labora para un empresa reconocida como promotor del producto ofreciendo de tienda en tienda trasladándose en automóvil que es su herramienta de trabajo. Desde hace 9 años el adquirió su vivienda de interés social ala cual le ha hecho variedad de mejoras, pero en este momento necesita cambiar la pintura del exterior e interior ya que esta muy deteriorada por el sol, para esto el necesita comprar la herramienta necesaria y comprar la pintura para que su casa se vea en mejores condiciones. Es padre de familia que se preocupara por el bienestar y confort de la misma es por ello que trabaja duro para poder sostener los gastos.
texts.en: José Alberto has been working as a sales rep for a well-known firm for the last 12 years. He goes from store to store in a car that’s his work tool.  Nine years ago he bought a government subsidized house that he’s done a variety of improvements to but currently he needs to repaint the interior and the exterior because it’s quite sun damaged.  Because of this he needs to buy the necessary tools and to buy paint so that his house will be in better condition.  He’s a father concerned for his family’s comfort and wellbeing and this is why he works hard to cover expenses.

loans.use: to paint the interior and the exterior of his house.

loans.name: Donnys

texts.es: Donnys de 49 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 7 años en el municipio de Soledad, donde se dedica a la producción de alimentos, negocio con el cual genera los principales ingresos a su hogar. Donnys antes de iniciar su negocio trabajaba en las minas de carbón, pero su compañero falleció y lo impactó tanto esta situación, que abandonó el riesgoso oficio que desempeñaba. Así fue como inició  su negocio de vender peto (bebida a base de maíz pilado, canela y leche), patacones y chorizos. Con su negocio ha tenido un cambio favorable pues ha construido una clientela y se ha acreditado en el sitio en el cual se encuentra ubicado. Su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo que se torna insuficiente para lograr aumentar su mercado, sus ventas son de contado y manja pocos inventarios, porque compra diariamente en los graneros del barrio y esto no le permite acceder a buenos descuentos, por volumen. Su crédito es el primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará   materias primas para la preparación de sus productos, como maíz pilado, canela, leche, plátanos, aceite y chorizo para aumentar sus ventas y también comprar sillas y mesas para lograr un más confortable ambiente para sus clientes. Su sueño es adecuar su vivienda con mejores condiciones habitacionales, para todos los días continuar contribuyendo a un mejor estar de sus hijos y su cónyuge.
texts.en: Donnys is 49 years old. He lives with his partner and their three children who are from 3 to 7 years old in the town of Soledad, where he is dedicated to the production of food, a business with which he generates the main income for his home. Donnys, before he began his business, worked in the coal mines but his friend was killed and this situation impacted him so much that he abandoned the risky job that he performed. This is how he started his business selling peto (a drink based on cracked corn, cinnamon and milk), plaintains and chorizo. With his business, he has had a favorable change since he's built a customer base and has proven himself in the spot where he is located. His greatest disadvantage is his working capital which becomes insufficient to expand his market. His sales are cash sales and he manages little inventory because he buys from the neighborhood graneries on a daily basis and this does not allow him to give good discounts, by volume. His loan is the first loan that he's made with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With it, he will buy raw materials for the preparation of his products, such as cracked corn, cinnamon, milk, bananas, oil and chorizo to expand his sales and also buy chairs and table to achieve a more comfortable atmosphere for his customers. His dream is to adapt his home with better living conditions so every day he can continue contributing to the wellbeing of his children and partner.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the preparation of his products, such as cracked corn, cinnamon, milk, bananas, oil and chorizo.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is the father of five children. He has been farming rice for the past five years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds and harvesting. Jean Pierre wishes to use the profits from his farming to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his rice garden.

loans.name: Rosa Escarleth

texts.es: Rosa tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a este medio de vida. Su mayor desafío ha sido buscar a las personas a quienes les vendió productos y no le han pagado. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, que con mucho sacrificio les ha brindado estudio, alimento y vestimenta. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, cremas, tratamientos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa has her business, which is the sale of cosmetics. She has made a living this way for 3 years. Her greatest challenge has been to find those people to whom she has sold products who have not yet paid for them. 

Rosa has three young children who are dependent on her and for whom, at great sacrifice, she has provided an education, food and clothing. Consequently she is requesting this loan to buy lip pencils, nail polish, lipstick, creams and beauty treatments, among other items.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, nailpolish, lipstick, creams, beauty treatments, among other items.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married with 4 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Elsa owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 3000 to purchase groceries to sell.

Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: María Manuela De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación, es de clima frió, su población en la mayoría se dedica a la agricultura o cría de animales, su gente es muy amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña María tiene 72 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Su esposo debido a su edad pasa en casa la misma que es de su propiedad siendo el sacrificio del trabajo en su juventud.

La Señora María se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, tiene gallinas, vacas y cerdos, los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Ella tiene su propio terreno donde cría sus animalitos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus potreros y alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es de conservar su salud.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank "14 de Agosto" and lives in the community of Zhidmad. A place of abundant vegetation, Zhimad has a cold climate and its people mostly work in agriculture or raising animals. The people of Zhidmad are friendly, polite and maintain their culture and the traditions of their parents. 

María is 72, married and has had eight children who are all adults, married and independent. Because of his age, her husband stays at home which they own as a result of the sacrifice he made while working in his youth.  

María raises and sells animals. She has chickens, cows and pigs which she sells whenever they need the money. She has her own land where she raises her animals.  

This is the third loan she has taken out with the community bank and she will use it to buy fertiliser and animal feed.

Her goal is to keep in good health.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and animal feed

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
In October 2008, Ellen was one of many to be laid off at her company. She decided that she wanted pursue something that she would enjoy and incorporate that with her love for animals. Ellen researched online and determined that incorporating dogs into a business would be a natural fit for her.

Ellen got her first dog, Trace, knowing that she would train him to become a mold and bed bug detection dog. On the bed bug detection front, she and Trace have a contract with Orkin and she earns a base salary as well as separate referrals. On the mold detection front, Ellen gets her own cases through personal ads and word of mouth. She and Trace only provide mold detection services on the weekends because Trace needs frequent breaks. Trace can only work 4 hours at a time with a minimum 5-hour break, so Ellen has to teach her second dog, Mason, to detect mold. 

Ellen found Mason at a local shelter and he was due to be euthanized in the next couple of hours. Both of the dogs come from shelters, so she feels good about taking “society’s throw-away dogs” and giving them a job to perform. She says it is important to have two dogs to work interchangeably so they can have breaks in between. Both Trace and Mason are a big part of Ellen’s family, and have the love and attention of four teenagers.

This loan from Accion USA will enable Ellen to have her second dog trained for detection services. This will help Ellen expand her business by being able to use both dogs for mold detection.

loans.use: To have her dog trained for mold detection services.

loans.name: Naboti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyirere, leader du groupe d’affaire «Naboti », est  une jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 27  ans, mariée, mère de 2 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un enseignant. Elle est  vendeuse de souliers. Il y a  3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  3eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  25 paires de souliers à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Nyirere is the leader of the 'Naboti' group.  She is a young 27-year-old entrepreneur who is married and has two young children.  Her husband is a teacher.  Nyirere sells shoes.  She has been in this small income-generating activity for three years and has just received her third loan from Hekima.  She will use this new loan to stock up with 25 pairs of shoes to sell.  In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and buy a plot of land.  She thanks Hekima for their actions in favor of poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Elvia has a food shop that sells snacks like banana & sweet potato cue. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks .
Elvia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Miguelito, a vendor, and mother to their three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elena operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are children’s clothes, ready-to-wear and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to her low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 5  filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade e 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Moamba para o Distrito de Boane quando se juntou com se marido, é negociante dedica-se a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra  da sua casa(chapas, reia, cimento, pedra,blocos  e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Violeta was born in the district of Moamba, Maputo province in Southern Mozambique.  She is widowed and has 5 children, 2 who are adults and 3 who are in school.  She attended school through the 4th grade but did not finish because her parents did not have the financial resources.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports 4 grandchildren who live with her. 

She left Moamba for the Boane district when she married her husband.  She is a merchant and for the past 2 years has had a business selling basic needs items.  She earns around 4.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

Violeta has never had a loan in another bank.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 17.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials to continue work on her home (metal panels, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.). 

She promises to make payments as scheduled.  In the future she plans to finish construction on her home and furnish it, and for that purpose she will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to continue work on her home (metal panels, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has owned a salon and a cosmetics shop for the past five years, and earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. She is 35 years old, married to Lazarus, and a mother of two school going children.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the loan amount to add stock of cosmetics, as well as chemicals relaxers, shampoo, braids and wigs for sale.

With the anticipated profits, she will save and provide for her family's basic needs. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to add stock of cosmetics, as well as chemical relaxers, shampoo, braids and wigs for sale.

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es: El señor Luis a sus 38 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 7 años, se dedica a la producción y venta de productos de aseo tales como clorox, aromatizantes, jabones, escobas y traperos, con esta actividad lleva 10 años gracias a un amigo quien le enseño la formulación para fabricar estos productos. El señor Luis requiere de la compra materia prima y material de empaque que le faciliten y le permitan elaboran un mayor numero de producto terminado y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle lo  mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: Luis is 38 years old and the father of a 7-year-old son. He makes and sells cleaning products such as laundry bleach, home fragrances, soap, brooms and mops. He has been in this business for 10 years, thanks to a friend who taught him the formulas to make these products. Luis needs to purchase supplies and packaging material which will make it easier for him to make a higher volume of finished product. That way he can meet his customers' orders, improve his living conditions and provide the best for his son.
