loans.use: to purchase supplies to make detergent, home fragrances, brooms and mops.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Guadalupe es de Villa ygatimi, esta integrado por 10 mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras quienes por medio del trabajo en conjunto desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa, pero comentan que desean llegar al máximo nivel.
María es una de estas mujeres, ella es muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Comenta que se dedica a la manicura, en lo cual le va muy bien puesto que le gusta lo que hace, y lo hace bien. Tiene buena clientela y eso la ayuda a tener buenos ingresos y a seguir creciendo. Una de sus metas es poder tener una peluquería donde pueda poder atender a las personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de quita esmalte, limas, esmalte para uñas y demás insumos que necesite para su trabajo. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Guadalupe [Communal Bank] is from Villa Ygatimi. It is composed of 10 hard-working, determined women who want to progress and to help their families through working together. They are in their first loan cycle, but say that they want to work at the highest level. 

María is one of these women. She is very hardworking and enterprising. She is dedicated to her work as a manicurist, and is doing well because she enjoys doing it and is good at her work. She has good customers, and that helps her bring in a good income and go on growing. One of her goals is to one day have a salon where she can serve her customers. She is seeking the loan to buy nail polish remover, nail files, nail polish and other materials she needs for her work. She is grateful to the field partner and to Kiva for the opportunities they offer.

loans.use: To buy nail-polish, nail-polish removers, nail files and other materials.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 1 child. 

Susan has a tailoring shop that sews and repairs clothes such as uniforms and jeans. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis, de 41 años de edad, es un hombre empeñoso y trabajador, además de ser amable y muy colaborador. Convive con Katya con quien tiene un negocio familiar. Tienen 02 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad, y juntos habitan en su propia casa en compañía de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Elvis es el transporte fluvial, para ello cuenta con una embarcación conocida como Morochata, con capacidad de 50 pasajeros. Dicha nave lo construyó con su propio capital pero se demoró por que le faltaba completar el costo. Su recorrido lo realiza por el rio Ucayali, uniendo varios pueblos y caseríos, asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, para el manejo del personal y administración de su negocio. Tiene 15 años realizando ésta actividad y gracias a ello a conocido lugares y zonas de la amazonía peruana, asimismo de los ingresos económicos que le ha generado ha logrado solventar los gastos de su familia. Éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles desea invertirlo en la compra de mercadería como productos regionales los cuales piensa comprar en los caseríos ubicados a las riveras  del río, de esa manera empezará con otro negocio.
texts.en:
Elvis, 41 years old, is a diligent and hard-working man as well as being kind and working very well with other people.

He lives with Katya, with whom he has a family business. They have 2 children, 14 and 6 years old, and together they live in their own home with his parents.

Elvis's works transporting people on the river, for which he has a boat know as Morochata, which has room for 50 passengers. He built this boat with his own money, but it took a long time because he didn't have the funds for the whole cost. His route is along the Ucayali riverm which joins various towns and small villages, he also relies on the support of his partner who runs the personal and administrative sides of their business. 

He has 15 years of experience in this line of work, thanks to which he has come to know places and areas of the Peruvian Amazon. The income he has generated has also allowed him to settle his family's expenses. 

This will be his first loan with MFP, whose collaboration will allow him to realize his plans. With the requested sum of 1000 PEN, he wants to buy merchandise, such as regional products that he believes he can buy in the small villages located on the banks of the river, in this way he plans to start another business.

loans.use: to buy regional products from the rainforest, like food and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jean Pascal

texts.fr: Jean Pascal est un homme de 25 ans célibataire. Après sa formation, il ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis quatre ans déjà. il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, tondeuses et petit matériel dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité et aménager sa boutique. Ceci lui  permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de ses enfants, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Jean Pascal is a 25-year-old single man. After his training, he opened a hair salon he has already been running for four years.

He often encounters problems due to lack of cosmetics, hair clippers and small equipment in his salon because he buys his products at retail prices. His aim is to satisfy his customers and make great profits.

He is requesting a loan so he can buy his material in large quantities and rearrange his salon. This will enable him to achieve his objectives.

Profits from this loan will help to satisfy his needs, those of his children, and also to save so he can expand his activity in the future.

loans.use: increase his stock of cosmetics and rearrange his salon

loans.name: Ndèye Bineta

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the women’s tontine Daara Seydina Limamou Laye, represented by Ndèye Bineta T..  Based in the old fishing village of Yoff on the Dakar peninsula, the members of Daara Seydina Limamou Laye sell homemade juices and syrups made from typical West African produce such as the dried flowers of the bissap plant, ginger, tamarind, “monkey bread” (pulp from the seed pods of the baobab tree), yams, and mangoes.  The loan requested by the group will be invested in the expansion of their juice and syrup business, financing:

  
  • The wholesale purchase of input ingredients: bissap, tamarind, sugar, ginger, “monkey bread”, lemons, yams and mangoes
  • The purchase of equipment and production materials: large buckets and pots, manual juicing mills, water, gas fuel, and jars
  • Transportation of the finished products to market

Background

 Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group.  Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines.  Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities.  Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members.  However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income.  This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities.  Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Production and marketing of juices and syrups

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira M. owns a butcher shop in the town of Khachmaz located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. She and her husband both operate the store on a daily basis. Elmira is looking for funding in order to purchase a cow for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny uses the land around her house to plant and grow bananas and taros. She lives in Sinamoga, which is a larger town, so she has to make good use of the land around her home. Fertilizers are the main food for the land and help to increase the harvest yield; Jenny knows the right time to apply them. Jenny’s husband takes the crops they grow to the market to be sold when they are harvested. Jenny’s husband also works, and provides extra money for the family. Jenny also works on her plantation with the help of her father.

loans.use: to purchase fertilisers, taro roots, bushknives

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is a married man and has two children, he started his business to maintain his family and three years ago he began with arts and crafts sales and also antiques that are very common and also required in his town because is a tourist zone with a lot of tourists. His children are young and they do not have studies and for this reason he wants to have a better income to offer his kids basic education, so, he decided to expand his business making rustic furniture which are required by his clients. His business lets him grow little by little and he wants to continue this growth, this way he can offer a better quality of life to his family.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan of US $550 and offers to repay this loan in 6 months, with this loan he will purchase raw material to make his rustic furniture because he has orders to complete and this kind of product takes a time to make. He also wants to maintain his clients. He thanks you for all your support that you can give to him that will let him continue grow with his business.

SPANISH

Guadalupe es un hombre casado y tiene dos hijos, él inició su negocio para poder mantener a su familia y empezó hace tres años atrás con la venta de artesanías y antigüedades que son muy solicitadas en su región por que es una zona turística bastante visitada. Sus hijos son pequeños y no estudian y por ello el desea tener una mejor fuente de ingresos para poder brindarles educación e incursiono en la elaboración de muebles rústicos, los que también tuvieron mucha aceptación por parte de sus clientes. Su negocio le ha permitido crecer poco a poco y desea continuar con su crecimiento y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 que los ofrece pagar en seis meses, con el cual el podrá comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los muebles rústicos que ya tiene pedidos y como son hechos artesanalmente toman algo de tiempo y quiere cumplir con sus pedidos y mantener a sus clientes. Él agradece mucho el apoyo que le des para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es:
Julia is 35 years old and has a domestic partner. She has a 14 year old daughter and two sons that are 7 and 9 years old. Six years ago, Julia started a business selling natural juice to support herself and her partner ,since he's been living on a low pension. Upon her customers' requests, Julia started to sell soft drinks, which was successful. Now she sells articles and trinkets and some clothing. Due to her savvy sales skills and desire to provide a good education for her children, Julia works even harder day to day.

Currently, she is seeking a loan of $475 which she will use to buy more merchandise to keep her business well-stocked and thus, offer good service. She promises to repay the loan in 3 months. The well-being of her family is in your hands. Make the choice to help Julia - she and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene una hija de 14 años de edad y dos hijos de 7 y 9 años. Hace seis años Julia comenzó a vender jugos naturales para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar ya que él está pensionado y recibe un ingreso muy bajo, poco después, a petición de sus clientes, Julia incorporó la venta de refrescos obteniendo muy buenos resultados, ahora también vende artículos de mercería y un poco de ropa, gracias a su gusto por las ventas y al deseo que tiene de que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación Julia se esfuerza día con día por mejorar su negocio.

Ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a ayudar a Julia, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, 30, has been in the Mankessim market for over 10 years now. Initially, she was selling cosmetics, but soon realized that cloth and dressmaking material has a higher demand at the market so she switched over. Her goal is for her store be the purchasing center for dressmaking material, such that people from all the neighboring towns will come to the market for her products.

Sometimes Patricia lets her brother take care of her store so that she has time for her 10-year-old daughter. Patricia balances between being a single mother and a business owner.

Patricia is a member of the lending group in the Mankessim market. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: Purchase zippers, thread material, and other dressmaking materials

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad is 47 years old, married and has 2 children. The M. family lives in Khachmaz town. Elshad buys chickens and raises them for sale. He has run this business for 4 years.  Now he needs a loan of  $475 to  buy  hens and chicken for increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy  hens and chicken

loans.name: Ševala

texts.en:
Ševala is a 51-year-old woman from a small village called Bašigovci near the town of Živinice. Her husband is self-employed in construction. His monthly income is US$ 300 (when weather permits). Agriculture and raising livestock is the basic income source by which Ševala supports her family. They have two daughters; one is a student.

This is Ševala's first loan with MCO WWI in the amount of US$ 450. Her intention is to buy a cow. Ševala has two cows and she is going to expand this business to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: Buying a cow

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia V. is a young vivacious woman of thirty-six. She is married to Jorge Arturo Garcia, who works as a driver for a transportation business which works between the neighboring countries. Felicia works as a seamstress for the business Cecilia Fadul. She specializes in a special type of sewing called ao poí.

The loan which she is asking for will be used to buy fabrics for her area of specialty in sewing. With the loan she will be able to buy the fabric in bulk and lower the prices of her clothes. This will attract more buyers and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Ms. Khanifa is a low-income, vulnerable woman. She is 44, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli city in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region.

Khanifa owns a small herd of milk cows. She sells milk in the Saatli bazaar. Her family expenditures are increasing as her children grow. Khanifa plans to increase the number of cattle to increase her income. But this project requires an investment. This winter, Khanifa has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $600 USD . She hopes this credit will let her change her family life.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela C. D. T. is a member of the Communal Bank "San Martin D. Porres," and lives in the Juanjui district of the Mariscal Caceres province, located in the San Martin region. She works selling beauty products from her home, at Jr. Eduardo Peña Mesa Nº 223.

For the last twelve years she has sold perfume and cosmetics from companies like esika, Avon and Unique, either by taking orders or through catalogs. Most of her clients are her neighbors, friends and relatives.

With this S/. 1000.00 (local currency, nuevo soles) loan, to be repaid in six months, Estela will purchase various products such as perfume, lotions, shampoo, soap, makeup, deodorant, etc., and she plans to buy those brands that go on sale so she can build up her stock and offer a wider variety of products. This will help her to cater to her customers' needs.

Estela is 60 years old, and lives with her husband and their five independent children, who are very supportive of her as she strives to meet her goals. She works every day with much perseverance and hopes to someday have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Estela Córdova D. T., es socia del Banco Comunal “San Martín D. Porres” vive en el Departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Caceres, Distrito D. Juanjui, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Mesa Nº 223.

Se dedica hace 12 años a la venta D. artículos D. perfumería y cosméticos D. diferentes marcas como esika, Avon, Unique, que lo venD. a través D. pedidos y por catalogo, siendo sus principales clientes sus vecinos, amigos y familiares.

Con el crédito D. S/. 1000.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos más, D. estas marcas que salen en ofertas para tener en stock y variar sus productos para así satisfacer los gustos D. sus clientes

Tiene 60 años vive con su esposo y sus 05 hijos independientes , la están apoyando para lograr sus metas, día a día trabaja con mucha perseverancia, anhelando mas adelante tener un local propio.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria S. started the business when she stopped working. At that time, her son was 4 years old, and she did not have enough money because they could not cover all the expenses with her husband’s income. For this reason, she started to sell beauty products to her neighbors and acquaintances by catalogue 15 years ago.

She now needs a loan of $600 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase more merchandise and host a beauty product party, which will help her increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria S. inicio el negocio cuando dejo de trabajar, el dinero no alcanzaba y en aquel tiempo su hijo tenia 4 años, con el sueldo de su esposo no completaban para solventar todos los gastos, por tal motivo se puso a vender productos de belleza por catalogos. Comenzo hace 15 años comprando los catalogos y asi empezo a vender entre sus vecinos y conocidos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancia y realizar una demostracion, la cual le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin T., 28, is married and lives in Siem Reap Province with her three young children. She sells soft drinks, making $3 each day, while her husband sells souvenirs in front of the temple, making around $3 every day as well. Rin T. wishes to expand her business to reach more customers, but she lacks the capital necessary to do so. She is therefore requesting a loan of $500 to invest in her family’s businesses. She would like to put $300 into her husband's souvenir business and $200 into her own soft drink business. She believes that these sustainable investments will increase the family's daily income. Rin T. has an entrepreneurial mindset and would like to see these businesses expand even more in the future.

loans.use: To invest in both the souvenir business and the soft drink business.

loans.name: Mawutoe

texts.fr:
Mr. Mawutoè A., 32, is married and the father of 2 children. He was born in Akoumapé in the Vo Prefecture and now lives in Lomé. He is a computer systems specialist and his shop, "Universal.com", which is at the same time a retail outlet has been open since 2003. He offers computer systems maintenance. He also buys used computers at low prices and repairs them to re-sell them at a profit. He also sells laptops and computer accessories.

Mr. A. is requesting this first loan so that he can fill an order for 2 computers and accessories.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 32 ans monsieur A. Kokou Mawutoè est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est né à Akoumapé dans la préfecture de VO et vit aujourd’hui à Lomé. Il est maintenancier et son atelier,’’Universal.com’’, qui lui sert en même temps de boutique est fonctionnel depuis 2003. Il fourni des services de maintenance informatique. Il fait aussi l’achat des ordinateurs d’occasion à des prix moins élevés, qu’il répare et revend à des prix plus élevés. Il y associe aussi la vente de portables et accessoires pour ordinateur.

Monsieur A. sollicite ce premier crédit pour répondre à une commande de 02 ordinateurs et des accessoires.

loans.use:
Purchase of computers and accessories

Achat d'ordinateurs et accessoires

loans.name: Luk

texts.en: This the second time Mrs. Luk K. has taken out a loan to improve her business activity. She sells lottery tickets in the village of Thmey in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Sen Kloeng, is a fisherman and he now faces a problem in his business because he does not have enough fishing equipments to gather fish, especially a boat. In order to improve this business, his wife, Mrs. Luk K., decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy a motor for it. Mrs. Luk K. is 55 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom helps the father with his business while two assist their mother in business. The remaining three are attending school. Mrs. Luk K. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and a motor for it

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Virginia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de comida, menestras y mote sancochado. El negocio está ubicado en un puesto del mercado Nº 02 de la ciudad, lugar donde acuden sus comensales, los cuales son mayormente los vendedores de ese sector y transeúntes del lugar.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  insumos que necesita para la preparación diaria de sus platos, como azúcar, arroz en sacos, aceite en galón, fideos en paquetes, y demás insumos que compra a diario, también comprará menestras y maíz para sancocharlos y luego venderlos.     

La señora Maria Virginia tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijas, quienes la apoyan en sus momentos libres en las actividades de la casa. Ella trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a sus hijos y también quiere darles un futuro mejor. Es una mujer muy activa, tiene como meta contar con un local para poner un restaurante con la venta de menú, y contar con un personal bajo su administración.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Virginia is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) microfinance institute. She lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the Tarapoto district. She sells food, vegetable stews, and mote sancochado (corn kernels boiled with cilantro). Her business is located in a stand in the Nº 02 market of the city, where her patrons, who are predominantly market vendors and passers-by, got to have a meal.

With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals, such as sugar, sacks of rice, gallons of cooking oil, packages of noodles, and other ingredients that she buys on a daily basis. She will also purchase legumes and corn in order to boil them in cilantro and sell them.

Ms. Maria Virginia is 37 years of age and lives with her husband and 2 daughters, who support her in their spare time with the household chores. Maria Virginia works everyday in order to help her children get ahead and offer them a better future. She is a very active woman who has the goal of obtaining a business space to set up a restaurant, offering an extensive menu, as well as having personnel under her administration.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals (sugar, rice, cooking oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Grace U. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, aged one and four. Grace has been running a cattle business since 2003, selling milk. She works at the business for four hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Grace currently earns about 200USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy two cows. In the future, she plans to increase her number of cattle. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom P. was born in 1957 and now lives in Prey Kla Tboung village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. 

Her husband, Mr. Nuo Choub, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On his plantation, he faces some problems because his field is infertile soil and has a lot of pests, which hurt his crop. He does not have enough money to hire laborers to support his field. 

In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sokhom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve her life with this loan. 

She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other two children are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and hire laborers to plant seedlings and harvest rice.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: A. Matluba first applied to MicroInvest in 2007. She applied for a business development loan and thanks to previous loans she could open a trade outlet in the central bazaar. Mrs. A. Matluba trades in Khujand local bazaar. She trades in fruits and has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She has repeat customers and she is very polite and kind by nature. Mrs. A. Matluba asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2000 STJ for 6 months to open her second trade outlet in another bazaar.

loans.use: Open a second trade outlet opening in another bazaar

loans.name: Shabana Ishtiaq Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shabana baji is a 32 -year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady. She couldn’t attend school because the school was far away from her house and there were no conveyances to reach the school. She got married at the age of 17 to a person whose name is I. A. who is a driver, driving a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shabana baji is the mother of three daughters. Her eldest daughter is in 9th standard. Another is in 4th standard. Her youngest daughter is in kindergarten. Shabana baji is a very responsible woman. She wishes to give her daughters everything she didn’t get in her life. She and Mr. I. A. decided to share the financial burden of supporting their family. So she takes the responsibility for her daughters' education and her husband takes the responsibility for household expenses. Shabana baji successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy a new auto-rickshaw for her husband.

Shabana baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Zubaida S. baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sabri baji wants a loan to buy milk to re-sell. Samina H. baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to re-sell. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone shop. Noreen baji wants a loan to repair her 32-seater bus called “Coaster”.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine Nyungula is a business lady aged  39. She has a retail shop in Nateete which she set up in 2002. She has 2 school-going children. She is a hard-working lady  with a vision of expanding her retail business into a supermarket. She is using the loan proceeds to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and soap for her business. She intends to purchase a piece of land with the income she earns from the business.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour and soap

loans.name: Darios

texts.en:
Darios is a hog raiser residing in Villa Gamiao.  With his wife as his business partner, hog-raising has become their main source of livelihood. His desire of growing his business leads him to avail a loan of PHP 4,000.  He believes that this amount will generate increased income for his business.  With the income from the business, he can provide the growing needs of his family and hopefully give a better future for their children.  
 
He is married to Analyn and they are living happily together with their two children: Darlene Rose - 4 years old and Gian Carlo - 5 months old.

loans.use: Additional working capital for his hog-raising business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 42 years old. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children are currently in the basic school. Her husband is a palm nut and cocoa farmer. Mary lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

She produces and sells palm oil out of palm nuts. Mary procures palm fruits from nearby farms and adds to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Mary wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She aspires to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Edgar Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Edgard S. es originario del municipio de Nagarote donde se dedica a trabajar arduamente en su negocio de compra y venta de chatarras comprando todo tipo de producto de material de lata y aluminio para posteriormente venderlo a lugares donde son procesados.

Actualmente él ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de las chatarras y es por esta razón que muy confiadamente espera en Ceprodel porque es la única institución que puede ayudarle a salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Edgard S. comes from the municipality of Nagarote where he works arduously at his business buying and selling scrap. He buys products of tin and aluminum in order to resell them to be processed. He has now approached Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan to be used to buy scrap and because of this he is very confidently optimistic that Ceprodel will grant him the loan as it is the only institution which can help him build his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia
Lourdes es casada tiene 42 años, un hijo D. 25 años y otros D. 9 años que esta en la escuela particular.
Lourdes entro a trabajar en el Terminal pesquero con su tío por varios años, hasta que un día su tío la motivo a que comience su negocio propio, con los ahorros que tenía compro pescado y lo empezó a vender, los clientes le pedían que le llevara el pescado  hasta sus cevicheria, ahora ella distribuye 400 kilos D. pescado semanal    
Lourdes necesita un préstamo D. 2400 soles, para compra D. pescado al por mayor.
DesD. que esta en Finca, aprendió ha sacar sus cuentas, hacer balance todas las semanas, aprendió a separar la ganancia del capital.  
El sueño D. Lourdes es traer pescado del norte para vender en el terminar.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Sarita Colonia community bank. Lourdes is married and is aged 42. She has one son aged 25 and another aged 9 who is currently at a private school. Lourdes started working in the fishing harbour with her uncle and continued for several years, until the day that her uncle encouraged her to begin her own business with the savings that she had. So she bought fish and began to sell it: customers would ask her to bring the fish to their cervicheria (fish restaurants) so now she distributes 400 kilos of fish per week. Lourdes needs a loan of 2400 soles in order to buy fish wholesale. Since she's been part of Finca, she has learn how to keep her accounts and make them balance every week and has learnt to separate income from capital. Lourdes' dream is to bring fish from the north in order to sell it at the port.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lourdes needs a loan of 2400 soles in order to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson D. is a rice farmer. He is 55 years old and has 3 children. He wants to increase the size of his farm so that he will have a bigger harvest. Aside from rice, he also grows vegetables in his backyard. He raises native chickens and sells them for Php 120 each.

He wants a a loan for Php 8,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. He believes that by doing so, he can improve the yield of his farm. In that way, he believes that he could better support his family.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people to start and have their own business. They not only provide loans to their clients, they also offer training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 50 años de edad, vive con la madre de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales, 3 de ellos migraron a otras ciudades, y ahora se ha quedado con los 2 menores, quienes son el motivo de su trabajo. Se levanta muy temprano para rajar la leña con la que su esposa prepara los alimentos de día, en seguida acude a realizar los trabajos agrícolas, sembrando en mayor cantidad papa. En estos años de agricultor pudo aprender los gajes del oficio, por ello, en cada una de sus cosechas no pierde, sólo a veces aminora su producción debido a la tierra pobre, por falta de fertilizantes. Pero, para ello, Santiago se preocupa en abonar sus plantas las veces que se requiera, para lograr cosechas abundantes, ya que tiene 5 hectáreas de terreno, donde ahora tiene sembrada papa por cosechar, las cuales piensa negociar en los mercados de la ciudad de Lima para acumular mayores ganancias, y con ellas incrementar y variar sus cultivos con la siembra de arvejas, ya que la considera muy rentable también. Santiago está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza, por lo que tiene planes a futuro, de seguir incrementado con sus tierras. Durante tres prestamos consecutivos viene trabajando con MFP, y no ha tenido problemas de pago, de lo contrario, en alguna fechas ha precancelado su crédito, y para este ciclo se compromete a seguir trabajando del mismo modo. Los mil quinientos soles que viene solicitando los va a derivar a la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para que pueda abonar los meses necesarios para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Santiago is 50 years old. He lives with his mother and 5 children. Three of them migrated to other cities and now he is left with the 2 youngest. They are the reason for his work. He gets up very early to chop up the fire wood his wife uses to prepare their daily food and then he goes to do his farming chores. He mainly grows potatoes. He has learned the tricks of the trade in these years as a farmer so he doesn’t lose anything in any of his crops. Sometimes his production is reduced due to the poor soil from lack of fertilizers. Santiago takes care to fertilize his plants as many times as needed to obtain abundant harvests since he has 5 hectares of land. Now he has potatoes to harvest which he hopes to trade in the markets of Lima to gain a better profit. He wants to increase and vary his crops by planting peas which he thinks are very profitable also. Santiago is very happy with the work he does. He plans to continue growing with his land in the future. He has worked with MFP for three consecutive loans and has had no payment problems. On the contrary, he cancelled his loan ahead of some due dates and he is committed to continue working in the same way for this loan cycle. He will use the loan for one thousand five hundred PEN that he has applied for to purchase chemical fertilizers so he can fertilize during the months his crops need it.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu D. is from the village of Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old. Marichu is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns & operates a business providing photocopying services in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marichu joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP to be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marichu from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay school tuition and to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand photocopy business.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Cette dame a pour activité la vente de charbon de bois, elle exerce cette activité depuis 1998.  Elle vend du charbon en gros et en détail aux gens de son quartier. Etant la seule à vendre dans son quartier elle réalise donc beaucoup de recettes. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 24 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady sells charcoal. She has been in this business since 1998. She sells charcoal in bulk and by retailing to people in her neighborhood. Being the only seller in the neighborhood, she therefore makes much income. The stock that she currently has does not enable her meet the needs of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy 24 bags of charcoal and to cover transport cost of the goods. She is married and the mother of five children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase charcoal

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuân T. Đàm was born in 1970. She lives in Ngoc Loi, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two children. Her husband is a worker. Their first son is a carpenter near the house. Xuan has a cosmetic shop in the village. She sells cosmetics, souvenirs and hair fastener.

Xuân is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Xuan is now requesting a new loan of 4.142.000 VND (or 230 USD) which will be used to invest in her cosmetic shop.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Mắn Thị Nguyễn was born in 1954. She has two children. Every day, she buys chickens from farmers and resells them in the market. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy more chickens.

Miên Thị Hoàng was born in 1970.She has two children. She sells fresh beer at home. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy chairs and tables.

Thu Thị T. Phạm was born in 1970. She has two children. She breeds pigs and poultry. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy food for them.

Vân Thị Nguyễn was born in 1971. She has two children. She sells fish in the market. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy more fish for sale.

Hà Thị Nguyễn was born in 1977. She has two children. Her family has a carpentry workshop at home. She needs 4.578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to buy wood.

loans.use: To invest in her cosmetic shop

loans.name: Комил

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Каримов Комил- мужчина со средним образованием. Ему 38лет, он разведенный, живет с родителями. Занимается торговлей на Джабборрасуловском продуктовом рынке, продаёт продукты питания и игрушки для детей . Закупает свой товар в городе, где и узнал о нашей программе. Решил попробовать и ему понравилось. Получив свой первый кредит, он смог получить хорошую прибыль и теперь он кредитуется у нас по сей день . Свой  следующий кредит он снова хочет закупить большую партию товара  по оптовой цене.

loans.use: оптовая покупка продуктов

loans.name: Amanda Yanira

texts.es: Amanda Yanira M. R. reside en Tacuba en el departamento de Ahuachapán, tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo Carlos de 20 años edad quien trabaja como agricultor. El sueño de esta joven pareja es fortalecer los ingresos de su negocio,  es un molino que da sus servicios en la zona donde la afluencia de clientes es mucha ya que varios poseen negocios de tortillería o pupuserias entonces necesitan de un molino, Amanda pasa al frente de su negocio todo el día, posee tres años de experiencia. Ahora Amanda solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio, de esta manera podrá solidificarlo y obtener mayores ingresos que serán de gran utilidad para ellos y su bebé que viene en camino.
texts.en:
Amanda Yanira Monteroso R. lives in Tacuba in the district of Ahuachapán. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband Carlos, who is 20 years old and works as a farmer. This young couples' dream is to strengthen the income of their business. Currently, she provides milling services for her customers. She works in an area where many people have tortillerías and/or pupuserías, so they need someone to mill their grains. Amanda works every day and has three years of experience. Now, Amanda is asking for this loan so she can invest in her business so that she will be able to establish it better and obtain the higher profits that will be of great use both for them and their baby who is on its way.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 09 hijos y no pudo estudiar es iletrada, vive en la comunidad D. Copana.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es socia fundadora,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para aumentar a su capital  para la compra D. productos D. la región. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, detergentes, etc., la Sra. Narcisa también se dedica a la pesca artesanal.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, detergentes, etc.,

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: VIRGEN D. CHAPI D. YANACOTO

Sus once integrantes son personas trabajadoras que debido a diferentes circunstancias buscaron ganarse la vida honradamente; es así que trabajan vendiendo: comidas, dulces, golosinas, manualidades u otros. Socios que participan en EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD más D. tres años y medio. Los créditos que se les brindan ayudan mucho en los hogares D. estas personas; tal son los casos D.:

Bacilia F. Calderón es vendedora D. pescado y frutas desD. hace 25 años, la responsabilidad como madre D. mantener a cuatro hijos pequeños la obligó a trabajar D. esta manera, después del abandono D. su esposo; tuvo que ingeniarse a vender estos productos en las calles; al principio los ingresos eran pocos debido a que no era muy conocida por los consumidores; teniendo que prestar servicio D. cocinera en comedores populares. Ésta llegó a captar clientes con el tiempo, es así que sus ganancias eran mayores, fue entonces la perseverancia D. Bacilia que hizo crecer su negocio. Sacó adelante a su familia e hizo que sus hijos estudien en la escuela, vestirlos y alimentarlos. Al obtener el primer crédito Bacilia con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD compró utensilios y gaseosas para expender ceviche los fines D. semana, días que hay mayor demanda D. ventas por los eventos deportivos que se realizan en la zona que resiD.. Hace dos años cambió las esteras D. su casa por un pequeño módulo D. madera con el propósito D. darles comodidad D. su familia, todo ello lo obtuvo D. los ingresos D. su negocio. El préstamo reciente lo invertirá en platos, verduras, carne D. carnero para la preparación D. caldo D. mote (plato típico D. la sierra peruana) así podrá seguir educando a su último hijo D. nueve años. 

Carmen Pérez Bendezú tiene 34 años en edad, es la tesorera del grupo se encarga que todos los socios cumplan con los pagos D. los préstamos.
Empieza a trabajar limpiando cuartos en club campestres cuando su niño mayor tenía un año D. edad, madre soltera en ese entonces. Ahorró un pequeño dinero invirtiéndolo en abarrotes, éstos eran vendidos en un espacio D. su casa, luego compró dos cajas D. cervezas con las ganancias D. los abarrotes, este último le resultó rentable; pues dejaba más ganancias, ingresos que cubrieron gastos D. la familia, como la educación a sus dos hijos D. catorce y cinco años, así mismo mejorar su casita y adquirir electrodomésticos. Necesita el capital para invertir en gaseosas.

Ana Rodríguez G., presidenta D. esta alcancía comunal, aprendió hacer manualidades cuando estudiaba en la secundaria, le interesó tanto que llegó a capacitarse más en este tema; aprovechó su habilidad que tiene en sus manos para hacer diversidad D. muñequitos, animalitos, gorritos, carteritas hechos en material corrospún y tela polar, sus trabajos los ofrece a sus amistades y en colegios para ambientar las aulas D. los niños. Son tan lindos que obtuvo mayor demanda en sus clientes, es así que con el primer crédito otorgado invirtió en corrospún, silicona, plumones indelebles, algodón sintético para la elaboración D. Santa Claus, renos, arbolitos, duendecitos; pues era época naviD.ña. Estas ventas han permitido a Ana compartir los gastos con su esposo en el hogar; porque éste no tiene un trabajo estable. En el mes D. marzo consiguió la concesión D. un colegio primario, allí venD. sándwiches, chupetes D. fruta, golosinas y comida. Necesita el capital para implementar más su negocio reciente y seguir educando a sus dos hijas en colegios particulares; su objetivo es darles una vida sosegada.
texts.en:
The eleven members of the Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto group are hardworking people that, owing to different circumstances, are looking to improve their lives honorably. They are engaged in the sale of: food, sweets, candy, handicrafts, and other items. The members have participated in EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for over 3 and a half years. The loans that they have been provided with have helped them very much. Here are some of their stories: Bacilia F. Calderón has sold fish and fruit for 25 years. After her husband abandoned her, she had to work in this manner to support her four small children. She had to figure out how to sell these products in the street. At first the income was low, because she was not well-known by her customers, so she had to work as a cook in a communal kitchen. She came to win customers over time, so that her earnings increased; the perseverance of Bacilia maD. the business grow. In this way she moved her family forward, making sure that her children would study in school, and be well-dressed and fed. The first loan that Bacilia received from EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD was used to buy utensils and drinks to sell ceviche on the weekends, days that are the best for sales due to the sporting events that take place in the area where she resides. Two years ago she changed the straw mats in her home to wood to make her family more comfortable, and this was all done with income from her business. The current loan will be used to purchase plates, vegetables, and meat for the preparation of caldo D. mote (a typical dish of the Peruvian mountains). This way she will continue to educate her youngest child who is 9 years old. Carmen Pérez Bendezú is the treasurer of the group. She is in charge of making sure that all the members make their payments on their loans. Carmen began cleaning rooms in a golf club when her oldest child was a year old. She was a single mother at the time. She saved a little money and invested in groceries which she sold from a space in her house. Later she bought two crates of beer with the earnings from her groceries, and this transaction was profitable. This created more earnings, income that covered her family expenses, such as education for her two children of fourteen and five years. In addition, she was able to improve her house and purchase domestic appliances. She needs capital to invest in soft drinks. Ana Rodríguez G., president of the communal bank, learned how to make handicrafts when she was still in school. This interested her so much that she obtained more training in this area, taking advantage of her talent in handicrafts to make small dolls, animals, caps, and handbags from corrospun (sheets of plastic) and polartec fabric. She offers her products to her friends and to the schools to decorate the classrooms of the children. Her products are so cute that she has obtained an increasing demand from her customers. She used her first loan to purchase corrospun, silicone, indelible markers, and synthetic cotton to make a Santa Claus, reindeer, little trees, and elves at Christmastime. These sales have allowed Ana to share the household expenses with her husband, because he does not have a steady job. In the month of March, he secured the concession of a primary school. There he sells sandwiches, fruit popsicles, candy and food. She needs capital to establish this new business and to continue to educate their two children in private schools; their objective is to give them a peaceful life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Kenjaboy

texts.en: T. Kenjaboy is from the city of Khujand, Tajikistan. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the community. He is the father of two children who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. It’s important to note that Kenjaboy is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. It’s for this reason that he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some young cattle to help him increase his income. With your help, Kenjaboy will be able to make his business succeed and support his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy some calves to increase his income

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros S. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Milagros is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Milagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilú es una joven madre que vive con su pareja y su bebé. Anteriormente de dedicaba netamente al cultivo de café y plátanos con el apoyo de sus padres, pero desde que tuvo su bebé, su esposo no quiere que trabaje, por lo menos hasta que crezca su pequeño. Por ello, decidieron tener un negocio de la venta de abarrotes, y desde el año pasado se dedica a su tienda. Marilú está muy contenta con su negocio, ya que se distrae mucho con la gente, solo que a veces se incomoda de no tener la suficiente mercadería para sus clientes. Su deseo a futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo se mostró muy responsable y entregada a las labores de su banco comunal y para este ciclo promete seguir haciéndolo así. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de comestibles de primera necesidad para su bodega, así como también, fertilizantes para los cultivos de su esposo.
texts.en:
Marilú is a young mother who lives with her common law partner and her baby. She previously devoted herself to growing coffee and bananas with the support of her parents. After she had her baby, her husband did not want her to work until their child grew a little older. For this reason, they decided to start a business selling groceries. A year has passed since they opened their store. Marilú is very happy with her business since it attracts many people. Sometimes she gets uncomfortable whenever she does not have enough merchandise for her customers. Her desire for the future is to grow her business so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her second loan with MFP. All this time, Marilú has been very responsible and dedicated to the work of her Communal Bank. She renews her commitment for this loan cycle. The money she requested will be used to purchase grocery staples for her store as well as fertilizers for her husband’s crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her store & fertilizers for her husband's crops

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha C. is the group leader of four members who all live in Damnak village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Choem Sophara, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chantha C. is 19 years old and the mother of a child who is just four months old.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to resell

loans.name: Abd Al Halim

texts.en:
Abd A. Halim, 49, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Abd A. Halim has been working as a car painter since 1993. Abd A. Halim is speciA. in his work because of his clean and clear work. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase some painting tools for his work. 

This is the first time that Abd A. Halim has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy merchandise and supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, de 26 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobre salir en la vida.
En la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Juliaca se encuentra el puesto de anticuchos (brochetas) de Sandra, todas las noches sale con su carrito a vender su delicioso platillo a todas las personas que desean saborearlos en las frías noches juliaqueñas. Ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva por eso siempre convence a sus clientes de comerse más de un solo anticucho.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer hasta altas horas de la noche en la calle, ya que tiene que acabar con todo lo que preparó en el día. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener un local donde pueda vender sus anticuchos con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Sandra con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo; en su banco comunal es una de las socias más participativas y responsables. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carne para elaborar más anticuchos al día.
texts.en:
Sandra, 26, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her two beloved children. She is prepared to work very hard in order to succeed in life. You can find Sandra’s kebob stand in the Plaza de Armas in the city of Juliaca. Every night she leaves with her cart to sell her delicious dish to everyone who wants to savor them on the cold Juliacan nights. She is a very persuasive seller, and she always convinces her customers to buy more than one kebab. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. She has been doing this activity for four years. The most difficult part is having to stay on the street until late at night because she has to exhaust all that she made for the day. In time, she hopes to have a location where she can sell her kebabs more peacefully. This is Sandra’s first loan with MFP. She is happy to have the opportunity of the loan, and she expects to be able to pay it on time. She participates a lot in her communal bank, and she is a very responsible member. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is requesting to buy more meat to make more kebabs each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Ilkham

texts.en: Ilkham H. is married and has a child. He was born in 1975. H.'s family lives in Fuzuli region. IIkham has been in this business for 10 years. Now Ilkham H. needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand the store to improve his business.

loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Chinwe

texts.en: Chinwe is 38 years-old and married with five children. Her youngest child is eight years old. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports the home. She sells used sarongs and lace at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years. Chinwe hopes to expand her business with the Kiva loan. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to enable her to purchase more used sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal denominado “Las Divinas” esta representada por la señora Marina y conformado D. 13 socios D. los cuales 11 son mujeres y 2 son varones. La señora Marina es viuda con dos niños en edad escolar que son su razón para trabajar, ella se dedica al comercio D.  venta artículos D. temporada que distribuye a domicilios, mercados y en algunos casos a oficinas, ella vive en una casa en anticrítico por lo que su mas granD. expectativa D. crecimiento es poder darles un hogar fijo a sus hijos. Las demás socias se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta D. ropas, verduras carne, queso, productos D. limpieza, vélelas, material D. óptica, material D. escritorio y otros. En su mayoría radican en la misma zona D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Dentro del mercado interno D. la ciudad cualquier negocios es muy competitivo como al igual que en todo el país por ello los socios buscan otras estrategias D. venta D. sus productos como el tener puestos en todas las ferias zonales posibles y un puesto fijo en el mercado central, una gran mayoría D. las socias solo generan ingresos para el sustento D. sus familias por lo que el capital brindado les sirve para generar un capital D. trabajo y una tasa D. ahorro para un futuro ya que una mayoría D. las socias son madres que se baten solas. El crédito que solicitaron será utilizado para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo y negocios, como compra D. mercadería, material, herramientas e insumos. El grupo esta emprendiendo su séptimo ciclo  con la institución por lo que tienen amplias expectativas D. crecimiento porque cuentan con el apoyo económico D. la Fundación Agrocapita.
texts.en:
The “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) communal bank is represented by Marina; it is maD. up of 13 members: 11 women and 2 men. Marina is a widow and has two, school-age children, who are her reason to work. She sells seasonal items door-to-door, in the markets and, in some cases, in offices. She lives in a house under the anticretico modality. (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you). Her greatest expectation is to grow and be able to proviD. her children with a stable home. The other members are involved in a variety of commercial activities such as: clothing sales, vegetable and meat sales, cheese sales, cleaning supplies sales, candle-making, optician supplies, office supplies, and others. For the most part, they all live in the same area of the city of El Alto. Within the city’s internal marketplace, any business faces a lot of competition, as is true for the rest of the country. For this reason, the members look for other sales strategies to move their product. For example: they set up sales stands in as many markets as possible plus a fixed stand in the central market. The vast majority of members earn just enough to support their families so the capital offered helps them generate working capital and a savings rate for a future; most of the members are single mothers who must fend for themselves. The loan will be used to increase their working capital and business. They will buy merchandise, materials, supplies, tools and ingredients. The group is in its 7th loan with the institution so they have wiD. expectations for growth because they can count on support from Fundación Agrocapita.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Heraclio

texts.es:
Heraclio tiene 39 años, es soltero y tiene 5 hijos. Reside en una comunidad de la selva central peruana llamada “Zorza”, donde tienen su techo propio.

Desde hace varios años tenía en mente en tener su propio negocio, donde se especializara en desarrollar productos para satisfacer a los comerciantes mayoristas. Es por ello que en la actualidad se dedica a la actividad agrícola, cultiva la hoja de coca y cacao, y cuenta con ayudantes con quienes trabajan en sus tierras arduamente. En su negocio le va muy bien, ya que con las ganancias obtenidas puede llevar felicidad a su familia y cumplir con los pagos a sus peones. Generalmente sus productos los vende a los centros de acopio en una localidad aledaña. Su plan a futuro es seguir apostando por este negocio, adquiriendo más terrenos vírgenes para que pueda  producir en mayor cantidad.

Este es su decimo sexto préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos y además se siente agradecido con su banco comunal, ya que hacen un trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará insumos y abono para rehabilitar y renovar algunas tierras afectadas que posee, para que en el futuro sean muy fértiles.
texts.en:
Heraclio is 39, single, and has five children. He lives in a community called Zorza, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. The roof over their heads belongs to him. For several years he has had it in his mind to have his own business. He would specialize in the development of products to satisfy the wholesale merchants. That is why he currently works in agriculture. He grows coca and cacao leaves. He has helpers with whom he works the land arduously. His business is going very well for him. With the earnings he gets he is able to make his family happy and pay the workers. He generally sells his products in centers where people gather in areas nearby. His plan for the future is to keep counting on this business and getting more virgin land to be able to produce in greater quantity. This is his 16th loan with MFP. He promises to make his payments punctually. He is grateful to his communal bank because they work as a team. He will use the money he is requesting to buy supplies and fertilizer for some of his land that needs to be restored and renovated. He will do this so that in the future they will be more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is from the town of Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 50 years old and single. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing shirt-making services to local community members. Emma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Emma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Emma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Timagos

texts.en:
Timagos E. is from the village of Baybay ,Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 53 years-old. Timagos is a widow with four adult children. To make a living, Timagos owns and operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Timagos has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Timagos joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Timagos is requesting a first loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurantShe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks.

loans.name: Xalid

texts.en: Xalid M. was born in 1974. He is married and has 5 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli, in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, now settled in the Absheron region. He has been in this business for 10 years. He now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy home products to sell to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel B. B. tiene 24 años, y vive con sus padres y su hijo Diego en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
María es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 
Se dedica al comercio. Compra y vende sus productos en Bucay cada fin de mes. Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio. Su sueño seria de tener su proprio negocio. Ahorra el desafío que enfrenta es la competencia.
Le gusta pasar junto con su familia. Su mama también solicita un crédito para su negocio.



Maria Isabel is 24 years old and lives with her parents and her son Diego in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra).
Maria Isabel is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops
She dedicates herself to commerce. She purchases and sells her products at the end of the month in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her dream would be to have her own shop. The main challenge she faces today is competition.
She likes to spend time with her family. Her mother is also asking for a loan for her own business.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 24 years old and lives with her parents and her son Diego in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra). Maria Isabel is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops She dedicates herself to commerce. She purchases and sells her products at the end of the month in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her dream would be to have her own shop. The main challenge she faces today is competition. She likes to spend time with her family. Her mother is also asking for a loan for her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao P. is 61 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she is also a pig breeder at home and is able to earn a small income to add to her farm revenue to support her family.

To support both these businesses, Mrs. Mao P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for her pig breeding business, and to buy fertilizer and to pay a laborer to plow her farm.

Mrs. Mao P. is widow with one child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed and to buy fertilizer and pay a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Masinadyahon, Brgy. Maquiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living as a coconut grinder and repair & maintenance shop owner.  Her husband Erasmo, who is 70 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  He also helps his wife.  They have eight children who are 27 to 37 years old. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500.  

This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to buy welding rods and other stock for her shop so she could continue to save up for future home repairs and education.  Erlinda B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

---------------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona M. D. G. D. 51 años D. edad, resiD. en San Matías ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como  motorista del transporte público y junto a su nuera y un nieto. Simona posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y sus familia, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder algunas ventas, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio.
