Simona es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante poder aportar a su casa y D. esta forma poder vivir D. una manera tranquila en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para ella, su esposo.
texts.en:
Simona M. D. G. is 51 years old and resides in San Matías, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as a public transportation driver, and their daughter-in-law and grandson. Simona has a store in her home where she sells perishable products. This business enables her to have everything necessary for her home and her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she will have the required funds to stock her business with everything she needs to proviD. better service to her customers. On many occasions she has lost sales because she did not have the products they requested. These circumstances are what motivated her to change, make improvements, and move forward with her business.

Simona is a visionary woman who always wants to succeed and grow day after day for her own benefit and that of her family. It is very important for her to be able to support her household and live peacefully so that she and her husband have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

location.town: San Matías,  departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Laxmi Gautam. She is married and has no children. In 2010, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase chicks. In the future, Laxmi plans to earn her own livelihood. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: http://www.kiva.org/partners/62

loans.use: Purchase chicks

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Colera del distrito de Tambogrande, una distrito agrícola caracterizado por producir principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde ha sembrado mango y limón, actualmente el limón se encuentra en producción, las frutas que cosecha las ofrece en venta a las fábricas procesadoras de la zona, el depende de estas actividades para sostener la economía de su familia, por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para poder mantenerse en el negocio.

Santos desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales pueda brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena cosecha, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y entregado a los suyos, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old, married, and lives with his 3 children in Colera, a district of Tambogrando which is an agricultural district known for producing primarily fruits for export. It is part of the Piura providence located within the region of the same name which is more than 3 hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He performs agricultural labor. He has some land where he has planted mangos and lemons, the lemons are currently in production. Harvested fruits are sold to area processing plants, activities that he depends on to maintain his household. He has always given the best of himself to uphold his business. Santos would like to purchase fertilizers and pesticides which will allow him to upkeep his crops and gurantee himself a good harvest. To achieve his objective he has requested for the first time, a loan of 1000 PEN ($375 USD) to Edpyme Alternativa. Santos is the father of a hard working family who are dedicated to helping their own. He longs to be able to offer his family a better quality of life. People who know him in the area where he lives have great respect and trust towards him.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to upkeep his mango and lemon crops.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica tiene 27 años de edad, inició su negocio de salón de belleza hace ya un año, ya que ella aprendió este negocio siendo practicante en un salón de belleza en lima, luego paso a ser asistente donde pudo aprender mas sobre el negocio, actualmente trabaja de forma independiente en un local alquilado, Angelica sueña con implementar su negocio para así poder tener mayores ingresos que le permitan sustentar a su familia ya que ella tiene un hijo aún pequeño, ella desea invertir el crédito en la compra de muebles para su local y asi poder tener mayor número de clientes, se le ofrece el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Angelica, 27, started her beauty salon business a year ago. She learned the business working at a salon in Lima where she eventually become an assistant. She works independently in a space that she rents and now she dreams of setting up her own shop so that can increase her income. She has a young son who she wants to better support. She will use the loan to buy furniture for the space she rents and, in turn, increase the number of clients that she brings in. The loan was extended after considering Angelica's ability to repay it and the good references received for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for salon business.

loans.name: Juana Celia

texts.es: Juana Celia L. D. M. es una señora muy responsable, la cual siempre ha deseado darle todo lo mejor a su familia, ella resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, junto a su esposo, un señor muy trabajador, y junto a sus dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Juana posee un pequeño bazar en su casa D. habitación, en el cual comercializa productos varios como: cremas para el cabello y el cuerpo, shampoo, acondicionadores, desodorantes, cosméticos y muchos otros productos más los cuales poseen gran demanda en el lugar tanto para uso personal como para regalar en diferentes ocasiones. DesD. hace 10 que ella posee este negocio lo que le ha permitido ser muy conocida en la zona, por lo que posee muchas clientes las cuales disfrutan D. ir a comprar a su negocio. Juana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, compran D. los productos que ya posee y D. esta misma forma comprar ropa, sandalias, y otros tipos D. accesorios los cuales son muy aptos para regalar.
texts.en:
Juana Celia L. D. M. is a responsible woman who always wants to proviD. the best for her family. She resides in the town of Soyapango with her husband, a hardworking gentleman, and their two children who are in school. Juana has a small bazaar in her home where she sells various products such as hair and body crèmes, shampoos, conditioners, deodorants, cosmetics, and many other items that are in great demand for both personal use and to give as presents for different occasions.

Juana has been in business for ten years and has become well-known in the area. As a result, she has many customers who enjoy shopping at her business. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business. Juana will buy products she already sells as well as clothing, sandals, and other types of accessories that are suitable to buy as gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toiletries & gift merchandise

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto A. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Roberto is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Roberto owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roberto has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 40,000 during harvest season. Roberto said that his earnings in the activities help him a lot in supporting the educational needs of his children.

In 2009, Roberto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Roberto is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase manure and pesticides. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Roberto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase manure and pesticides

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad A. is 48 years old, married and runs his own business. He operates a dealer center for selling mobile Sim cards and cards to replenish the phone balance.
Elshad tries to use up-to-date technologies in his work so that he can satisfy his customers' demands and requirements. He is requesting a loan of 800 AZN to purchase Sim cards and to improve his business place. This is Elshad's second loan and he thanks everyone for their support. He promises not to let them down and to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase Sim cards

loans.name: Zarina Majeed Ahmad Khan's Group

texts.en:
Zarina M. A. K. is a widow who lost her husband to a heart attack a few years ago. She is a resident of Riwind that is famous for its dairy industry in Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter and has been living with them in a two-room brick house for the last 25 years.

Zarina couldn’t educate her children due to unfavorable circumstances, and they had to start working at an early age to financially help support the family. Her eldest and youngest sons have a video game shop, while her second son works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her daughter is sixteen years old and is studying at the tenth class level.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her sons’ video game shop. They will invest the loan in purchasing more video games. Their shop is famous in surrounding areas, and their clientele base is young kids. They have been doing this business for over ten years, and Zarina is very confident that through this investment her sons will successfully be able to introduce new and interesting games to their customers and double their income in size.

Zarina is a regular Asasah borrower, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan periods, she was a responsible client who paid her duties responsibly.

In the photo, the woman who holds a book (called an “Asasah Passbook”) in her hands is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy video games for her sons' shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana M. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 44 years old. Juana is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Juana owns and operates a transportation business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community.  Juana has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Juana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the motorcycle. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Juana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the motorcycle used in her transport business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda Q. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 59 years old. Merlinda is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business buying and selling clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Khiev's Group

texts.en:
Eleven members form this  village loan, and they are located in Preaek Dach village in Kandal province. This village loan selected, Mr. Khiev Y., 68 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this village hope to increase their income with these loans. 

Mr. Khiev Y. and his wife, Mrs. Klork Yory, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. With this farming, they still earn little income to support the family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Khiev Y. would like to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat for fishing. 

They have two children: one is a blacksmith, and one is a farmer who supports the parents' farming.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for fishing.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and takes care of four children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama sells cooked rice and serves it with tomato sauce at Abura. She . Her business just started some months ago. She wants to expand the business with the loan she hopes to get. Ama will use the loan to buy more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale.  She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more rice and other ingredients to cook for sale.
